AD.speaker: Shadowheart
AD.context: NodeContext: Unconscious groans of pain and shock

session_synopses.AD: Shadowheart groans and moans while unconscious. This occurs immediately after the nautiloid crash, with the player finding her lying on the ground amongst the debris.

session_synopses.Recruitment_AD: As you walk down the road, Astarion calls out to you. He's got something dangerous trapped and needs your help to finish it off.

node_data.text: CinematicNodeContext: ~Nautiloid arrives in Faerun
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Nautiloid arrives in Faerun

node_data.context:
CinematicNodeContext: [Player] knocked out of hull by console
Mind Flayer Pilot reacts to player falling out of ship
[Player] falls unconscious from the nautiloid
[Player] wakes mid fall
[Player] begins slowing descent
[Player] crashes on beach

Dead.speaker: Narrator
Dead.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

session_synopses.Dead: You speak with the dead soul of a fisherman, who hurried to the crash site when he saw your ship fall from the sky. At the site he saw a mindflayer, disguised as a beautiful woman, and was killed by Intellect Devourers (brains).

PAD_FightingFishers.speaker: Player
PAD_FightingFishers.text: Must have been fishing when these monsters came. Bad luck.

PAD_FightingFishers.speaker: Player
PAD_FightingFishers.text: Hm. Wouldn't wish that fate on anyone.

PAD_Jetty.speaker: Player
PAD_Jetty.text: Fresh water. There must be a settlement somewhere nearby.

PAD_Jetty.speaker: Player
PAD_Jetty.text: Let's hope the locals are friendly.

session_synopses.PAD_FightingFishers: Player clicked on a fisher's corpse on the beach that's near an intellect devourer's corpse, and remarks they must have put up a fight.
session_synopses.PAD_Jetty: Player comes near the end of a jetty that looks over the Chiontar.

Dead.speaker: Narrator
Dead.context: NodeContext: "elicited" = "el-iss-it-ed": a soft C, not a hard one.

session_synopses.Dead: You speak with the dead soul of a fisherman, who tells you where you are: on a river that flows to Baldur's Gate. However, you're probably too far away to get there before the worm in your brain transforms you into a mindflayer.

AD_KilledMindflayer.speaker: Player
AD_KilledMindflayer.text: Monster. Death is too good for it.

session_synopses.AD_KilledMindflayer: The party comments after killing the mind flayer that lay dying in the wreckage.

AD_Rock.speaker: Player
AD_Rock.text: Deep grooves in the mud around that rock.

session_synopses.AD_Rock: A player passes by a hidden Harper cache. If they pass a Perception check, they discover the rock hiding the cache. Otherwise, they just comment on the nearby ocean view.

PAD_ShadowheartComment.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_ShadowheartComment.text: Those people... the mind flayer made them its puppets.

session_synopses.PAD_ShadowheartComment: Shadowheart realises that some people encountered near the nautiloid crash are being enthralled by an injured mind flayer and have no control over their actions.

AD.speaker: Shadowheart
AD.text: They can't hold forever. Come on!

session_synopses.AD: Utterances by Shadowheart as she tries to bash through a locked door leading into an ancient chapel.

PAD_RichSarcophagus.speaker: Narrator
PAD_RichSarcophagus.text: *Here lies the Guardian of Tombs. Through knowledge comes atonement.*
PAD_RichSarcophagus.context: NodeContext: Reading the inscription on a sarcophagus.

AD_FL1Mural.speaker: Narrator
AD_FL1Mural.context: NodeContext: Narrator describes a plaque written in a dead language

AD_FL1Mural.speaker: Player
AD_FL1Mural.text: A dead tongue. Whoever worshipped here must be long gone.

AD_TrappedTomb.speaker: Narrator
AD_TrappedTomb.text: *The text on the plaque is a mystery to you.*
AD_TrappedTomb.context: NodeContext: Commenting on a plaque written in an unknown language.

session_synopses.PAD_RichSarcophagus: Player reads the inscription on a plaque in an abandoned chapel dedicated to the god Jergal.
session_synopses.AD_FL1Mural: The player reads a plaque attached to a statue of Selune, the moon goddess. Shadowheart casually mocks it.
session_synopses.AD_TrappedTomb: The player tries to read a bronze plaque in a tomb.

session_synopses.VB_Trap: You click on a broken trap on the ground and find it useless.

VB_LowerFloor_1.speaker: Player
VB_LowerFloor_1.text: This place wasn't built for the living.
VB_LowerFloor_1.context: NodeContext: Karlach: She's enjoying exploring here.

PAD_SuccessfulGraverobbing.speaker: Player
PAD_SuccessfulGraverobbing.text: I pity anyone caught by those things. We were lucky to get out with the loot.

VB_SideChamber_1.speaker: Player
VB_SideChamber_1.text: Looks like someone wanted to bury their secrets.

AD_BanditGuardWarning.speaker: Andorn
AD_BanditGuardWarning.context: NodeContext: He's in an abandoned chapel, looting, and has just spotted the players. He calls to his friends for help and enters combat

AD_JergalInsideTomb.speaker: Richly Adorned Sarcophagus
AD_JergalInsideTomb.text: Dost thou think to rush fate? See to the dead first.

AD_BanditSanctumSearching.speaker: Barton
AD_BanditSanctumSearching.text: At least there's no skeletons this time.
AD_BanditSanctumSearching.context: NodeContext: Referring to his surroundings in an abandoned chapel. He's searching for a way to open the crypt, or some treasure. Muttering to himself... the last time he tried something like this, skeletons attacked him.

AD_BanditLockpickerUnlocked.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerUnlocked.context: NodeContext: spotted the player - shouting to alert her companions as she becomes hostile

PAD_GasPit.speaker: Player
PAD_GasPit.text: I can't see any way to disarm it.

AD_BanditCrashBanter.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditCrashBanter.text: Gods, there's something moving in there!
AD_BanditCrashBanter.context: NodeContext: a roof in the dungeon they're exploring just collapsed - they're getting into position to investigate/ambush anyone involved and are scared

AD_BanditCrashBanter.speaker: Andorn
AD_BanditCrashBanter.text: Be ready for anything. I told you this wouldn't be easy...
AD_BanditCrashBanter.context: NodeContext: these characters are robbing an abandoned chapel and the roof in one of the rooms just collapsed. They don't know what's happening and are VERY twitchy. The roof in one of the rooms just collapsed, and they're reacting to the sound. This guy is the pragmatic one of the bandit group - robbing crypts is dangerous work, and he knows it. Doesn't necessarily like it though

VB_Skeleton_1.speaker: Player
VB_Skeleton_1.text: Armed scribes - but no sign of a struggle.

AD_BanditGuardCallHelp.speaker: Andorn
AD_BanditGuardCallHelp.context: NodeContext: alarmed - he's a tomb-robber in an abandoned chapel, and the players just surprised him. He's calling his friends to help as combat begins

AD_BanditLockpickerSpotting.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerSpotting.text: How'd you get past Andorn? Back off!
AD_BanditLockpickerSpotting.context: NodeContext: She was trying to pick a lock in an abandoned chapel and is surprised to see the players who have either killed or sneaked past her friend 'Andorn'. She's entering combat.

AD_BanditGuardSurprised.speaker: Andorn
AD_BanditGuardSurprised.context: NodeContext: he's part of a crew looting an abandoned chapel - the player lied to him, convincing him they were part of his team, and now he's seen them and realises he's been tricked. Calls for help as he backs away, in combat

VB_Artefact_1.speaker: Player
VB_Artefact_1.text: A lot of effort to hide one sarcophagus.
VB_Artefact_1.context: NodeContext: Said with reverence and a touch of fear.

VB_Sanctum_1.speaker: Player
VB_Sanctum_1.text: No more prayers... only silence and dust.
VB_Sanctum_1.context: NodeContext: player reflects on an the abandoned inner sanctum of a long-abandoned chapel. Possibly quietly reverential; it's a holy place

AD_UpDownDoorInvestigation.speaker: Player
AD_UpDownDoorInvestigation.text: No lock, no handle. How does it open?
AD_UpDownDoorInvestigation.context: NodeContext: found a door without a lock or handle

PAD_FoundCoins.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundCoins.text: A strange coin. I wonder what it's worth.

AD_BanditLockpickerLockpicking.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerLockpicking.text: Not even sure this is a door.
AD_BanditLockpickerLockpicking.context: NodeContext: Confused - trying to unlock a door in an abandoned chapel that doesn't actually have a lock. She's struggling and muttering to herself

VB_Skeleton_2.speaker: Player
VB_Skeleton_2.text: Armed scribes - but no sign of a struggle.

VB_Skeleton_2.speaker: Player
VB_Skeleton_2.text: I wonder what was so subversive about their words that they commanded protection.
VB_Skeleton_2.context: NodeContext: player reacts to companion commenting that skeletons in an abandoned chapel appear to have died without a fight. Slightly unnerved

AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert.text: Well it is a crypt, ain't it? Rot's to be expected.
AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert.context: NodeContext: Cracking a bad joke during a tense moment

AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert.speaker: Haseid
AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert.text: Shut it. This is no time for joking around.

Jergal.text: CinematicNodeContext: Jergal climbing out of his tomb and standing up before the player
Jergal.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jergal climbing out of his tomb and standing up before the player

Jergal.speaker: Withers
Jergal.text: So he has spoken, and so thou standest before me. Right as always.

Jergal.speaker: Withers
Jergal.text: What a curious way to awaken.

Jergal.speaker: Withers
Jergal.text: Now I have a question for thee: what is the worth of a single mortal's life?

Jergal.speaker: Player
Jergal.text: A peaceful undead. Interesting. Why aren't you attacking me?

Jergal.speaker: Withers
Jergal.text: Dull your weapons as you wish.

AD_BanditLockpickerOpenDoor.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerOpenDoor.text: It's... open? Could've sworn I hadn't cracked it.

VB_TakingTheArtefact_1.speaker: Player
VB_TakingTheArtefact_1.text: Oh, hells. Something just woke up...
VB_TakingTheArtefact_1.context: NodeContext: just picked up an artefact and heard something awakening in response down in a dungeon - afraid, but with resolve

AD_BanditLockpickerWander.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerWander.text: You killed my friend. Answer to me. Now!
AD_BanditLockpickerWander.context: NodeContext: Searching. Calling out angrily to whoever killed her comrade.

AD_BanditLockpickerSurprised.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerSurprised.text: Hells! Something's coming out of the crypt!
AD_BanditLockpickerSurprised.context: NodeContext: Terrified - we just emerged from a seemingly abandoned crypt she was trying to break into

PAD_JergalStatueReaction.speaker: Player
PAD_JergalStatueReaction.text: That statue. It seems they worshipped some kind of... scholar?

VB_Sanctum_2_WithMysticShadowheart.speaker: Player
VB_Sanctum_2_WithMysticShadowheart.text: I feel a presence here - a power. The patron god of this place?
VB_Sanctum_2_WithMysticShadowheart.context: NodeContext: Player is stepping into an abandoned chapel and still feels the holy presence of the goddess Selune (seh-LOON-eh). She is a tranquil, protective deity.

VB_Sanctum_2_WithMysticShadowheart.speaker: Shadowheart
VB_Sanctum_2_WithMysticShadowheart.text: Whoever that even is. No intact symbols here, no dedications - nothing.
VB_Sanctum_2_WithMysticShadowheart.context: NodeContext: Mocking her companion's pious reference to the moon goddess, of whom she is no fan.

AD_BanditSanctumSpotting.speaker: Barton
AD_BanditSanctumSpotting.text: Clear off - we got here first!
AD_BanditSanctumSpotting.context: NodeContext: seeing a threat, preparing to attack

session_synopses.VB_LowerFloor_1: This triggers has the player unlocks a door and enters a secret and, until now, hidden crypt.
session_synopses.PAD_SuccessfulGraverobbing: Voicebark dialog after robbing the amulet from Jergal chapel, about whether it was right to loot the place. Its guardians might have been killed by the player. Or the guardians might have engaged the player, but they found a way to get out without killing them all, by fleeing or distracting them. Or the player might have sneakily escape the guardians.This is played on the party after they leave an area, so Speakers are roughly interchangeable here, the undertaking is assumed to be a party effort.
session_synopses.VB_SideChamber_1: VB upon noticing the book chained and padlocked to the table in the side room.
session_synopses.AD_BanditGuardWarning: A bandit who is part of a crew looting an abandoned chapel - at this point, he's seen the players entering the chapel - 'the uninvited guests' - and thinks they're after the same loot as his crew. He's calling his friends to help.
session_synopses.AD_JergalInsideTomb: Jergal reacts to a player touching his sarcophagus when his servants (the skeletal clerics) have not yet been killed.
session_synopses.AD_BanditSanctumSearching: A bandit in an abandoned chapel who is searching around an altar for a way to open a passage into the crypt, which is in the corridor outside. He's frustrated, twitchy and nervous. This place is creepy.
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerUnlocked: A bandit in an abandoned chapel calls to her companions for help upon spotting the player
session_synopses.PAD_GasPit: Player characters comment when the player interacts with a trap that has been spotted but not yet triggered
session_synopses.AD_BanditCrashBanter: A group of bandits in an abandoned chapel - they're hoping to loot the place and are a little on edge. Abandoned chapels often have traps or undead guardians. they're startled by a loud noise from one of the side-chambers. The roof just caved in, and the bandit are trying to figure out a plan of action. What they don't know is that the roof collapse was caused by the players who just broke in.
session_synopses.VB_Skeleton_1: Player characters are commenting on skeletons in a chapel. Even though the corpses look like they are scribes, they are all armed.
session_synopses.AD_BanditGuardCallHelp: One of a group of bandits looting an abandoned chapel. He's just been surprised by the players who have infiltrated the same chapel. He's twitchy and on edge, and now he's in a fight and needs his friends.
session_synopses.PAD_ButtonBlocked: The player has pressed a button only to find it won't move - because it deactivates a trap they haven't triggered yet.
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerSpotting: A bandit who was trying to pick a lock in an abandoned chapel - at this point, she's seen the players intruding on her position and tries to alert her friends as she enters combat
session_synopses.AD_BanditGuardSurprised: A bandit guarding the door to an abandoned chapel that his crew are looting. The player just surprised him and he calls for help as he enters combat
session_synopses.VB_Artefact_1: Players notice the tomb containing the Selune artefact.
session_synopses.VB_Sanctum_1: players reflect on an the abandoned inner sanctum of a long-abandoned chapel
session_synopses.AD_UpDownDoorInvestigation: player finds a door that has no lock or handle
session_synopses.PAD_FoundCoins: Player finds a soul coin inside Jergal's chapel.
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerLockpicking: A bandit in an abandoned chapel - she's trying and failing to open a door to the lower level of the chapel, searching for loot. Talking to herself as she struggles - confused by the fact the door doesn't have a lock.
session_synopses.VB_Skeleton_2: Player characters are commenting on skeletons in a chapel. Even though the corpses look like they are scribes, they are all armed.
session_synopses.AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert: Three bandits - Barton, Mari and Haseid - are on alert in a crypt they're attempting to rob. They heard a commotion (falling masonry) and are braced for threats.
session_synopses.Jergal: After the party has slain a group of undead scholars, the judge of death--Jergal--climbs out of his sarcophagus to greet them. He has been locked inside for years by the god Helm to atone for his part in raising the Dead Three, wicked gods who are now plotting to conquer the realms. Jergal is emotionless and excessively formal, both resigned to his fate and that of others. He is here to assist the party because that is his divine oath, not out of any true desire to act. Players can attempt to goad or attack him, but to minimal effect, as he is functionally immortal. His only goal was to see their faces, so he can find them at camp later to offer further assistance.
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerOpenDoor: Mari realises that the door she was trying to unlock is suddenly opened, but she has not unlocked it.
session_synopses.VB_TakingTheArtefact_1: The player just stole a relic from a crypt in an abandoned chapel, and all candles around it sputtered out. Sounds of movement come from another room...
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerWander: Mari has found the door she is trying to lockpick open. She went to tell Barton, but found him dead. Now, she is looking in the room to find his killer.
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerSurprised: Players emerge from a seemingly abandoned crypt, startling a bandit on the other side of the door. Afterward, the bandit attacks.
session_synopses.PAD_JergalStatueReaction: Player succeeds/fails passive check to recognise statue of Jergal.
session_synopses.VB_Sanctum_2_WithMysticShadowheart: A mystic comments that they feel the power that once resided in an abandoned chapel. Shadowheart responds. Neither of them recognise which god this place is dedicated to.
session_synopses.AD_JergalWandering: Jergal wanders around after his conversation with the player, waiting for them to leave so he can teleport to camp and speak to them again later.
session_synopses.AD_BanditSanctumSpotting: The bandit in the chapel's inner sanctum spots the player and starts combat.

AD_ReturnAnyCombat2.speaker: Damays
AD_ReturnAnyCombat2.text: Back to the toad-freak. I can't risk it escaping.

AD_TieflingsLeaving.speaker: Damays
AD_TieflingsLeaving.text: Observe - and listen. You'll hear goblins before you see them.

AD_LaezelInspectsCorpses.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_LaezelInspectsCorpses.text: They must have carried something useful.

AD_OpenCage1.speaker: Nymessa
AD_OpenCage1.text: Shoot it down. Let's kill this thing.

AD_LaeZelDead.speaker: Damays
AD_LaeZelDead.text: Hold it together. We've got to finish what we started.

AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.speaker: Damays
AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.text: And when the goblins ally with it?

AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.speaker: Nymessa
AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.text: We'll be on the road to Baldur's Gate.

AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.speaker: Damays
AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.text: When this thing strikes, there will be no soldiers to protect you. This isn't Elturel.

AD_LeavingAnyCombat2.speaker: Damays
AD_LeavingAnyCombat2.text: I can't remain here. It's too dangerous.

LaezelDead.speaker: Damays
LaezelDead.text: Now come. We have a blast to investigate.

session_synopses.AD_LaezelReactsToAttack: Lae'zel is in the cage. The player attacked her.
session_synopses.AD_ReturnAnyCombat2: Damays (and Nymessa) got dragged into a combat from another situation (ex.: the brains at the crash site, the bandits at the chapel). Damays plays this AD when the combat ends, while he returns to the cage.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingsLeaving: Two tieflings discussing goblins, who might be nearby.
session_synopses.AD_LaezelInspectsCorpses: Damays and Nymessa are dead. Lae'zel says this once, then will inspect the corpses.
session_synopses.AD_OpenCage1: A tiefling encourages you to shoot down a cage containing a strange creaturfe (Lae'zel).
session_synopses.AD_LaeZelDead: Two tieflings that faced a strange creature (Lae'zel) comment that it is finally dead after battle.
session_synopses.AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro: Two tieflings argue about what to do with Lae'zel. Nymessa thinks to leave her alone. Damays wants to take her back to camp.
session_synopses.AD_LaezelDeadSolo1: A tiefling that faced a strange creature (Lae'zel) comments that it is finally dead after battle.
session_synopses.AD_LeavingAnyCombat2: |Tieflings joined a random combat and were dragged far from Lae'zel Recruitment. They will leave out of stage while saying this instead of going back to the scene.|
session_synopses.LaezelDead: You helped two tieflings kill a strange creature. (Lae'zel.) You talk to them, and they tell you about a blast they heard. (The ship crash.)
session_synopses.AD_OpenCageLaezel: Lae'zel is still hanging in her cage. She calls to you to let her down.

AD_BanditsDiscussion.speaker: Gimblebock
AD_BanditsDiscussion.text: Either we act now, or someone else will pick that wreck clean and leave us nothing.

AD_BanditsDiscussion.speaker: Taman
AD_BanditsDiscussion.text: Haven't seen anyone but us. It's just wilderness out here.

VB_LockpickingShadowheart_1_WithShadowhe.speaker: Shadowheart
VB_LockpickingShadowheart_1_WithShadowhe.text: There! Not so impregnable after all.
VB_LockpickingShadowheart_1_WithShadowhe.context: NodeContext: Satisfied. She's just successfully lockpicked a large, heavy set of doors.

AD_Bandit_Caster_01_CrushedReaction.speaker: Quelenna
AD_Bandit_Caster_01_CrushedReaction.text: Well, that's one less greedy bastard to share the loot with.
AD_Bandit_Caster_01_CrushedReaction.context: NodeContext: with a shrug - found a dead companion and sees the bright side

AD_Bandit_Melee_02_CrushedReaction.speaker: Taman
AD_Bandit_Melee_02_CrushedReaction.text: We'd have been safer in the crypt!
AD_Bandit_Melee_02_CrushedReaction.context: NodeContext: reacting with shock on seeing a dead friend

session_synopses.AD_BanditsDiscussion: Discussion between Gimbleboc and Taman before the scene against them triggers. They're arguing about whether to investigate the crash (this segues into the beginning of their intertactive dialogue when you get near enough)
session_synopses.VB_LockpickingShadowheart_1_WithShadowhe: Shadowheart lockpicked the crypt door that she usually try to bash.
session_synopses.AD_BanditReaction: A bandit exclaims in alarm/indignity upon spotting the player 'trespassing' near a tomb they intended to loot.
session_synopses.AD_Bandit_Caster_01_CrushedReaction: A bandit reacts to finding one of her companions dead in an apparent accident. She looks on the bright side.
session_synopses.AD_Bandit_Melee_02_CrushedReaction: A bandit sees the corpse of one of his companions, killed by a falling boulder

Bear.speaker: Ormn
Bear.text: He's back! You brought him back!
Bear.context: NodeContext: excited - halsin has finally come back!

session_synopses.Bear: The bear is worried and depressed because Halsin hasn't come back yet.

session_synopses.AD_ToronCurious: Toron notices you speaking with the strabge ox, but he's not too concerned, just curious.
session_synopses.AD_OxReaction: This AD plays after you have spoken with the ox with SwA, if you linger or pass by the ox again.

VB_FishOutofWater.speaker: Lae'zel
VB_FishOutofWater.text: These tieflings prove fragile. I've a mind to end their misery myself.

VB_FishOutofWater.speaker: Player
VB_FishOutofWater.text: Calm yourself. They're survivors, not soldiers.

VB_FishOutofWater.speaker: Lae'zel
VB_FishOutofWater.text: I fail to see the distinction.

session_synopses.VB_FishOutofWater: Lae'zel remarks on the tieflgins' frailty, and the party responds.

003.speaker: Topaz
003.text: Shh, I'm concentrating. Does this look good? Is the coin in the middle?
003.context: NodeContext: Clearly concentrating on something else while talking to the player. He's pushing the coin around.

003.speaker: Player
003.text: Kick at the bird, trying to scare it away.

003.speaker: Topaz
003.context: CinematicNodeContext: the bird picks at the player.NodeContext: The player kicked at the bird, but the bird holds his ground and pecks the foot.

session_synopses.003: Speak with animals dialogue. A little bird is adding a coin to the shinies in his nest, but he's not confident it's looking good.
session_synopses.AD_Birdsong: Ad where the bird sings (when he is persuaded to sing instead of caring about his nest).
session_synopses.AD_004: Animal sound AD for pet boar in druid grove

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.context: InternalNodeContext: Remember he could have been KO by Aradin. The flag PostConfrontationDone will make him move after the dialogNodeContext: mrag-RESH-em. Means 'shithead' in infernal. Zevlor has just woken up after being punched in the face by Aradin. He's groggy and pissed off.

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: A cheap shot - to be expected from a drow. But you helped us, so instead of killing you, I'll just ask:
DenIntro.context: NodeContext: Sneering, barely keeping his temper in check

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: Who in the Nine Hells do you think you are?

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: I'll survive a sore jaw. What I won't tolerate is a stranger waltzing in here and interfering in our business.

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: Lucky for you, you seem to have spooked that adventurer trash into leaving.

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: Whatever your business, I'd see to it quickly - the druids are forcing everyone out.
DenIntro.context: NodeContext: Cautionary - his people are also being forced out

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: This attack will only strengthen their resolve.

DenIntro.speaker: Player
DenIntro.text: I won't be staying long - I just need to find a healer.

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: They've started a ritual to cut the grove off from the world outside.

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: We can't stay, but we'll be slaughtered if we leave - we're no fighters.
DenIntro.context: NodeContext: Weary, doesn't know what to do

DenIntro.speaker: Player
DenIntro.text: This ritual - is there no way to convince the druids to stop it?

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: I've tried. Kagha - their new First Druid - won't even see me.

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: You, though... I know it's not your business, but she owes you for saving this place.
DenIntro.context: NodeContext: Slowly and thoughtfully - considering you, idea just occurring to him

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: Perhaps you could persuade her. For more time to prepare, if nothing else.

DenIntro.speaker: Player
DenIntro.text: I'll see what I can do.

AD_Victory.speaker: Zevlor
AD_Victory.context: NodeContext: Announcing to everyone it's time to leave. Eager, putting on a brave face.

session_synopses.DenIntro: In these dialogues, Zevlor reflects on what's happened (an attack of goblins at the gate, which the player helped with) and his mistrust of and bitterness towards the druids who are reluctantly hosting his people. He is exasperated, furious, but also eager to meet anyone who could help. He'll show a flash of anger and frustration at the start if the player struck him, but is pragmatic enough to calm himself once he realises you could be more help to him than harm.
session_synopses.AD_Victory: Plays after the tieflings won Attack on Den or after completing Goblin Hunt. Zevlor is standing on the plateform above the gate of the Grove and he's watching the other tieflings below.

AD_WithChef.speaker: Okta
AD_WithChef.text: Showing up here out of the blue, you've got good timing.
I had to! Kicked out of your own homes, poor things. How could I stay away?
AD_WithChef.context: NodeContext: Playing the concerned old granny

AD_WithChef.speaker: Okta
AD_WithChef.text: And how did you make it past all the goblins and gnolls?
Well, when you've lived as long as I have, you pick up a few tricks, you know?

node_data.speaker: Lae'zel
node_data.text: Hello, petal! Need anything? Any lotions or potions?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Cheerful and sincere. This is her second time meeting the player. Acting like they're friends already.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I need help. I've been infected by a mind flayer parasite.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *As you recount your adventure, Auntie Ethel nods along - her eyes wide.*
You poor pet. My heart goes out to you, truly.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: She clutches her chest, looking incredibly concerned and sympathetic. NodeContext: Deep concern and sounds sincere. Very worried about the player.

node_data.text: I see no sign of a tentacle yet, but that could change in an instant. You need help, serious help.
I've ne'er a potion or lotion here that could do it, but...
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking around, concerned as she tries to think of something. Shaking her head.

node_data.text: ...yes. I may have something at home!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes light up. Smiles. NodeContext: Hope and cheer in her voice. She sounds like she genuinely wants to help.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: My time could be running short. I can't afford to spend it paying you a house visit.
I'm sorry, but I can't do much for you here. You could try asking around, but be careful.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Sincere. Sounds worried and concerned.

node_data.text: Most folk won't be as understanding of your little... problem.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Almost wincing at the word problem.

node_data.text: I'll be heading home soon. Here. Let me mark it on your map - just in case.
node_data.context: NodeContext: almost winking at just in case. Expects player to show up at her home, confident that she's baited them enough.

node_data.text: Oh, and those potions you swiped from me? Keep them - call it a gift from your Auntie Ethel.
See you around, petal.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Amused.

session_synopses.AD_WithChef: Ethel and Okta are about 2m from each other. Ethel is tending her stand and selling 'lotions and potions' while Okta is cooking at a large pot - doing her best to make enough food for all the tieflings. Okta is slightly sick of Ethel poking her nose in things, and while doing her best to be polite, her grumpiness and annoyance is poking through.
session_synopses: Auntie Ethel appears to be a charmingly roguish old lady selling potions in the grove. She is actually a hag in disguise. The player can explain what happened with the tadpole and Ethel offers to meet them at her home in order to 'help them'. The player can also get poison from her for the goblin camp, but she asks them to do her a favour instead.

TieflingGuard5.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5.text: Look, between us? You're not supposed to be here, but I'll turn a blind eye.
TieflingGuard5.context: CinematicNodeContext: She's healed and standing up.

TieflingGuard5.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5.text: Just don't touch anything, all right?

RefugeeChef.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef.text: We'll be leaving soon. Make sure you stock up.
RefugeeChef.context: NodeContext: A gruff sounding chiding that comes from a place of concern.

AD_TieflingGuard1.speaker: Rikka
AD_TieflingGuard1.context: CinematicNodeContext: She's staring at the dead below.NodeContext: Shocked and scared.

ElevatorBear.speaker: Tuffet
ElevatorBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear lifts up his head, sniffs the air and goes back to sleep.

ElevatorBear.speaker: Tuffet
ElevatorBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear lifts its head and starts roaring at us. The roar turns into a yawn midway, and he goes back to sleep.

Gatekeeper.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper.text: Glad you made it inside... doubt we'll be safe here for long though.
Gatekeeper.context: NodeContext: twitchy - she's watching the tree-line as she speaks, expecting an attack

Gatekeeper.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper.text: There'll be more coming. Goblins hunt in packs.

Gatekeeper.speaker: Player
Gatekeeper.text: You're scared of a few goblins? Pathetic.

TieflingGuard4.speaker: Kaldani
TieflingGuard4.text: Aradin's back with his tail between his legs. I'm glad for your help, but I'd hoped you were Halsin.

TieflingGuard4.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard4.text: I'm looking for a healer. Let's skip the local drama.

TieflingGuard4.speaker: Kaldani
TieflingGuard4.text: Fair enough. Didn't mean to get too friendly.

TieflingGuard4.speaker: Kaldani
TieflingGuard4.text: If you want a healer, look to the druids.

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.text: O Selne, Our Lady of Silver.
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: praying for her dead friend. The goddess she addresses is Selune (seh-LOON-eh)

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.text: Please, may he rest by Your side.
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: praying over the body of her dead friend

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: remembering her dead friend while standing over his body

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.text: He always knew what to say... when I was homesick.
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: remembering her dead friend while standing over his body

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.text: He never let it show, but he was homesick, too.
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: remembering her dead friend while standing over his body

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: remembering her dead friend while standing over his body

VB_Grave_TieflingLeader.speaker: Narrator
VB_Grave_TieflingLeader.text: *Here lies Zevlor. He saved us when all hope seemed lost. Thank you, friend.*
VB_Grave_TieflingLeader.context: NodeContext: Standing over a grave and reading the headstone.

AD_TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_TieflingGuard10.text: The moment we arrive, I'm heading straight to Elfsong Tavern.
AD_TieflingGuard10.context: NodeContext: Relief. They might make it. Determination.

PAD_ShadowheartBook.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_ShadowheartBook.text: A temple of Shar? Where? And what's this about a curse?
PAD_ShadowheartBook.context: NodeContext: First she's heard of this temple.

PAD_BearStatue.speaker: Narrator
PAD_BearStatue.text: *By Silvanus, the Forest Father, we are granted balance.*

Squirrel.speaker: Timber
Squirrel.text: Try it again. I dare you.

Squirrel.speaker: Timber
Squirrel.text: You barged in without an invitation. I wouldn't call that friendly.

Squirrel.speaker: Timber
Squirrel.text: See, you're in my territory. And I want you gone.

Squirrel.speaker: Player
Squirrel.text: Back off, squirrel. Or I'll make you.

Squirrel.speaker: Timber
Squirrel.text: Okay, okay, calm down. We can make a deal.

Squirrel.speaker: Timber
Squirrel.text: How about this - you can stay if you keep those ugly feet on the ground.

Squirrel.speaker: Timber
Squirrel.text: I'll even sweeten the pot. Found some weird smelling stuff on the ground. You can keep it. But...
Squirrel.context: NodeContext: sweet but an edge to your voice at the end. You're about to threaten.

Squirrel.speaker: Timber
Squirrel.text: The trees are mine. Follow the rules, and I won't have to intervene. Got it?

PAD_EntranceStatue.speaker: Narrator
PAD_EntranceStatue.text: *This grove is kept by Silvanus' faithful.*

GruntingKid_Hideout.speaker: Doni
GruntingKid_Hideout.context: CinematicNodeContext: with a nod of greetingNodeContext: abrupt greeting

Refugee4.speaker: Toron
Refugee4.text: We're cornered in this place. Even the bloody druids look like they might turn on us.

TieflingGuard11.speaker: Zorru
TieflingGuard11.text: Please. I've... I've been through enough.

AD_Adventurer02.speaker: Barth
AD_Adventurer02.text: We should be back in the Gate by now.

VB_Grave_Kanon.speaker: Narrator
VB_Grave_Kanon.text: *Here lies Kanon. He gave his life defending others. He will be missed.*
VB_Grave_Kanon.context: NodeContext: Standing over a grave and reading the headstone.

Rat.speaker: Rat
Rat.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spooked by the hissNodeContext: Scared

AD_TieflingGuard4.speaker: Kaldani
AD_TieflingGuard4.context: NodeContext: Sighing, she's walking around and noticing more problems than solutions in the grove that has become a refugee camp for her people

Tiefling001.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001.text: How do you drow do that - find pleasure in killing? I got a goblin myself, yesterday. Shot her through the throat.
Tiefling001.context: CinematicNodeContext: She's closed off, crossing one arm over the other to hug herself, uncomfortable with what she did.

Tiefling001.speaker: Player
Tiefling001.text: Just embrace it - the adrenaline, the excitement, the power. It makes you stronger.

Tiefling001.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001.text: I don't know if I want that. But... if that's how I get through this...
Tiefling001.context: NodeContext: She was advised to lean into her sadistic urges and enjoy killing, She's a little hesitant, but willing to try it if that's what it takes.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: Used to think the goblins'd kill us the second we set foot outside. But after hearing what you did at the gate...

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: ... well, I still think they'll kill us. But at least we can put up a fight.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard10.text: Try not to keel over with the first blade drawn.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: Well, we came through Avernus. We might not look it, but we're tough.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: Who knows, some of us might even make it to Baldur's Gate.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard10.text: Maybe you'll catch a glimpse of Baldur's Gate before they cut you down.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: Ohh, well aren't you an optimist?

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: I've seen what the goblins can do to a vulnerable caravan, so I'm not as confident.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: But if you are, why not put a little gold on the line? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: No? Shame, I thought you might enjoy a little fun.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: Be safe out there, whatever comes your way.

PAD_WolfStatue.speaker: Narrator
PAD_WolfStatue.text: *By Silvanus, the Treefather, our turmoil is calmed.*

AD_TieflingGuard3.speaker: Okta
AD_TieflingGuard3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Leaning over cooking pot - cooking. NodeContext: Slightly gruff. Talking to herself. Surprised.

Mule1.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1.text: Another one. What are you under there, then? Ant? Aurochs?

Mule1.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1.text: The keepers of this place. They change their form to fit their need.

Mule1.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1.text: They become birds, to hunt on the wing. Bears, to tear flesh with teeth. But for me - only oxen. Only same old hay.

Mule1.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1.text: And I cannot even eat it, because the horned ones hide their shiny bits inside.

Mule1.speaker: Player
Mule1.text: Cheer up - you do a noble thing, carrying burdens for those who can't.

Mule1.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1.text: Hmph. When the horned ones leave this place, I will lie in the back, and you will pull. Noble one.

PAD_ElkStatue.speaker: Narrator
PAD_ElkStatue.text: *By Silvanus, the Old Oak, all death begets life.*

AD_Refugee4.speaker: Toron
AD_Refugee4.text: Can't keep the goblins out forever. This is no fortress, and we're no warriors.

AD_TieflingGuard3_8.speaker: Okta
AD_TieflingGuard3_8.text: Did you pass out a bowl to everyone?
AD_TieflingGuard3_8.context: NodeContext: Worried about leaving and is trying to busy herself and her son. Sounds gruff but warm.

AD_TieflingGuard3_8.speaker: Ikaron
AD_TieflingGuard3_8.context: NodeContext: Mother is chiding him about preparing to leave. He speaks in reassuring tones, he knows she's just worried.

AD_TieflingGuard3_8.speaker: Okta
AD_TieflingGuard3_8.text: You didn't offer anything to that old woman, did you?
AD_TieflingGuard3_8.context: NodeContext: Suspects the woman is dangerous but is trying to hide it. Passing it off with indifference.

AD_TieflingGuard3_8.speaker: Ikaron
AD_TieflingGuard3_8.text: No. You told me not to.
AD_TieflingGuard3_8.context: NodeContext: Worried for a brief second as he thinks he made a mistake.

AD_TieflingGuard3_8.speaker: Okta
AD_TieflingGuard3_8.context: NodeContext: Feigning indifference, hiding her relief.

AD_TieflingGuard8.speaker: Ikaron
AD_TieflingGuard8.text: Should be safe to travel now.

session_synopses.TieflingGuard5: She drank a potion given to her by the hag, with the promise that it would make her strong as steel. It did, but it has paralysed her legs. The effects are temporary, but she's angry and embarassed at the situation she's found herself. She doesn't suspect any foul play on the hag's part. We get a clue about this mysterious old woman selling potions in the cave, and through tagged gameplay can reveal that she's been duped. She is frustrated at herself - she wanted to help in the goblin fight, and instead she is sprawled on the ground.
session_synopses.RefugeeChef: An older woman, responsible for feeding an entire camp of refugees before they leave. She is gruff but has a heart of gold. She offers the player some gruel. Purpose is to highlight how desperate their situation is.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingGuard1: AD for a shelshocked tiefling patrolling the bridge and looking at the dead below. Older tiefling.
session_synopses.PAD_ElevatorUnusable: VB when the player clicks on the elevator, but it's blocked by the bear lying on top of it.
session_synopses.ElevatorBear: A bear is sleeping on the elevator, blocking it off from use. She's very tired and doesn't want to get up
session_synopses.Gatekeeper: Tiefling in charge of operating the gate at the druid's grove. She saw goblins attack and saw the player(s) help to repel them. She's nervous that more attacks will be coming and that the grove's defenses won't hold, which makes her eager to get on the road to Baldur's Gate as soon as possible.
session_synopses.TieflingGuard4: Non-critpath. A tiefling who sees the confrontation with a human adventurer at the grove as part of a systemic prejudice against tieflings. He carelessly led goblins to a grove full of tiefling children, and she doesn't think he'd have done that if there were humans there.
session_synopses.AD_CorpseMove: Two tieflings standing over the body of their killed comrade, about to bury him. Rikka is frustrated and angry in her grief, Kaldani tries to be the voice of reason.
session_synopses.VB_Grave_TieflingLeader: This is the grave of Zevlor, the tiefling leader. The player is reading out the sign above their grave.
session_synopses.PAD_ShadowheartBook: Shadowheart reads a book in the druid grove that suggests theres' a temple dedicated to her patron goddess somewhere in the region.
session_synopses.PAD_BearStatue: A plaque in the druid grove devoted to Silvanus, god of nature and balance.
session_synopses.Squirrel: This dialogue has two versions: SwA and non-SwA. In the non-SwA version, the squirrel communicates via squeaks or through the narrator.In the SwA version, the squirrel speaks like a human. She shouldn't sound like a disney animal. She's serious about getting the player to leave - she sees them as a threat - but she's also cocky about it. She doesn't think she'll have any problem beating the player the player to a pulp.Players encounter the squirrel in the druid grove. For all he knows, they're encroaching on HER territory, and she wants them out. Players have several options to deal with him in SwA - persuading or intimidating her. In both versions, they can kick her to death, if they choose.
session_synopses.PAD_EntranceStatue: A plaque in the druid grove devoted to Silvanus, god of nature and balance.
session_synopses.GruntingKid_Hideout: Non-critpath. A child who speaks solely in grunts in the thiefling hiedout.
session_synopses.Refugee4: A refugee, anxious about the goblins beyond the gates and the druids within.
session_synopses.TieflingGuard11: Tiefling is afraid of githyanki - he's seen one gut his friend while they were scouting.
session_synopses.AD_Adventurer02: A gruff adventurer complains about being stuck in a grove full of refugees. Wants to get back to the city. Speaking to himself. Grumbling.
session_synopses.VB_Grave_Kanon: This is the grave of Kanon, the tiefling who died at the gate of the grove. He was killed by goblins. The player is reading out the sign above their grave.
session_synopses.AD_Gatekeeper: A tiefling refugee stands watch on a battlement, unnerved and unsettled. Also has a line for her relief when the danger is gone - 'we can finallly leave'.
session_synopses.Rat: This dialogue has two versions: SwA and non-SwA. In the non-SwA version, the rat communicates via squeaks or through the narrator.In the SwA version, the rat speaks like a human. He can have some rat-like tendencies in hs delivery, but he shouldn't have a squeaky voice or come across comical.Players encounter the rat in the druid grove. He's in pain, with a chipped tooth. He chipped it on an item in a nearby chest. If players are nice to him, he'll lead them to the chest. If players remove the item, the rat excitedly jumps into the chest.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingGuard4: Thie tiefling refugee is trying to keep an optimistic view of things, but as she walks around the grove that they're using as a shelter, she sees too many problems and not enough solutions
session_synopses.Tiefling001: This tiefling recently killed a goblin and is trying to progress the grueling death she caused. She's trying to be strong, but is deeply traumatized. Depending on the player's answer, she'll express her frustration at not being able to deal with it,be shocked, or sink deeper into depression.
session_synopses.TieflingGuard10: A Tiefling in the druid grove who's keen to banter and joke. She's a bit flirtatious, though there's an undercurrent of fear throughout it all. She's genuinely afraid that she's going to die, and her only coping mechanism is to joke about it - in this case offering to make a bet. She's looking for something to look forward to.RERECORD NOTES: All lines in that dialogue have been set to rerecord with a few line changes. Overall direction. she needs to a more tongue in cheek humorous delivery.
session_synopses.PAD_WolfStatue: A plaque in the druid grove devoted to Silvanus, god of nature and balance.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingGuard3: Okta is leaning over her cooking pot, trying to make something edible as she mutters to herself.
session_synopses.Mule1: The ox is waiting in the cave while the tieflings decide whether to return to the road or not. He has been watching the druids in the grove below, and how they can change into any form they wish. He's wistful and sulky, wishing he could change his own shape from an ox to something less subservient.He can give us a hint about an item stashed in his hay.
session_synopses.AD_GruntingKid: General, casual grunt from grunting kid while he's under normal circumstances in the druid grove.
session_synopses.PAD_ElkStatue: A plaque in the druid grove devoted to Silvanus, god of nature and balance.
session_synopses.AD_Refugee4: Waiting for an attack of goblins on the druid grove. On edge.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingGuard3_8: This occurs between Okta and Ikaron. Okta is the grumpy chef in the camp and Ikaron is her son, a surly but caring guard. The purpose of these is to highlight their relationship, and how both of them care deeply for the camp, even if they're not the best at expressing it.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingGuard8: Ikaron either comments on the fact that the goblins have been defeated, or that they tiefligns have already bene attacked.

PAD_Cyanide.speaker: Player
PAD_Cyanide.text: Wyvern poison. Let's hope it doesn't come to that.

PAD_Cyanide.speaker: Player
PAD_Cyanide.text: Better a quick draught than ceremorphosis, nonetheless.

PAD_Cyanide.speaker: Player
PAD_Cyanide.text: Better to have on hand than not.

AD_Busy.speaker: Nettie
AD_Busy.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hand raised in a sign to wait and then turns back to what she was doing .NodeContext: Terse, impatient. She's dealing with serious matters right now.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: First you save us from goblins, then you bring Kagha back from the brink. You're making your mark.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Examining injured bird. Glances up from her work to look at player.NodeContext: Examining injured bird. Glances up from her work to look at player.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Give me a moment. I'll be right with you.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks back to the injured bird after glancing at the playerNodeContext: Looks back to the injured bird after glancing at the player

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Wait patiently.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Vis medicatrix...
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Casts spell (healing word) on the bird.NodeContext: A quietly murmured spell

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: There. It's up to her now. Life or death.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Still looking at the birdNodeContext: Still looking at the bird

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Now, what -
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to the playerNodeContext: Friendly, but cuts herself off when she sees you're a race she doesn't like

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Drow. Last time I saw one of you folk, he tried to slit me open. I hope you're more agreeable.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Doesn't like drow, but she's willing to give you a chance.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'm looking for Nettie.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: You found her. But I still don't know what she can do for you.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Healing. As soon as possible.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Come here. Let's have a look at you.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Approaches the player to examine themNodeContext: Approaches the player to examine them

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: You seem healthy enough. A bit tired 'round the eyes, maybe.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Examines the player, carefully looking them up and and down.NodeContext: Examines the player, carefully looking them up and and down.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Right. Yes, I'm... very tired indeed.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Then get some rest. There's no better magic.
node_data.context: NodeContext: with care

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Take a nip of whiskey before bed if you need to. Come back to me if that doesn't do it.

AD.speaker: Nettie
AD.text: Still have some mugrot in the stores, but no blueleaf sap.
AD.context: NodeContext: Distracted, checking through her inventory at her desk

AD_TadpoledStart.speaker: Nettie
AD_TadpoledStart.text: We need to be quick. This way.
AD_TadpoledStart.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gesturing for the player to follower her as she escorts them to the storage room, where they will be quarantined. NodeContext: Concerned

PAD_SeeDrow.speaker: Player
PAD_SeeDrow.text: I wonder what happened to that drow.

PAD_SeeDrow.speaker: Player
PAD_SeeDrow.text: Is there a dead tadpole in that jar?

PAD_SeeDrow.speaker: Player
PAD_SeeDrow.text: I can't tell if this is a temple or a library.

AD_TadpoledCombat.speaker: Nettie
AD_TadpoledCombat.text: This is for your own good, why can't you see that?

AD_WithBird.speaker: Nettie
AD_WithBird.text: It's messy, but we'll fix you up.

WoundedBird.speaker: Player
WoundedBird.text: Something took a chunk out of you. What happened?

PAD_Relieved.speaker: Player

HealedBird.speaker: Wounded Bird

AD_Studying.speaker: Nettie

LockedUp.speaker: Nettie

session_synopses.PAD_Cyanide: Context: Nettie has given the player a vial of poison to take if they start turning into mind flayers. Players reflect on whether they should actually take it if the time comes.Speaker 1 has just promised Nettie they will take the poison if they begin to turn. (SPEAK TO JORDI, The Speaker 1 nodes may need to be changed. )Speaker 2 reacts to Speaker 1 acquiring the poison after swearing to Nettie they'll use it if they start to turn.Gale - Shadowheart: We'll resort to poison if necessary.Lae'zel - Astarion - Wyll - Karlach: It won't come to that - don't entertain the option.
session_synopses.AD_Busy: Nettie is dealing with a player and has been interrupted by another player.
session_synopses: Nettie is the apprentice of Halsin, the missing druid. We can tell her about the parasite in our heads. She listens with compassion but decides the player is too dangerous and must be quarantined. If she knows about the parasite, she'll invite the player to come with her deeper into her rooms for "treatement."
session_synopses.AD: This triggers as Nettie is at her desk in Halsin's lab, researching and organising. The bird she was treating may have died at this point.
session_synopses.Bird: This bird has been told to go and find Halsin and you're interupting him just as he's getting ready to take flight. He's tense and in a hurry to be gone, so he'll only answer one question before taking to the skies and carrying out his mission.
session_synopses.AD_TadpoledStart: Nettie's comments as she walks with the 'infected' player to the storage room, where they will be quarantined.
session_synopses.PAD_SeeDrow: The player broke inside the room without Nettie. Normally they follow her inside and they get the info from her. The VB stops playing when the tadpoled scene with Nettie starts or when Halsin is found in the goblin camp.
session_synopses.AD_TadpoledCombat: The player triggered combat during the tadpoled scene
session_synopses.AD_WithBird: Nettie is tending to a badly wounded bird. The bird is weak, its life hangs in the balance, but Nettie is doing what she can.
session_synopses.WoundedBird: Wounded bird is resting on the table after being treated by Nettie. It's probably going to die. If you poke it repeatedly, it will die.
session_synopses.Cyanide: Nettie leads the player into a lab and fetches a thorn. The player doesn't know, but the thorn is a deadly poison. Nettie knows it's the only choice she has - the player could transform into a monster and kill everyone in the camp. She sees this as a kindness - the transformation is terrible - so she has a very 'matter of fact nurse' tone about the whole thing before she scratches you, but will get stressed if you resist. Once she's scratched the player, her tone will be softer - kinder. She plans to sit with you while you pass and make it as easy as possible. The player will have to convince her they're not a threat if they're going to get the antidote. She'll be slow to convince, hesitant to allow any risk to the camp. Nettie is STANDING for this entire dialog.
session_synopses.PAD_Relieved: The player is cured from poison ( the status DEN_APPRENTICE_THORN). This status has 3 stages leading to death. Each time the player make a long rest, they get closer to death.This PAD of relief plays only if the status reached the stages 2 or 3. The status was getting worse and worse, which must have been worrying, but now they've been cured.
session_synopses.HealedBird: The 'Wounded Bird' that Nettie was treating after some time has passed (after Goblin Hunt or Attack on Den). The bird's recovering and feels a bit better.
session_synopses.AD_Studying: After poisoning the tadpoled player, Nettie settles down at her old Master's desk to see if she can uncover any secrets about the tadpole in his research.
session_synopses.LockedUp: During the scene where she scratches you. Nettie is in the lab, sitting at a table, studiying Halsin's notes. The player can still try to persuade her to give the antidote. The player must also accept to take the wyvern poison. The other choice is to kill Nettie.

VB_BrokenRunes.speaker: Player
VB_BrokenRunes.text: It's broken, but not too badly.

VB_EmptyHolder.speaker: Player
VB_EmptyHolder.text: The stone's less worn here. Recently uncovered.

session_synopses.VB_BrokenRunes: Player finds a broken rune amongst some ruins.
session_synopses.VB_EmptyHolder: Player finds a slot in the wall where you can fit a slab of stone. This is where we'll place a stone rune, if we find one.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Remira

AD_AtCorpses.speaker: Aradin
AD_AtCorpses.text: Lucky you. Done with this shite.

LeaderAtCorpses.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses.text: Thought you was busy with the foulbloods in Halsin's grove.

AD_AdventurerCleaningWound.speaker: Remira

session_synopses.RaidAdventurer:
Age: mid-30-40s.
Female
Bio: Rough and working-class. A veteran of many expeditions, Remira is nonetheless shaken after a raid gone horribly wrong and trying to hide it behind bravado. She feels guilty for leaving a new recruit to die, but tries to wave it away and gets defensive if confronted over it. Shes sarcastic and casually racist.
session_synopses.AD_AtCorpses: Gallows humour, grimly delivered - the 'you' are the corpses of his fallen comrades, who he finds in a forest. But  he's effectively talking to himself.
session_synopses.LeaderAtCorpses: Aradin comes across the corpses of some of his friends, who were lost during the goblin raid. He's in a neutral location at a bridge and observing the corpses of his people and of goblins, who were also killed in the fight.
session_synopses.AD_RemiraBarthAtCorpses: Remira and Aradin are discussing the fate of their fallen comrades at the hands of goblins
session_synopses.AD_AdventurerCleaningWound: Remira is cleaning a wound she got from the goblins. She winces and grunts in pain while checking out the damage.

PAD_RaidersDefeated.speaker: Player
PAD_RaidersDefeated.text: Was that an ordinary raid? Seemed a fool's errand.

PAD_RaidersDefeated.speaker: Player
PAD_RaidersDefeated.text: They likely have a camp nearby. I'd expect more raiders eventually.

Confrontation.speaker: Zevlor
Confrontation.text: There are children here, you fool!
Confrontation.context: CinematicNodeContext:  NodeContext: Absolutely furious.  He and his crew nearly died. Right in Zevlor's face.

Confrontation.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation.text: We was running for our lives.
Confrontation.context: NodeContext: Exasperated. Thinks Zevlor is just being unreasonable.

Confrontation.speaker: Zevlor
Confrontation.text: You led them straight to us. And you let them take the druid, too. Unbelievable!
Confrontation.context: NodeContext: He's completely lost his temper at this point. Words are spat out.

Confrontation.speaker: Player
Confrontation.text: One fight just ended, and now you're picking another? Relax.

Confrontation.speaker: Zevlor
Confrontation.text: Tell that to the dead at the gate.

Confrontation.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation.text: Shut it, horns. I'd be lying dead next to the goblins if you'd stalled any longer.
Confrontation.context: CinematicNodeContext: Points at Zevlor on first phrase - violent gesture. Emphasis on 'I'd' since he's responding to Zevlor talking of the deadNodeContext: Trying to turn the tide. Accusation is strong in his voice,

Confrontation.speaker: Zevlor
Confrontation.text: My duty is to this camp.

Confrontation.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation.text: God forbid you risk your precious tail. But I shouldn't be surprised.

Confrontation.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation.text: Foulbloods ain't known for courage.
False

Confrontation.speaker: Player
Confrontation.text: Stand back and watch.
CinematicNodeContext: In one swift move, the armoured man's fist makes contact with a sickening crunch.
Confrontation.context: CinematicNodeContext: In one swift move, the armoured man's fist makes contact with a sickening crunch.

Confrontation.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation.text: Shoulda done that a long time ago. Arrogant prick had it out for me from day one.

Confrontation.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation.text: No one leaves my people out cold.

Confrontation.speaker: Player
Confrontation.text: You put him in a bind, showing up like that. And he did try to open the gate.

Confrontation.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation.text: Too little, too late.

Confrontation.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation.text: He was right, though. Coming back to this hellhole was a mistake no amount of gold can put right.

Confrontation.speaker: Aradin
Confrontation.text: I'd rather face another round of goblins than stay in this pit.

AD_LeadersArgue.speaker: Zevlor
AD_LeadersArgue.text: You led them to our door.

AD_LeadersArgue.speaker: Aradin
AD_LeadersArgue.text: And you was ready to let 'em have us.

AD_LeadersArgue.speaker: Zevlor
AD_LeadersArgue.text: Don't blame me for your idiotic mistakes.

AD_LeadersArgue.speaker: Aradin
AD_LeadersArgue.text: I blame you for lockin' us out. Leavin' us to die.

VB_PeacefulResolution.speaker: Player
VB_PeacefulResolution.context: NodeContext: A massive argument has just died down thanks to you. You're relieved and also surprised at how tense it was. Commenting on situation.

VB_PeacefulResolution.speaker: Player
VB_PeacefulResolution.text: Yes. It's a good thing we were here.

session_synopses.AD_Adventurer2AtGate: Plea from one of the adventurers at the gates.
session_synopses.PleaAtTheGate: Initial situation dialog. Adventurers are at the gates of the Den, pleading to be let in while tieflings refuse them entry since goblins are on their trail.
session_synopses.AD_WyllCharge: Originally only meant for Wyll's jumping into combat line.
session_synopses.Adventurer1: Robbed adventurer raiding party and Adventurers Qest dialogues (one-liners). Is fallback for Adventurers Quest in the event Adventurer Leader and Adventurer Raider die.
session_synopses.AdventurerLeader: Minor dialogues before and after Aradin/ Zevlor's confrontation insider the camp.
session_synopses.Adventurer2:
Age: mid-30-40s.
Female
Bio: Rough and working-class. A veteran of many expeditions, Remira is nonetheless shaken after a raid gone horribly wrong and trying to hide it behind bravado. She feels guilty for leaving a new recruit to die, but tries to wave it away and gets defensive if confronted over it. Shes sarcastic and casually racist.
session_synopses.AD_GoblinCaptain: A goblin veteran leading a raid on a druid grove - he's giving orders to his troops
session_synopses.AD_TieflingLeaderWantsGateOpened: The tiefling leader calls for the doors to be opened with an AD if players are outside of dialog range.
session_synopses.AD_AdventurerLeaderAtGate: Plea from the adventurer leader at the gates - goblins are almost here, he needs Zevlor to open up! Zevlor is being circumspect.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingLeaderRant: Rant the tiefling leader says before going off to meet the adventurers after the goblin raid.
session_synopses.VB_ApproachingGate: VB played when the players are approaching the gates of the DEN.
session_synopses.AD_Adventurer1AtGate: Plea from one of the adventurers at the gates.
session_synopses.AD_WyllWantsOut: AD used by Wyll when his first combat turn against the goblin raiders start. This should be cried out valiantly! Wyll has arrived to save the day!
session_synopses.PAD_RaidersDefeated: Context: The raiders that were attacking during plea at the gates have been defeated. Characters ponder what next.
session_synopses.Confrontation: After the goblins' raid on Halsin's camp, the tiefling leader berates the adventurers for causing trouble. The situation can escalate until one leader is knocked out, or it can be descalated with the aid of the player.
session_synopses.AD_LeadersArgue: Argument that loops over itself while the leader await the arrival of the player. They are both furious and high-energy, having just survived the goblin encounter.
session_synopses.VB_PeacefulResolution: VB if everyone survived the confrontation in Raiding Party.

AD.speaker: Shadowheart
AD.text: There must be something I can learn from it.
AD.context: NodeContext: Talking to herself, trying to figure out a mysterious artefact.

session_synopses.AD: Shadowheart tries to figure out the mysterious cube that she carries with her while resting in the Druid Grove (the cube is a powerful relic that she was to retrieve deliver to her superiors - she does not know its exact nature, but has to protect it at all costs).

Thieflings_HideoutTrespassCaught_Crime.speaker: Narrator
Thieflings_HideoutTrespassCaught_Crime.text: *It seems Mol was as good as her word. She's reported that you've been threatening children.*

GroveConflict_IdolCrime.speaker: Narrator
GroveConflict_IdolCrime.text: *It seems the Idol of Silvanus has been stolen. Choose your next move carefully.*

session_synopses.Thieflings_HideoutTrespassCaught_Crime: Non-critpath. Occurs when a guard confronts players who have offended Mol, teenage crime boss in the Druid Grove. The player can try talk their way out of trouble, attempt a bribe, fight or surrender.
session_synopses.GroveConflict_IdolCrime: The player has stolen a most sacred idol from the druids.Though the druids have made peace with the players and the tieflings at this time, they can't let anyone steal their idol, so they interrogate the player when they see him.

PAD_DiscoverTrap.speaker: Player
PAD_DiscoverTrap.text: I don't like the look of that mushroom. I should stay clear.

session_synopses.PAD_DiscoverTrap: The player has discovered a hostile looking mushroom in the DEN Grove Prison. It's origins are from the Underdark, but have been planted by an inquisitive druid.

session_synopses.AD_AdventurervsKid: Barth is threatening Meli, who has stolen a locket from him. Meli is playing dumb and/or threatening him in return.
session_synopses.Trainee1: Player speaking directly to a tiefling child who's learning to fight.
session_synopses.AD_HideoutTrespass: Mol has caught the player in her hideout and advises them to leave, starting to count down. She's threatening and serious.
session_synopses.Pickpocket_002: Not Critpath. A small tiefling girl (7-9 years old), very shy and nervous, is planning on stealing from the player and is surprised that they're talking to her. Though she's a gifted thief, she's not good at lying. There is also a portion of this dialogue where the player can get her to partially admit to having stolen from them.
session_synopses.HideoutKid_001: A young woman in her early teens, crime boss, leader of the thiefling kids in the Den. She reacts to the various ways the player has treated her kids so far, and if necessary, can return items to the player that her kids have stolen.
session_synopses.AD_HideoutGuards: The sneaky kids are talking amongst themselves in their secret hideout.
session_synopses.AD_MerchantLeaves: When the scammer (Lim) and the pickpocket walk away, having stolen from the player.
session_synopses.VB_FoundStolenGoods: Said with a lilt of suspicion. They have found their own things, which a kid stole, but don't know they were robbed in the first place
session_synopses.HideoutGuard_002: Little kid talkign to the player-- trying to be tough.
session_synopses.CaughtThief: Non-critpath. Occurs when the player catches the small tiefling girl (7-9 years old) is stealing from them. The player can grab and shake her, as per design.
session_synopses.Pickpocket_001: Non-critpath. A tiefling merchant kid who's trying to distract the player while his partner/sister steals the player's belongings. Orphaned street rat, works for Mol (Boss kid in the hideout)
session_synopses.AD_CannotFitCrack: Player found a crack through which they potentially can or cannot enter the kids' hideout.
session_synopses.Trainee3: Tiefling child far too confident they can fight goblins next time, even when scared.
session_synopses.AD_RobberKid: Child pickpocket, bored out of his mind, talking out loud.
session_synopses.Trainer: Non-critpath. Trainer asks the player to inspire the children. Player can give speeches or roar. Trainer, Asharak should sound weary and a little sad. He doesn't want to have to train children to fight.
session_synopses.Trainee2: Tiefling child confident they can fight goblins next time they come.
session_synopses.AD_Trespassing: A crime reaction dialog said by the kids in the Thiefling Hideout.
session_synopses.AD_Trainee3Responses: Gan (and possibly Ide) recieve combat training from an adult tiefling. They're both tiefling girls aged 9-10. Too brave. Don't know the danger ahead.
session_synopses.AD_PickpocketTrader: Scammer kid mutters to himself after having swindled someone.
session_synopses.AD_KidGuardReport: Player is fighting Mol and the other kids. The kids are calling for help from the other tieflings.
session_synopses.AD_GuardAfterKnockout: After the confrontation at teh gates where Zevlor and Aradin show down. Ikaron, a tiefling, is pro Zevlor.

AD_ZorruGuard.speaker: Zorru
AD_ZorruGuard.text: Be on the lookout for those... things.

AD_ZorruGuard.speaker: Eramas
AD_ZorruGuard.text: You're tense, Zorru. Maybe you should rest a while.

AD_ZorruGuard.speaker: Zorru
AD_ZorruGuard.text: I won't rest. Not while those yellow freaks are after me.

PAD_AfterKid.speaker: Lae'zel
PAD_AfterKid.text: This Zorru has encountered githyanki. I must find and question him.

session_synopses.AD_ZorruGuard: Zorru and another tiefling speak. Zorru mentions the gith are after him - Tilses isn't sure they even exist.
session_synopses.PAD_AfterKid: Lae'zel avatar remarks on the kid who recognised her as a githyanki

PAD_Attack.speaker: Player
PAD_Attack.text: It'd take an age to hack through all this.

session_synopses.PAD_Comment: This VB plays when players first see the results of a druid ritual: indestructible vines have enveloped the entire grove, sealing it off from the outside world. Players cannot get past them to the grove within.
session_synopses.PAD_Attack: This VB plays when players attack the indestructible vines that have enveloped a druid's grove.

AD_Parents.speaker: Locke
AD_Parents.context: NodeContext: Crying - grieving. Your daughter is dead

AD_Parents.speaker: Komira
AD_Parents.context: NodeContext: Holding back tears to comfort your husband - trying to be strong

Guard3.speaker: Mino
Guard3.text: See to your business here quickly - then leave.
Guard3.context: NodeContext: 'tread on eggshells while you're here - or else.'

Guard2.speaker: Maggran
Guard2.context: NodeContext: SFX only - animal sound. Do not record.

Protester1.speaker: Rechel
Protester1.text: Now they're done messing about with rituals, maybe them lot can make themselves useful.
Protester1.context: NodeContext: Calmer than before - druids have stood down

Protester3.speaker: Xeph
Protester3.text: This place ain't so special. Why were the druids so protective of it?
Protester3.context: NodeContext: Calmer than before - druids have stood down

node_data.speaker: Maggran
node_data.text: *Roar!*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Threatening roar + aggressive stance from the bear/druid. But he doesn't attack.

node_data.speaker: Jeorna
node_data.text: Calm, Maggran. Give them a chance.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The druid guard raises a hand to her bear colleague, stilling him.NodeContext: She's addressing the bear, but 'give him/her a chance' is more for the player's benefit.

node_data.speaker: Jeorna
node_data.text: You - get back.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jeorna (druid1) turns to address the player.NodeContext: Entry not up for discussion.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Why? What's so special down here?

node_data.speaker: Jeorna
node_data.text: It's forbidden to outsiders - Kagha's orders.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bear-druid glowers menacingly when druid says 'see what happens'

Protester2.speaker: Amek
Protester2.text: Heartless bastards. They deserve to have the goblins burn 'em out.
Protester2.context: NodeContext: Angry. Speaking to the player about the druids and how they're treating the tiefling refugees

SoloParentB.speaker: Komira
SoloParentB.text: Because of you, I got my little girl back. That's not something I'll forget.

AD_ParentsSeeCorpse.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsSeeCorpse.context: NodeContext: You've caught sight of the corpse of your daughter. Hysterical. Grieving.

AD_ParentsSeeCorpse.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsSeeCorpse.context: NodeContext: You've caught sight of the corpse of your daughter. Hysterical. Grieving.

AD_ParentsSeeCorpse.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsSeeCorpse.context: NodeContext: You've caught sight of the corpse of your daughter. Hysterical. Grieving.

Guard1.speaker: Jeorna
Guard1.text: Show some dignity and leave. You've burdened this place with your troubles long enough.
Guard1.context: NodeContext: Resentful. Possibly speaking to a fellow druid, in which case she refers to the outsiders in third person.

session_synopses.AD_Parents: Situation 1: Locke and Marrick have learned their daughter is dead - killed by Sagha and her snake. Situation 2: Locke and Marrick have been denied entry into the inner grove. They are standing close to the entrance trying to figure out their next step. Marrick is happy to charge in but Locke is advising caution. Their daughter is inside.
session_synopses.Guard3: A druid guarding the entrance to the inner part of a sacred druid grove. He curtly warns the player to behave.
session_synopses.Guard2: Maggran (druid guarding the entrance to the inner sanctum of the Emerald Grove) is in bear form. He delivers curt, bestial one-liners if the player has speak with animals. He doesn't want them around. He has a lone human fallback line should he somehow transform.
session_synopses.Protester1: Angry demonstator. Part of a mob of irate tieflings who have gathered to protest the druids' actions. They fear the druids will place them in danger in order to protect the grove. Later, the druids might stand down and the tiefling might remark upon this in a calmer tone.
session_synopses.Protester3: Angry demonstator. Part of a mob of irate tieflings who have gathered to protest the druids' actions. They fear the druids will place them in danger in order to protect the grove. Later, the druids might stand down and the tiefling might remark upon this in a calmer tone.
session_synopses: Three druids guard the entrance to the inner part of their sanctuary, blocking any outsiders. They're on edge, having recently driven back some outraged tiefling refugees who know the druids hold one of their children captive. One of the druids transformed into a bear during this confrontation, causing the tieflings to back down. Now we try to gain passage while tempers are still running hot.
session_synopses.Protester2: Angry demonstator. Part of a mob of irate tieflings who have gathered to protest the druids' actions. They fear the druids will place them in danger in order to protect the grove. Later, the druids might stand down and the tiefling might remark upon this in a calmer tone.
session_synopses.SoloParentB: Marricko's dialog after her kid is back (and she thanked and rewarded the player) or after learning that her kid is dead.
session_synopses.AD_ParentsSeeCorpse: This is the edgecase in which the player takes Arabella's corpse and dumps it in front of her parents. They are hysterical with grief.
session_synopses.Guard1: Jeorna, one of the druid grove guards, speaks to the player after they've been allowed entry. She's curt and not greatly pleased that we're allowed inside.

1.speaker: Danis
1.text: I don't want to wait around here longer than we have to.

session_synopses.1: This is Danis' default dialogue if Bex is either occupied or dead, so it's a bit uneasy and tonally ambiguous without giving a strong indication of what's on his mind.

AD_Ritual.speaker: Aelar, Karrik, Inwe, Tahan, Elwyn
AD_Ritual.text: Defende nos ab imminentibus aequilibrio tuo.
AD_Ritual.context: NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: deh-FEN-day nohs ahb ee-mee-NEN-tee-booce AI-kwee-lee-bree-oh TWO-oh.

AD_SearchingBird.speaker: Apikusis
AD_SearchingBird.text: Find our master. Return to me then.
AD_SearchingBird.context: CinematicNodeContext: Speaking to the bird. NodeContext: Stern but also love in her voice. She knows the bird will do its best.

AD_SearchingBird.speaker: Apikusis
AD_SearchingBird.text: Tell me what you find. Tell only me. Understand?

AD_SearchingBird.speaker: Tingmiaq
AD_SearchingBird.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hopping from foot NodeContext: Cheerful, excited.

RitualDruid2.speaker: Karrik
RitualDruid2.text: Hostes subeunt. Protege nos. Muni nos.
RitualDruid2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes closed, focused on the chant, channelling magical energy.NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: HO-stess soo-BAY-uhnt. PRO-teh-jay nohs. MOO-nee nohs.

RitualDruid3.speaker: Inwe
RitualDruid3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes closed, focused on the chant, channelling magical energy.NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: Ahb SPEE-ree-too oo-MOHK, AH-coo-lay-oos VEE-tees-kway.

RitualDruid4.speaker: Elwyn
RitualDruid4.text: Defende nos ab imminentibus aequilibrio tuo.
RitualDruid4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes closed, focused on the chant, channelling magical energy.NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: deh-FEN-day nohs ahb ee-mee-NEN-tee-booce AI-kwee-lee-bree-oh TWO-oh.

RitualDruid5.speaker: Tahan
RitualDruid5.text: You think you saved us? You just prolonged the inevitable.
RitualDruid5.context: NodeContext: The ritual has stopped and the goblin threat against the grove is dealt with, but she believes something similar will happen again so long as her fellow druids let outsiders in.

RitualDruid5.speaker: Tahan
RitualDruid5.text: Sooner or later, other outsiders will bring trouble to the grove.
RitualDruid5.context: NodeContext: The ritual has stopped and the goblin threat against the grove is dealt with, but she believes something similar will happen again so long as her fellow druids let outsiders in.

AD_RitualDruid3.speaker: Inwe
AD_RitualDruid3.text: We have to make this right.
AD_RitualDruid3.context: NodeContext: The ritual has been stopped, but the goblin threat remains. Inwe is being hard on herself for falling for Kagha's ploy to turn their grove to the evil shadow druids.

AD_RitualDruid2.speaker: Karrik
AD_RitualDruid2.text: We'll be stronger for all of this.
AD_RitualDruid2.context: NodeContext: The ritual has been stopped, and the goblin threat has passed. Karrik has calmed - he is feeling introspective.

AD_RitualDruid5.speaker: Tahan
AD_RitualDruid5.text: Those tieflings brought nothing but trouble.
AD_RitualDruid5.context: NodeContext: The ritual has stopped and the goblin threat is dealt with. Tahani is bitter - she blames players and tiefling for bringing trouble to the grove in the first place.

RitualDruid1.speaker: Aelar
RitualDruid1.text: Aggeniculamur in umbra tua, Pater Arborum.
RitualDruid1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes closed, focused on the chant, channelling magical energy.NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: AH-jeh-nee-koo-lah-moor een OOM-brah TWO-ah, PAH-tehr ARR-bore-oom.

BirdSender.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender.text: I knew Kagha was desperate, but I never imagined she'd get Cloakwood involved.
BirdSender.context: NodeContext: She distrusted Kagha, but didn't think that she'd gone so far as to turn 'evil'

BirdSender.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender.text: You pulled her from the brink. She owes you her life.
BirdSender.context: NodeContext: Players convinced Kagha to abandon the shadow druids.

BirdSender.speaker: Player
BirdSender.text: You've known her longer - has she really changed?

BirdSender.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender.text: By all appearances, yes - when I look at her, I see the Kagha I once knew.

BirdSender.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender.text: But it could be another lie. I pray it isn't.

AD_RitualDruid4.speaker: Elwyn
