session_synopses: Nadira is a witty tiefling that survived Avernus and escaped with a soul coin, a valuable currency of the Hells. She suspects the player works for the original owner of the coin, a devilish erinyes, and will have to be persuaded in order to hand it over.

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: Step, parry, strike - damn it! It's just not... agh!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Trying and failing at swordplay practiceNodeContext: Frustrated. Practicing swordplay with little success - then reacts with alarm upon seeing a gith

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: Sorry, sorry. I've just never seen... your face is... well. I should get back to it.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Apologising, A little unnerved by a gith

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Interesting technique. Having some trouble?

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: Nothing but. Goblins in the wilds, out for blood. And the druids in here, looking to kick us out - or worse.
node_data.context: NodeContext: unloading his burdens

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: We need to be ready for a fight - but I'm useless with a sword.
node_data.context: NodeContext: 'I'm doing my best, but my best isn't good enough'

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: No wonder you're struggling - you've no balance. Space your feet farther apart.
True

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: I'll try and brace them better - like so. Step-brace, parry, swing! Yes!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Practicing his swing.NodeContext: Successful attempt

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: Good advice - If I had two copper, I'd owe you one.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Grateful (but he has nothing to give the player)

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: You really know what you're doing! Found this by the road - bet you'll put it to good use.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Grateful

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Keep training. In time, you'll make short work of any goblins.

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: Hopefully it's just the goblins we have to worry about - the druids are treating us like vermin.
node_data.context: NodeContext: He's still got misgivings - the goblins aren't the only threat

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: But I'll keep at it. Thank you.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Grateful

session_synopses: Tiefling is practicing his swing on  a dummy, trying to improve. The player can offer advice, potentially improving the tiefling's form.

AD_GreetingPlayer.speaker: Asharak
AD_GreetingPlayer.context: NodeContext: Introducing the player to his students.

session_synopses.AD_GreetingPlayer: Trainer introducing the player to the class. The player has just walked up.

AD_DarkUrgeSeesDeadChild.text: Is this the first time I've caused a child's death?

session_synopses.AD_DarkUrgeSeesDeadChild: Dark Urge sees a dead child after the destruction of the Den at the hands of goblins

node_data.speaker: Sazza
node_data.text: Didn't expect to see a drow in here. Did the boss lady send you to rescue me?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Yes, she sent me. Ready to get out of here?
True

node_data.speaker: Sazza
node_data.text: Yeah. Take me back to the tribe, and we'll tell the boss all about this pretty little place so she can burn it to the ground.

node_data.speaker: Sazza
node_data.text: We'll be heroes, blessed by Priestess Gut in the name of the Absolute.

node_data.speaker: Sazza
node_data.text: Get me outta 'ere, an' I'll introduce you to my tribe. You'd like 'em.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: All right. You've captured my interest.

node_data.speaker: Sazza
node_data.text: You won't regret it, promise.

node_data.speaker: Sazza
node_data.text: Priestess Gut will give a little under-dweller like you all the blessings of the Absolute.

session_synopses.AD_Guards: Several conditions of conversations between Arka and Memnos here: Sazza escaped, sazza was killed, the pair wait for the goblin attack at the gates, or Arka's brother, Kanon, has been killed by goblins.
session_synopses:
If the player saves the goblin captive from being killed, the goblin will try to convince the player to free them and then meet the player later in the goblin camp. Note from Swen on this dialogue: ''I also want a different emotion in there. This goblin is negotiating with me. Think a terrorist that is locked up and who is offering their interrogators an option to save their lives if they free her.
It'll be quite the intense conversation.''
session_synopses.AD: Sazza's ADs when she's in the druid grove. She's in a cage for most of these, or could have been broken out by the player. She's at risk of life and limb but that doesn't stop her from antagonizing everyone around her.
session_synopses.Friend: Memnos - the supporting optional tiefling character in the Captive Goblin situation, Friend to Arka.

Dead.speaker: Player
Dead.text: What is it like to die?

session_synopses.Dead: In this dialogue, Volo has died and is a lifeless corpse. Rather than his usual jocular self, he's a shade who can hardly speak.

AD.speaker: Rolan
AD.text: We don't even know these people!
AD.context: NodeContext: Arguing with Lia. He thinks her suggestion to stay is suicide.

AD.speaker: Lia
AD.context: NodeContext: Rolan has claimed you don't even know the other tieflings. You're snapping back.

AD.speaker: Rolan
AD.text: Of course it does. You would choose strangers over us!

AD.speaker: Cal
AD.context: NodeContext: You sister and your best friend are arguing and it's getting progressively heated. You're trying to calm the situation but you also know they're going to keep ignoring you.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: I can spare but a moment - Baldur's Gate awaits! Oh, I can almost smell the city.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Leaving for Baldur's Gate after a hell of an argument but isn't bothered. Excited to be leaving and seems oblvious to that fact that Lia is next to him, SEETHING.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You're cheerful for someone about to abandon his kin.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: Well, you're here, aren't you? You can help them if you want.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: I don't believe in sacrifices for a lost cause.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: We're leaving for Baldur's Gate. And we will make it.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Are you always this selfish?

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: Tch. You're as bad as Lia.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: And I think one of her is quite enough in my life. Good day to you.

Sister.speaker: Lia
Sister.text: Those goblins will rue the day they chose to tangle with this grove.

Sister.speaker: Lia
Sister.text: You and I will do some good here - I can feel it.

session_synopses.AD: This occurs betwen Lia, Cal and Ronan. There are mixed ADs which occur - when they're arguing about when to stay and go, when they've decided to stay and when they've decided to go.
session_synopses: This occurs after the argument with Lia. If they're leaving for Baldur's Gate he's pretty relaxed about the argument and dismissive of Lia and her concerns. If they're staying in the grove, he's furious and is convinced they'll die here.
session_synopses.Sister: This occurs after the argument betwen Lia and Rolan. Lia is still stewing after the fight. Opportunity to get to know her better and understand the group dynamics.

AD_ShadowDruid_001_DruidLeaderDied_Comba.speaker: Olodan
AD_ShadowDruid_001_DruidLeaderDied_Comba.text: Nature's ruination! You have spoiled everything!

SnakesCourt.speaker: Arabella
SnakesCourt.context: CinematicNodeContext: The druids are holding court. The child stands with a snake guarding her, facing judgment. She cries out an apology.

SnakesCourt.speaker: Rath
SnakesCourt.text: This is madness, Kagha. She's just a...

SnakesCourt.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt.text: A what, Rath? A thief? A poison? A threat?

SnakesCourt.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt.text: I will imprison the devil. And I will cast out every stranger.
SnakesCourt.context: CinematicNodeContext: . |Kagha turns and stares directly at you after the first line,

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: Tsk. That damned nose of yours has gone poking in our business.

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: Shh-shh. No need. It couldn't be helped.

Denouncing.speaker: Rath
Denouncing.text: Kagha! What is the meaning of this?

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: You think yourself quite the spy, don't you? Go on - tell him.

Denouncing.speaker: Player
Denouncing.text: The Shadow Druids are taking over - the circle is overdue some change.

Denouncing.speaker: Rath
Denouncing.text: Shadow Druids? Kagha, have you lost your mind?!

PAD_FoundSecretLocation.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundSecretLocation.text: Odd - someone's cut a notch in the tree there.

Opposed.speaker: Rath
Opposed.text: Mercy on us, Silvanus - mercy, mercy, mercy.

Opposed.speaker: Player
Opposed.text: The child is to blame. She shouldn't have stolen in the first place.

Opposed.speaker: Rath
Opposed.text: Preventable. The sickening result of sickening beliefs.

Opposed.speaker: Rath
Opposed.text: We let this happen. We let this snake replace our leader.

Leader.speaker: Kagha
Leader.text: Go on. Say it. You think I'm a monster.

Leader.speaker: Wyll
Leader.text: Monster? Too kind. A demon, more like.

Leader.speaker: Player
Leader.text: Honestly, I just wanted to see what would happen.

AD_ReactToDeadKid.speaker: Rath
AD_ReactToDeadKid.text: She's dead. Kagha, we are guardians, not killers!

AD_ReactToDeadKid.speaker: Kagha
AD_ReactToDeadKid.text: She knew the danger. She still tried to run.

LeaderPostGoblins.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPostGoblins.text: Finally, we'll be rid of the outlanders' infernal stench.

LeaderPostGoblins.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPostGoblins.text: The last prayer will be spoken and the rite will conclude. When the coming army swarms, the brambles will keep us safe.

LeaderPostGoblins.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPostGoblins.text: I suppose you want thanks. I'm sure the tieflings have plenty.

session_synopses.AD_ShadowDruid_001_DruidLeaderDied_Comba: Leader of the shadow druids ADs in combat.
session_synopses.SnakesCourt: Druids hold court to determine whether or not to lock up a tiefling child for stealing their precious artifact. If you fail to stop them, the child tries to run and is attacked by their guardian snakes.Sagha the druid leader is the main player in this scene. She is machiavellian, and flips to evil should the snakes attack the child.
session_synopses.Denouncing: You have confronted Kagha about being a Shadow Druid. This has initiated the transformation of the rats into shadow druids before your very eyes. The shadow druids welcome the circle into their fold; you have to fight, or convince Kagha to come around, which will be very hard - and even harder if the kid died before. Olodan the shadow druid is their leader; slobbering and sleazy.
session_synopses.PAD_FoundSecretLocation: Player notice the tree that contains Kagha's letter from the Shadow Druids. They might find it by chance or know it was there.The note that sends players here reads like this: [The marks crisscrossing the page don't look scribed so much as slashed.]Kagha.Swamp-docks. Tree. Meet me. Alone.Olodan.
session_synopses.001: Shadow Druid in rat shape. Trying to use speak with animals or animal handling results in nothing.
session_synopses.Opposed: Rath is a human druid opposed to Kagha, who has taken control of the grove in Halsin's absence. He is a kind, determined man, who seeks to keep nature in balance and prevent violence at all costs.
session_synopses.AD_CallWolf: Silver, Rath's wolf companion, is wandering away from him. He calls the wolf back. Patient and affectionate tone.
session_synopses.Leader: Player speaks with Kagha, the secret Shadow druid. Various paths of conversation reflect whether Kagha's actions led to a child's death or not. She may be neutral/Machiavellian or pure evil, depending.
session_synopses.AD_ReactToDeadKid: Rath reacts to the tiefling girl being killed by Sagha's snake. Sagha responds coldly.
session_synopses.AD_KaghaInCombat: Kagha has been outed and is now fighting the players with the Shadow Druids.
session_synopses.LeaderPostGoblins: Kagha's dialogue after the goblins' leaders are all dead and the grove enters the victory state.

AD.speaker: Tracker Worm
AD.text: Minthara's gonna skin us. No one knows about this damn weapon.

AD.speaker: Sharp-Eye Gurza
AD.text: Yeah. She'll kill us dead if we go back without it.

AD.speaker: Warrior Gresh
AD.text: We'll get the druid talking. Grove's got to be full of magic.

AD.speaker: Tracker Torrack
AD.text: That's why I've been stabbin' all the rats. Might be spies.

AD_CapturedGoblin.speaker: Sazza
AD_CapturedGoblin.text: They ain't as friendly as me. Not as clever either. Kill 'em.
AD_CapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: sly, vicious on last two words

session_synopses.AD: A quartet of goblins scouts are torturing a druid they captured in the tunnels, trying to find out the location of a weapon for the Absolute. They expect the other goblins will be bursting in the front gate of the grove any minute, and are unaware the others were defeated.
session_synopses.AD_CapturedGoblin: Sazza tells players to kill other goblins while she is being rescued from the grove

AD_InstrumentStolen.speaker: Alfira
AD_InstrumentStolen.text: Get away from me. I mean it!
AD_InstrumentStolen.context: NodeContext: Player has stolen her dead teacher's instrument. You're upset and yelling at the player.

AD_FullSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong.context: NodeContext: Gently singing. Sad but hopeful.

AD_FullSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong.text: Smile and pain will fade away.

AD_FullSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong.text: Words of mine will turn to ash.

AD_FullSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong.text: When you call the last light down.

AD_FullSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong.text: Moon. Sun. All remind me of your grace.

AD_FullSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong.text: Faith. Care. All the love I can't repay.

AD_FullSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong.text: Moon reminds me of your grace.

AD_FullSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong.text: All the love I can't repay.

AD_FullSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong.text: Rest and know that I will pray.

AD_FullSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong.text: Moon. Sun. All remind me of your grace.

AD_FullSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong.text: Faith. Care. All the love I can't repay.

session_synopses.AD_InstrumentStolen: The bard is sitting. Snaps at the player.
session_synopses.AD_FullSong: The bard is playing on her lute and singing the full song the player helped her compose.

InHideout.speaker: Mirkon
InHideout.text: You came! I have - here! Mol said I should thank you properly. For the harpies.
InHideout.context: CinematicNodeContext: The kid takes something out of his back pocket. If you can suggest that he's holding a pageoff-camera, that would be very good.

InHideout.speaker: Mirkon
InHideout.text: So I wrote you a story!
InHideout.context: CinematicNodeContext: If you can suggest that he's offering the player a page off-camera, that would be very good.

InHideout.speaker: Player
InHideout.text: I've heard enough of your chatter. I don't need more.

InHideout.speaker: Mirkon
InHideout.text: Oh. Umm... okay, I'll... keep it.
InHideout.context: NodeContext: The player refused his gift, saying it's junk

AD_PlayerCharmed.speaker: Player
AD_PlayerCharmed.context: NodeContext: Enchanted - on Karlach node, 'Malcanthet' is pronounced 'MAL-can-fet'

VB_PlayerWarnings.speaker: Player
VB_PlayerWarnings.context: NodeContext: wondering, a little bit in awe.

CharmedVictim_Wildshape.speaker: Mirkon
CharmedVictim_Wildshape.context: CinematicNodeContext: The gnome isn't looking at the player, but in the direction the singing comes from.NodeContext: in awe, entranced. Trying not to disturb the singer.

CharmedVictim_Wildshape.text: CinematicNodeContext: Harpy flies in and perches menacingly on the rock, while she keeps singing
CharmedVictim_Wildshape.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harpy flies in and perches menacingly on the rock, while she keeps singing

CharmedVictim_Wildshape.speaker: Mirkon
CharmedVictim_Wildshape.text: Yes, everything's gonna be fine... once I get there...

VB_FoundHarpyNest.speaker: Player
VB_FoundHarpyNest.text: A giant nest... let's see what we can find.
VB_FoundHarpyNest.context: NodeContext: They enter the nest and smell the offal the harpies left behind.

session_synopses.InHideout: You encounter the kid you saved from the harpies in the children's hideout. He wants to thank you, but is still a little shy.
session_synopses.AD_PlayerCharmed: AD when the player is charmed by the harpies.
session_synopses.AfterHarpyEncounter: Non-critical path. The player has just saved the child from harpies that had enchanted and tried to eat him. He's shy and still scared.
session_synopses.VB_PlayerWarnings: AD played when the player gets close to the harpy situation, warning them that something is amiss.
session_synopses.CharmedVictim_Wildshape: Non-critical path. Unless the player has snapped him out of it, the boy will be enchanted and wanting to get closer to the source of the song.
session_synopses.VB_FoundHarpyNest: VB when the player finds the Harpy's nest
session_synopses.AD_GnomeUncharmed: The tiefling kid wakes up fron his trance, he's panicked and (almost) crying because he's so frightened.

node_data.speaker: Tilses
node_data.text: Keep your steel sharp.

session_synopses: A guard outside the prison who can greet the player on their way in/ out.

GrieflingFriend.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend.text: These druids are insane - why are they doing this?!

ZenBear.speaker: Ormn
ZenBear.text: You ruined it! You ruined Master's grove!

AD_RangerTraderLootingAfterAttack.speaker: Eramas
AD_RangerTraderLootingAfterAttack.text: I can't believe they just left this all behind.

Prodigy.speaker: Rolan
Prodigy.text: Let them come! I'll end them with a single spell.
Prodigy.context: NodeContext: In the middle of a fight - fired up and eager to prove yourself.

Gatekeeper.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper.text: We no longer need to fear a dagger in the back from our kindly hosts. Thank you - for standing by us.

AD_Refugee004.speaker: Toron
AD_Refugee004.text: Bloody druids! You let us in! You gave us shelter!

RitualDruid3.speaker: Inwe
RitualDruid3.context: NodeContext: Emphasis on 'will'. The druids are preparing to attack the tieflings in the grove - and the player.

Tiefling004.speaker: Kaldani
Tiefling004.text: I'll take you all on! Just try me.

Trainee001.speaker: Umi
Trainee001.text: They're supposed to be our friends.
Trainee001.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cowering.NodeContext: Crying. The druids have turned on her people and are trying to slaughter them.

AD_LoversPackingAfterAttack.speaker: Danis
AD_LoversPackingAfterAttack.text: Maybe should I go help defend the wall.

AD_LoversPackingAfterAttack.speaker: Bex
AD_LoversPackingAfterAttack.text: You're no fighter. And I need you here.

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: Keep them away from the kids - please.

Tiefling005.speaker: Pandirna
Tiefling005.text: I couldn't fight the goblins - but I'll make damn sure I get those druids.

AD_ChefAndSonAfterAttack.speaker: Ikaron
AD_ChefAndSonAfterAttack.text: Eerie little black rock. Wonder what it does?

AD_ChefAndSonAfterAttack.speaker: Okta
AD_ChefAndSonAfterAttack.text: Probably rots your fingers off. Leave it be!

RitualDruid2.speaker: Karrik
RitualDruid2.context: NodeContext: The druids are preparing to attack the tieflings in the grove - and the player.

Weaponsmith_PostEA.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_PostEA.text: We managed against the druids, but half our weapons are bent or broken.

Weaponsmith_PostEA.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_PostEA.text: The goblins will run us through unless I get them mended.

AD_Trainer.speaker: Asharak
AD_Trainer.context: NodeContext: Druids are squaring up to his people, ready to start a fight

AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack.speaker: Zaki
AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack.text: Why did Mol let you in, anyway?

AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack.speaker: Alfira
AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack.text: Even your boss can't resist a good story.
AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack.context: NodeContext: Smiling and relaxed - trying to be friendly

DruidGuard001.speaker: Jeorna
DruidGuard001.text: Time to reclaim our grove. Stand in our way and we'll cut you down.
DruidGuard001.context: NodeContext: Combative. Spoken just before the druids turn hostile against the tielfling refugees.

RitualDruid5.speaker: Tahan
RitualDruid5.context: NodeContext: The druids are preparing to attack the tieflings in the grove - and the player.

Protester3.speaker: Xeph
Protester3.text: I was so relieved when we found this place. Now I can't wait to put it behind me.
Protester3.context: NodeContext: Post-battle. Even in victory, attitude's a little defeated.

ProdigyBrother.speaker: Cal
ProdigyBrother.text: Damn it. How many are there?
ProdigyBrother.context: NodeContext: In the middle of the fight - grim and determined.

ProdigySister.speaker: Lia
ProdigySister.context: NodeContext: You'll defend your fellow tieflings to the death - grim, determined and ready to fight

ParentB.speaker: Komira
ParentB.text: Goblins, worgs, gnolls - let them all come. We'll protect our own. We proved that.

ExcitedBoar.speaker: Tusk
ExcitedBoar.text: Start running, two-legs - I'll be right behind you.
ExcitedBoar.context: NodeContext: a threat, not a friendly sentence

AD_ServantPlight.speaker: Arron
AD_ServantPlight.text: Ack. Mistress Kagha said it might come to this...

AD_WeaponsmithAndGuardsAfterAttack.speaker: Rikka
AD_WeaponsmithAndGuardsAfterAttack.text: I'm worried. I don't think we're ready.

AD_WeaponsmithAndGuardsAfterAttack.speaker: Dammon
AD_WeaponsmithAndGuardsAfterAttack.text: Lakrissa's right. Can only do what we can.

SnakeKid.speaker: Arabella
SnakeKid.context: NodeContext: whispered, barely audible, head down

ElevatorBear.speaker: Tuffet
ElevatorBear.context: NodeContext: Second line where she's a bit more awake. The previous line was "You *yawn* woke me up!"

AD_IrritatedTieflingTrainingAfterAttack.speaker: Guex
AD_IrritatedTieflingTrainingAfterAttack.text: Hrah! Do you like that, Kagha?

Protester2.speaker: Amek
Protester2.text: I hope that lot burn in whatever hell they're destined for.
Protester2.context: NodeContext: Post-battle. Still keyed-up and outraged at what's happened.

RitualDruid4.speaker: Elwyn
RitualDruid4.text: I'm sorry. But this must be done.
RitualDruid4.context: NodeContext: The druids are preparing to attack the tieflings in the grove - and the player.

RangerTrader.speaker: Eramas
RangerTrader.text: Thank you for helping us. Seems like there's still a few real adventurers left.

DruidOpposed.speaker: Rath
DruidOpposed.text: We've won, yes, but at what cost? The peace of this grove has been shattered forever.

Protester1.speaker: Rechel
Protester1.text: The druids have gone mad - save yourself!
Protester1.context: NodeContext: Urgent - there's a bloody fight between druids and refugees unfolding in the grove

Scammer.speaker: Nerela
Scammer.text: There's nothing left those rats can take from me.

AD_TraineesAfterAttack.speaker: Gan
AD_TraineesAfterAttack.text: Why didn't those druids like us?

AD_TraineesAfterAttack.speaker: Ide
AD_TraineesAfterAttack.text: No one likes us. Cause we're tieflings.

AD_TraineesAfterAttack.speaker: Ide
AD_TraineesAfterAttack.text: Don't say that. It's their fault, not ours.

Pickpocket.speaker: Silfy
Pickpocket.text: Um... thank you for helping us...
Pickpocket.context: NodeContext: She's thanking the player for fighting against the druids with the tieflings.

AD_LeadersPrepareAfterAttack.speaker: Zevlor
AD_LeadersPrepareAfterAttack.text: Lady down some barricades. We already have the high ground - best to make use of it.

AD_TreeCuttingAfterAttack.speaker: Kaldani
AD_TreeCuttingAfterAttack.text: This one looks to be in good health.
AD_TreeCuttingAfterAttack.context: NodeContext: appraising it for the kind of wood it'd make

RobberKid.speaker: Meli
RobberKid.text: Is it true some of the rats were druids? I used to have a pet rat.

AD_SonOfChef.speaker: Ikaron
AD_SonOfChef.context: NodeContext: The druids that took him and his people in have turned on them and are trying to slaughter them all.

AD_ParentA.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentA.text: Stay close. We'll get through this.
AD_ParentA.context: NodeContext: Whispered - trying to keep everyone calm during the attack.

PickpocketTrader.speaker: Mattis
PickpocketTrader.text: Hiding with the children, huh? I get it.
PickpocketTrader.context: NodeContext: She gets the player wanting to save their own skin by hiding with the children. She's not judging. Said while the druids are attacking.

ServantPlight.speaker: Arron
ServantPlight.text: This is your last chance. Leave.

Tiefling001.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001.text: The druids will kill us - help us, please!
Tiefling001.context: NodeContext: She's about to be attacked.

AD_DruidGuard1.speaker: Jeorna
AD_DruidGuard1.text: Kagha wills it! Silvanus wills it!

AD_Tiefling011.speaker: Zorru
AD_Tiefling011.text: Damn it - they just keep coming!

Trainee003.speaker: Gan
Trainee003.text: There's no druids left for us! No fair!
Trainee003.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands on hips. The druids are dealt with.NodeContext: Childish

Chef.speaker: Okta
Chef.text: Sorry, no gruel on the pot today.

Chef.speaker: Okta
Chef.text: Now that this druid mess is over, I'm having to store up all the rations I can.

Chef.speaker: Okta
Chef.text: Which... isn't much. But we'll make do.

RitualDruid1.speaker: Aelar
RitualDruid1.context: NodeContext: The druids are preparing to attack the tieflings in the grove - and the player.

Stargazer.speaker: Nadira
Stargazer.text: Don't look at me! Those druids are out for blood.

AD_ParentsAfterAttack.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsAfterAttack.context: NodeContext: Trying to calm your wife. Strong and assured.

Griefling.speaker: Arka
Griefling.text: If we can survive the druids, we might survive the goblins.

ServantIntolerant.speaker: Marcoryl
ServantIntolerant.context: NodeContext: Vicious and cruel - you are eager to spill tiefling blood

AD_HideoutLeader.speaker: Zaki
AD_HideoutLeader.context: NodeContext: quiet, terrified, they're hiding from an attack

AD_HideoutLeader.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutLeader.text: I've always protected you, haven't I?
AD_HideoutLeader.context: NodeContext: trying to sound brave, but scared

Tiefling011.speaker: Zorru
Tiefling011.text: Elturel. Hostile druids. Is nowhere safe?

Trainee002.speaker: Ide
Trainee002.text: You better help if the goblins come!
Trainee002.context: NodeContext: A bit lecture-y. The druids are dealt with.

DruidGuard003.speaker: Mino
DruidGuard003.text: You outsiders had your chance to leave. Now blood's going to be spilled.
DruidGuard003.context: NodeContext: Combative. A fight's about to break out.

AD_FleeAfter.speaker: Zorru
AD_FleeAfter.text: Vicious gith. Murderous druids. I've had enough!

AD_ProtestersAfterAttack.speaker: Xeph
AD_ProtestersAfterAttack.text: Still got to face the goblins before we can go anywhere.
AD_ProtestersAfterAttack.context: NodeContext: 'We're not out of the woods'

AD_ProtestersAfterAttack.speaker: Rechel
AD_ProtestersAfterAttack.text: Druids, goblins... and then what? There'll be other things looking to kill us. There always is.

DruidLeader.speaker: Kagha
DruidLeader.text: The brood is restless. The mother strikes!

ScoutCaptive.speaker: Findal
ScoutCaptive.text: You should have left while you could.

Apprentice.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice.text: Better that Master Halsin doesn't see this. It'd break his heart.

ParentA.speaker: Locke
ParentA.text: Dead druids means my daughter Arabella saw some justice. Thank you.
ParentA.context: NodeContext: Exhausted, tired, grieving for your daughter but grateful

session_synopses.GrieflingFriend: Memnos reacts to the druids turning on the tieflings. If the tieflings prevail, he reacts to this also.
session_synopses.ZenBear: This bear is still struck with grief because his master hasn't returned, but he's also incredibly angry because the player has committed a crime.
session_synopses.AD_RangerTraderLootingAfterAttack: Eramas is looking around the adventurers' spot in the Grove for useful stuff for the incoming goblin fight.
session_synopses.Prodigy: Rolan is being Rolan here - full of pride and arrogance, even as he begrudingly admits that the player played a large part in defending them from the druids.
session_synopses.Gatekeeper: Elegis is the gatekeeper for the grove. She is grim but determined to keep her kin safe as the druids attack.
session_synopses.AD_Refugee004: Toron, a tiefling, reacts to the druids attacking him and the other refugees sheltering in the grove.
session_synopses.RitualDruid3: Inwe has stopped chanting as the druids prepare to battle the tieflings in a fight to the death. She's calm and serious - she doesn't want to fight, but she will.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingLeader: Zevlor is a leader who hears commotion between his followers and a rival faction. These lines trigger from when he first hears the noise, investigates, sees a confrontation brewing to when fighting actually starts.
session_synopses.Tiefling004: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.
session_synopses.Trainee001: This dialogue plays during and after a group of druids turn on the tieflings in the grove and attack them. Umi is taken into a secret cave to hide during the druid attack. He's frightened while they are attacking, and clearly shaken afterward.
session_synopses.AD_LoversPackingAfterAttack: Lovers go back to packing after attack on Den.
session_synopses.HideoutLeader: During and after the druid attack, Mol is frustrated and a little anxious rather than scared. If she made a deal with the player, tough and resilient when discussing it.
session_synopses.Bard: Alfira is scared but trying to hold it together during the attack. She is with the children in the hideout. She isn't a fighter but is prepared to lay down her life to protect them. She stays in the hideout with the children afterwards.After the attack, if the player has stolen or broken her instrument she is thankful but wary of the player. Otherwise she is grateful that someone has finally stuck by the tieflings.
session_synopses.Tiefling005: Pandirna is guard who is either 1) sprawled on the ground, unable to move. 2) healed due to the player's help. If she's healed, she is ready for a fight and eager to prove herself and protect those she loved. If she paralyzed, she just wants the player to protect the other tieflings - she's convinced she'll die. If she survives, she thanks the player - knowing it is directly because of them that she survived.
session_synopses.AD_ChefAndSonAfterAttack: Okta is preparing meals for the road and Ikaron is snooping around the hag's corner, against his mother's pleas.
session_synopses.RitualDruid2: Kerrick has stopped chanting as the druids prepare to battle the tieflings in a fight to the death. He's ready to do what needs to be done.
session_synopses.Weaponsmith_PostEA: This dialogue plays either while the druids are attacking the tieflings in the grove, or after the druids have been defeated. During the attack, Dammon fights against the druids. He's provided the tieflings with their weapons, and he hopes they're up to the task. Afterward, he's back at his forge, repairing the weapons that were damaged in the skirmish.
session_synopses.AD_Trainer: Asharak is training kids when he hears commotion breaking out - he investigates to find the druid faction are attacking his people.
session_synopses.AD_YoungLover01: Danis reacts to the tiefling refugees (himself included) being attacked by the druids.
session_synopses.AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack: Tone: People trying to act somewhast normal under grave circumstances. Intreactions are intoned with gravity.The Bard is inside the kid hideout with the rest of the kids, supposedly keeping an eye on them as they are not to go outside the hideout anymore with the incoming goblin attack. Zaki is trying to act older and not scared and Alfira is playing along with it.
session_synopses.DruidGuard001: Jeorna, speaking just before the druids turn hostile against the tielfling refugees.
session_synopses.Kid004: Kid responses related to druid attack.
session_synopses.RitualDruid5: Tahani has stopped chanting as the druids prepare to battle the tieflings in a fight to the death. She's anxious to fight - she sees the tieflings as foreign invaders that need to be driven out.
session_synopses.PetWolf: This wolf is about to attack the other druids. He's full of energy and anticipation.
session_synopses.Protester3: A tiefling refugee reacts to the druids turning hostile against all the tieflings (both during and after battle).
session_synopses.ProdigyBrother: Cal is fighting the people who once hosted them in the grove. He'll do it to protect the tieflings but he hates it - he would much prefer a peaceful resolution.
session_synopses.AD_DruidLeader: Kagha shouts her ADs during the attack phase.
session_synopses.PrisonGuard: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.
session_synopses.ProdigySister: Lia will defend her fellow tieflings to the death. She does not shy away from violence and is prepared to fight ever druid in the grove if it means saving her people.
session_synopses.ParentB: Marrick is hidden alongside the other tieflings during the attack but is unafraid. She is no fighter but if the druids reach her she will fight to her last breath. In her post attack dialogues, if her daughter has died her anger is waning even as she strives to hold onto it - the grief settling in as she realises all the dead druids in the world won't bring her daughter back.If her daughter in the post attack she is full of righteous anger - let anyone in the world take on the tieflings. They won't back down from anything.
session_synopses.ExcitedBoar: This boar was friendly to the player before. Now the player has committed a crime, and the boar feels betrayed. He's about to attack.
session_synopses.AD_ServantPlight: A battle is breaking out between the tieflings and the druids. This druid has previously tried to help the tieflings, and he is more surprised and sad than angry. He prays to his god that what they are doing is right.
session_synopses.AD_WeaponsmithAndGuardsAfterAttack: Dammon is working to supply weapons and armour for the raid while Lakrissa and Rikka bother him during his work.
session_synopses.SnakeKid: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.
session_synopses.ElevatorBear: This bear is about to attack, but she just woke up, and she's still sleepy.
session_synopses.AD_IrritatedTieflingTrainingAfterAttack: Guex is training on his own for the incoming goblin attack. Swinging his sword.
session_synopses.Protester2: A tiefling refugee reacts to the druids turning on him and his companions (both during and post-combat)
session_synopses.RitualDruid4: Elwyn has stopped chanting as the druids prepare to battle the tieflings in a fight to the death. She regrets that this has to happen, but will do what needs to be done.
session_synopses.RangerTrader: This dialogue has two states: getting ready for battle and after the battle.
session_synopses.IrritatedTiefling: Guex reacts to the druids turning on the tieflings in the grove, and  if the tieflings defeat their attackers.
session_synopses.DruidOpposed: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.
session_synopses.Protester1: A tiefling refugee reacts to the conflict with the druids (during and after)
session_synopses.Scammer: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.
session_synopses.AD_TraineesAfterAttack: Trainees are bickering over who would be better to deal with the druids and the bears, after the attack has resolved and the player has taken down the druids.
session_synopses.Pickpocket: This dialogue plays either while the druids are attacking the tieflings in the grove, or after the druids have been defeated. During the attack, Silfy is hidden away with the other tiefling children. She's terrified and thinks a theft may have triggered the attack. Afterward, she's back to her shy self.
session_synopses.AD_LeadersPrepareAfterAttack: Asharak and Zevlor are at the entrance and walking around together as they envision what sort of defense they can mount on the walls.
session_synopses.AD_TreeCuttingAfterAttack: Kaldani wants to cut down some trees after the druid attack
session_synopses.RobberKid: Child pickpocket reacts ot the druid attack, and player's success in that attack.
session_synopses.AD_Tiefling001: ADs when the character is fighting a bunch of druids - she's angry, scared and full of adrenaline.
session_synopses.AD_SonOfChef: These lines play when the druids launch an attack against the tieflings in the druid grove. Ikaron's been on edge for a while, afraid something like this would happen. He doesn't hesitate to fight back - he's had enough of his people getting pushed around.
session_synopses.AD_ParentA: The druid attack has begun. Lock yells for everyone to hide and then quietly reassures the other tieflings around him to keep quiet and stay calm. He is a voice of reason and assurance.
session_synopses.PickpocketTrader: This dialogue plays either while the druids are attacking the tieflings in the grove, or after the druids have been defeated. During the attack, Lim is hidden away with the other tiefling children. She's fairly calm, given the situation - she's used to getting out of binds. Afterward, she's already plotting how she might get out ahead, though she's a bit irked at the player for getting rid of a source of income.
session_synopses.ServantPlight: The player committed a crime, and this druid is extremely disappointed, but doesn't want to attack, so implores the player to leave. He knows a fight will break out in mere minutes.
session_synopses.VoloBear: The bear is about to attack us, because we comitted a crime. Imagine him very angry, his hackles raised and growling.
session_synopses.AD_FoodTrader: Okta is hidden with the other tieflings. She is determined to sacrifice herself to save the others if needs be. The druid attack is on going.
session_synopses.Tiefling001: This dialogue has two states: one where the character is getting attacked and is panicked, and one for after the attack, where she is trying to calm down, but killing other people is making her feel sick.
session_synopses.AD_DruidGuard1: Jeorna, a druid, shouts orders and battle cries after she and her fellow druids turn on the tielfings. Fanatical and aggressive.
session_synopses.YoungLover02: Bex reacts to the druids attacking the tieflings.
session_synopses.Wyll: Wyll's dialogue before and after Druid attack state. This is secondary recruitment state, if you trigger druid attack before he is recruited.
session_synopses.DruidGuard002: Maggran (the bear-druid guard, now in human form again) shouts aggresively before he and the other druids turn hostile on the players and the tiefling refugees.
session_synopses.AD_Tiefling011: Zorru calls out his reactions in ADs during different states of the druid attack.
session_synopses.GruntingKid: Tiefling kid who communicates by grunting during and after druid attack
session_synopses.Tiefling010: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.
session_synopses.Trainee003: This dialogue plays during and after a group of druids turn on the tieflings in the grove and attack them. Gan is taken into a secret cave to hide during the druid attack. She's full of bravado - she's had training with a wooden sword, and she's eager to show off. She doesn't quite grasp the seriousness of the situation.
session_synopses.Chef: This dialogues occurs after the druid attack. Okta is relieved that they survived and drained from being tierrified (not that she would admit it). She's trying to be tough and no nonsense about the entire event.
session_synopses.ServantGnome: Loic has lost all his patience in this dialogue - you commited a crime, and he's really angry and disgusted. This happens right before he starts to attack the player.
session_synopses.RitualDruid1: Aelar has stopped chanting as the druids prepare to battle the tieflings in a fight to the death. He's ready to do what needs to be done.
session_synopses.Stargazer: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.
session_synopses.AD_ParentsAfterAttack: Parents are mourning the death of their child after the druid attack. They hang around the grove and wonder what will follow.
session_synopses.Griefling: Arka reacts to the druids attacking the tieflings in the grove.
session_synopses.ServantIntolerant: Marcoryl is only too delighted to fight the tieflings. This is during the druid attack and he is eager to put down these 'hellspawn.'
session_synopses.AD_HideoutLeader: Two scared young tieflings: Mol protects Zavi during the druid attack
session_synopses.Tiefling011: Zorru one-liner reacting to druid attack state. Zorru has a proven dislike of githyanki, so those reactions are a bit different.
session_synopses.Trainee002: This dialogue plays during and after a group of druids turn on the tieflings in the grove and attack them. Ide is taken into a secret cave to hide during the druid attack. She's frightened while they are attacking, but shakes it off quickly afterward. She's just impressed that the player could take on so many druids.
session_synopses.DruidGuard003: Spoken just before the Druids turn hostile against the tiefling refugees.
session_synopses.AD_FleeAfter: AD when Zorru flees attack on grove. He's fearful and running for his life.
session_synopses.AD_ProtestersAfterAttack: Three tieflings (who had previously been protesting their treatment at the hands of their druid hosts) react to the aftermath of a bloody confrontation between tiefling refugees and druids. In this instance the druids have all been killed. The refugees are shaken and angry.
session_synopses.DruidLeader: NPC Dialog during the Druid Attack state, before the Druids turn hostile. In case player clicks on druid before hostility is fully set.
session_synopses.ScoutCaptive: A druid we saved from some goblins earlier - regretfully telling us it's too late to leave - his people are going to kill us.lNPC Dialog during the Druid Attack state, before the Druids turn hostile.
session_synopses.Apprentice: NPC Dialog during the Druid Attack state, before the Druids turn hostile.
session_synopses.ParentA: Locke is hidden alongside multiple other tieflings as the druids attack the grove. In his post attack lines he is grim and depressed if his daughter is dead (even as he thanks the player.) If his daughter is alive, he is saddened that violence occured but thankful the player was there to help.

Village_Trespassing.text: You sniffing where you ain't oughta be, friend. Might have to take that nose.
Village_Trespassing.context: NodeContext: Cheerful threat - you've been found sneaking in a village where you shouldn't be

session_synopses.Village_Trespassing: This guard has come upon you sneaking through a village her force is occupying. She was bored and sees you as a potential source of fun (ie, someone to murder/bully).  Defaulting to she, but numerous goblins could deliver this dialogue as it's a dynamic crime one.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Tracker
node_data.text: A drow...? Erm, I mean, glory to you, True Soul.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Grovelling

session_synopses: A goblin tracker stands guard as their leader torments a captive. If the player interferes, they turn hostile (unless the player is a drow - in this case the goblins are servile and afraid).

AD_AtCaveEntrance.speaker: Andrick
AD_AtCaveEntrance.text: Bloody Ed. I wish he'd listened.

Cultist002_InCave.speaker: Brynna
Cultist002_InCave.context: NodeContext: Heartbroken. Her other brother died in the owlbear fight. Trying to hold it together.

Cultist002_InCave.speaker: Brynna
Cultist002_InCave.text: He's... with Edowin now, right? He's with the Absolute.

Cultist002_InCave.speaker: Player
Cultist002_InCave.text: Perhaps. Who truly knows the ways of our god?

Cultist002_InCave.speaker: Brynna
Cultist002_InCave.text: I suppose... I suppose the Absolute keeps some mysteries from us all.
Cultist002_InCave.context: NodeContext: Trying very hard not to cry.

Cultist002_InCave.speaker: Brynna
Cultist002_InCave.text: What would you have of me now, True Soul?
Cultist002_InCave.context: NodeContext: Trying to rally. Trying to be brave.

Cultist002_InCave.speaker: Player
Cultist002_InCave.text: Find the nearest stronghold and report on your mission.

Cultist002_InCave.speaker: Brynna
Cultist002_InCave.text: Edowin told us there was a camp of faithful goblins nearby. It'll do me good to be among allies.

Cultist002_InCave.speaker: Brynna
Cultist002_InCave.context: NodeContext: Saying goodbye to the player. She means it.

session_synopses.AD_AtCaveEntrance: Two junior members of a cult have been sent to hunt the wild creature that killed their superior. They've found its nest, but are reluctant to proceed inside and face the beast.
session_synopses.Cultist002_InCave: Novice Brynna. a junior member of the cult of the Absolute, has been sent by hersupposed superior to attack an owlbear - a wild creature that killed another cultist. She reacts to the monster's presence before attacking it, then seeks orders from the player once it is dead.
session_synopses.AD_OwlbearCubResolution: Two cult novices, believing you to be their superior, react to your decsion to spare a wild anima.

VB_FindWeakWall.speaker: Player
VB_FindWeakWall.text: A wonder this shoddy wall hasn't already collapsed.

PAD_NatureCheckOutcome.speaker: Player
PAD_NatureCheckOutcome.text: If only I knew where to find some.

session_synopses.VB_FindWeakWall: Player finds a weak wall. Something's behind it.
session_synopses.PAD_NatureCheckOutcome: Player is commenting on a rare ingredient needed for crafting a powerful weapon. Sussur bark can only be found in the Underdark.

AD_MissingPoster.speaker: Narrator
AD_MissingPoster.text: *Missing children: Maggie Terrens, Marcus Terrens, Mathen Deetch, Rochelle Kirk*

session_synopses.AD_MissingPoster: A faded poster of missing children in an abandoned village, indicating an earlier Dark Justiciar abduction.

001.speaker: Andrick
001.text: Bottoms up, eh? These little lads snagged some pretty decent drink!

002.speaker: Brynna
002.text: So glad to see you safely arrived. We haven't found the weapon yet, but it's good to be among allies. Even if they're a bit... unusual.
002.context: NodeContext: A respectful greeting to the player, who she believes is a superior.

session_synopses.001: Novice Andrick, a junior member of the cult of the Absolute, currently standing guard in the goblin camp. If the player met and won him over previously in the forest, he'll refer to this and speak deferentially.
session_synopses.002: Novice Brynna, a junior member of the cult of the Absolute, currently standing guard in the goblin camp. If the player met and won her over previously in the forest, she'll refer to this and speak deferentially.

VB_EggPickedUp.speaker: Player
VB_EggPickedUp.context: NodeContext: Impressed - the egg they've just acquired is very large. (That of an owlbear - a large beast. The egg has been found inside its cave nesting ground).

VB_EnterCave.speaker: Player
VB_EnterCave.text: That stench... dead owlbear prey, no doubt.
VB_EnterCave.context: NodeContext: Upon entering the den of a carnivorous beast. Rotting, half-eaten prey are strewn about. The player previously identified the beast as an owlbear.

VB_CubResolution_1P.speaker: Player
VB_CubResolution_1P.text: At least it won't suffer anymore.
VB_CubResolution_1P.context: NodeContext: Reasoning decision to kill an orphaned owlbear cub

CMB_Enrage.speaker: Owlbear
CMB_Enrage.context: CinematicNodeContext: Charges to attack.NodeContext: Horrified and enraged

VB_LastCub.speaker: Player
VB_LastCub.text: A lone cub isn't much of a threat...

VB_LastCub.speaker: Player
VB_LastCub.text: Not without its mother by its side. What now?

session_synopses.VB_EggPickedUp: The player discovers an intact owlbear egg (think something the size of an ostrich egg) and makes an impressed remark. If there's an adult owlbear nearby, the player will remark that interferring with the egg will put them in danger.
session_synopses.VB_EnterCave: The player enters a cave that houses an owlbear - a large, aggressive wild beast. They might comment on the stench of half-eaten prey, or note that some tracks they discovered lead into the cave.
session_synopses.VB_CubResolution_1P: The players comment briefly on their decision to let an orphaned owlbear cub live or not.
session_synopses.CMB_Enrage: In SwA, the owlbear speaks like a human. Her voice is deep and threatening - in this dialogue specifically, she is enraged.Players encounter an owlbear mother and her cub in a cave. This dialogue plays if players smash her egg or kill her cub in front of her.
session_synopses.VB_LastCub: After killing an adult owlbear, combat ends as the player notes that the surviving owlbear cub doesn't pose much of a threat to them.

BridgeSign.speaker: Player
BridgeSign.context: NodeContext: Reading a signpost. Elturel pronounced 'ELL-tur-ELL'. Baldur pronounced 'Ball-dur'

Combat_GnomeGoblin1_002.speaker: Fezzerk
Combat_GnomeGoblin1_002.text: The Absolute's got my back - I ain't afraid of nothin'!

Combat_GnomeGoblin1_003.speaker: Fezzerk
Combat_GnomeGoblin1_003.text: The worms'll feast on your sorry carcass when I'm done with you!

session_synopses.BridgeSign: Sign near a stone bridge linking the Druid Grove to the Ruined Village. Establishes where the player is in relation to the city of Baldur's Gate. After reading this, natives of the city may pass comment, noting that they know broadly where they are now.

InteractWithWell.speaker: Narrator
InteractWithWell.text: *Apart from an overgrowth of moss, the well looks unremarkable.*

InteractWithWell.speaker: Narrator
InteractWithWell.text: *Dry stones line the wall, but the darkness below is impenetrable.*

PAD_WebWarning.speaker: Player
PAD_WebWarning.context: NodeContext: General comment. Less aware of any danger.

session_synopses.InteractWithWell: Dialogue when first interacting with the well.
session_synopses.PAD_WebWarning: PAD when seeing webs. Either just complaining about the fact that the spiderwebs are everywhere, or realising touching them could be dangerous.

session_synopses.PAD_PlayerHeardEttercapWarning: The player has touched a spider web and heard an ettercap scream in response. They realise the ettercap has found out they are there.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Devout
node_data.text: I ain't the one you need - talk to Fezzerk.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Fez-erk

session_synopses: The party comes across a trio of goblins who've captured a gnome and have turned to tormenting him - they've tied him to windmill sail and are rotating him for their amusement. The party can try to intervene and save the gnome, possiblyby using their mind-influencing powers or otherwise convincing the goblins they're on the same side. GnomeGobllin3 is one of two lackeys, there to support the leading goblin, Fezzerk. She's abrupt and aggressive to most, though servile and meek if the player happens to be a drow.

PAD_NoticeStashSeal.speaker: Player
PAD_NoticeStashSeal.text: There's magic keeping this chest sealed; I can feel its aura.

PAD_TriggeredTrap.speaker: Player
PAD_TriggeredTrap.text: Agh! This thing won't yield its contents easily...
PAD_TriggeredTrap.context: NodeContext: Reacting to a moderate jolt of pain.

session_synopses.PAD_PickupPrayerSheet: The player comments after picking up an old prayer sheet. They may or may not recognise that it could help them unlock a magically sealed chest.
session_synopses.PAD_NoticeStashSeal: Following a passive arcana check, the player comments that a chest discovered at a shrine has a spell cast over it, protecting its contents.
session_synopses.PAD_TriggeredTrap: The player reacts to a magically-locked chest injuring them upon attempting to open it without disabling the protections.
session_synopses.PAD_OpenStashWithPrayer: The player passes comment after they manage to open a magically sealed chest by reciting a prayer they found. If Shadowheart or a worshipper of Shar is speaking, the prayer does nothing.

session_synopses.AD_Dog: Scratch the courier's dog barks and growls as you near him, warning you away. Sound effects only.

PAD_PlayerTriedToTakeTome.speaker: Player
PAD_PlayerTriedToTakeTome.text: Sorry, but that book is spoken for - by me.

session_synopses.PAD_FindBook: PAD when you pick up 'The Necromancy of Thay' (DangerousBook_Tome.lsj). Character might have a sense that the book is evil or just be curious about what it might contain.
session_synopses.PAD_PlayerTriedToTakeTome: Plays if the player tries to take DangerousBook (The Necromancy of Thay) out of their companion's inventory when the book is bound to that companion (and therefore locked to their inventory). The PAD will play and the tome won't be removed. Only valid for Astarion, Gale, who want to keep the book and won't let anyone take it from them.

PAD_NotReturning.speaker: Player
PAD_NotReturning.text: You can't summon a dead ogre, it turns out.

session_synopses.PAD_NotReturning: Player Blows ogre horn, but no one comes.

node_data.speaker: Chock
node_data.text: Friend. No eat friend.

session_synopses: Ogre in the middle of a meal. Dumb as a box of rocks.

node_data.speaker: Fank
node_data.text: Chicken?

node_data.speaker: Fank
node_data.text: No. You not chicken.

session_synopses: Ogre in the middle of a meal. Dumb as a box of rocks. Mistakes you momentarily for a chicken.

AD_Combat_Goblins_Caster_01.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
AD_Combat_Goblins_Caster_01.text: Gonna add your ears to my collection once you're dead!

PatrollingGoblin_AD_JoinOgreFight.speaker: Goblin Brawler
PatrollingGoblin_AD_JoinOgreFight.text: Oi! You fightin' them ogres, then you fightin' with me!

session_synopses.PatrollingGoblin_AD_JoinOgreFight: Goblin near the ogres joins the fight if player gets into combat with them.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: A wine bottle? A scholar with good taste, perhaps.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Or maybe a bit of a drinking problem.

session_synopses.PAD: This is a booster for FOR. The player finds a book hiding a secret bottle of wine.

AD_Subordinates.speaker: Goblin Warrior
AD_Subordinates.text: And the others getting drunk off their choppers in camp.

AD_BossAndSubordinate.speaker: Tracker Slice
AD_BossAndSubordinate.context: NodeContext: search the place, don't bother me

AD_BossAndSubordinate.speaker: Tracker Slice
AD_BossAndSubordinate.text: And you got nothing to show for it but your own arse.

AD_GoblinsLooting.speaker: Tracker Slice
AD_GoblinsLooting.context: NodeContext: looking for results from subordinates she perceives as being idiots

session_synopses.AD_Subordinates: Frustrated goblins searching a derelict building, finding little. They're bitter they can't be getting drunk in camp with the others.
session_synopses.AD_BossAndSubordinate: Goblins scouting an abandoned village-- boss is tired of his subordinates.
session_synopses.AD_GoblinsLooting: Frustrated goblins looting an empty derelict buiilding

AD_FoundJournal.speaker: Player
AD_FoundJournal.text: Someone's diary. Might explain what happened here.

session_synopses.AD_FoundJournal: The party finds a old diary in the ruined schoolhouse of an abandoned village. They comment that it might shed some light on what happened here.

AD_Plead.speaker: Barcus Wroot
AD_Plead.context: NodeContext: Barcus screaming while swining on the windmill

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Urrrgh... magga cammara - those pustulent thugs!
node_data.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/actor context - the deep gnome sways dizzilyNodeContext: 'Magga cammara' pronounced 'Mag-ah cam-ah-rah'. Gnomish exclamation meaning 'by the stones'.
Barcus the deep gnome is suffering some grogginess after spinning on the sail of a windmill for the last while.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Well - get on with it.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Still a little out of sorts after his ordeal spinning on a windmill, now a mixture of resigned and annoyed. He's expecting you to extort him now.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You seem a little confused.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Get on with what?

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: I'm a deep gnome, you're a drow. You helped me, now you plan to enslave me.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: That's not what I want.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: What, then? Torture? Bloodsport? Or perhaps just a good old-fashioned walloping?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You owe me nothing.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Nothing?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'd rather know how you got caught.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: My own fault, really. I should have dropped my pack and outrun those bastards. Alas.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Take my pack if you can find it. The only reason those goblins caught me was its weight. I'll travel lightly from now on.
node_data.context: InternalNodeContext: Has not offered pack yet.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You're a little far from home for a deep gnome.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Ignorance is alive and well, it seems! Deep gnomes aren't restricted to the Underdark, you know - I've lived in Baldur's Gate for years.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Testily

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: I'm in search of a friend. I fear he's in trouble. He had this locket, see, that I gave him years ago before leaving home.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: He talks about the locket but doesn't have it on him to show the player

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: I found it around the neck of a thug in Baldur's Gate. It was speckled with blood, my friend nowhere to be found.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: He talks about the locket but doesn't have it on him to show the player

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: But I still have hope. I have reason to believe he's in the Underdark. Hopefully I'll pick up his trail from there.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: He talks about the locket but doesn't have it on him to show the player

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: I always help my friends.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks player up and down judgementally, player should wonder 'is he talking about me?'InternalNodeContext: He hasn't given player the pack yet.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: On that note, I bid thee farewell. If we should meet again... well, we will have met again.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: He says his goodbyes, turns and walks away

TiedUp.speaker: Barcus Wroot
TiedUp.text: Come on! What are you waiting for?!
TiedUp.context: NodeContext: The gnome grows exasperated and panicky over the player's delay in cutting him free.

TiedUp.speaker: Barcus Wroot
TiedUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: The gnome is tied to the (stationary) sail of a wind, begging to be cut free by the player. He's close to the ground and within normal speaking range.NodeContext: Urgent, panicked. The gnome begs to be untied from the sail of a windmill. The sail is at the lowermost part of its rotation in relation to the ground, and the gnome is within normal speaking range.

TiedUp.speaker: Player
TiedUp.context: NodeContext: Incredulous. His good samaritan seems to be haggling for a reward before even freeing him.

TiedUp.speaker: Barcus Wroot
TiedUp.context: NodeContext: Impatient. He's used to being extorted.

AD_UnfortunateGnomePikeFail.speaker: Player
AD_UnfortunateGnomePikeFail.context: NodeContext: The player mutters to themselves as they struggle to untie a bound hostage in need of aid.

session_synopses.AD_Plead: Fezzerk the goblin calls up to his captive, Barcus Wroot, who is being spun on the blade of a windmill, mocking his efforts to attract help.
session_synopses: The player speaks to a deep gnome after freeing him from some goblins, who'd had him tied to the sail of a windmill. The player discovers that the deep gnome travelled to the region as he learned his old friend is in danger. By way of thanks, he provides the player with the means to craft smokepowder, an explosive item. He then leaves for the Underdark in search of his friend. There, the player may encounter him again.
session_synopses.AD: If the player gets the windmill to stop spinning, then clicks Barcus, Barcus will get these lines. Barcus will be impatient, mistrustful of the player, but still in need of player's help.
session_synopses.TiedUp: The player has stopped the windmill from rotating and can now cut Barcus Wroot, the captive gnome, free from its sails. They can do this immediately, or else demand payment first, much to the gnome's frustration.
session_synopses.AD_RotatingFasterReaction: Said while being spun faster on the pane of a windmill. Should be in a panic.
session_synopses.AD_UnfortunateGnomePikeFail: Player failed to untie Barcus from the windmill.

VB_Bookcase.speaker: Player
VB_Bookcase.text: Hmm. Scratch marks on the floor...
VB_Bookcase.context: NodeContext: Pondering, investigative. Noticed a potential clue in an abandoned house.

VB_ReadLedger.speaker: Player
VB_ReadLedger.text: It says there's a cellar here somewhere.

VB_Mirror.speaker: Player
VB_Mirror.context: NodeContext: Pondering, investigative. They just detected something strange that they can't put their finger on.

MagicMirror.speaker: Ornate Mirror
MagicMirror.context: NodeContext: The voice is sharp, cracked and broken, with a jagged cadence.

QuasitSummon.text: Argh. Shit-piddling toe-rag. Never summon Shovel. Never feed Shovel. Now call Shovel?!

QuasitSummon.speaker: Narrator
QuasitSummon.text: *You recognise the tiny fiend - a quasit. Wicked creatures often used as familiars.*

session_synopses.VB_Bookcase: The player is exploring a ruined house that once belonged to a rural doctor. As they look around, they realise that the home's resident was in fact a wizard, laying low and conducting his own secret experiments while maintaining his cover as a doctor. Here, the player discovers a clue that leads to the wizard's secret lab.
session_synopses.VB_ReadLedger: The player comments that a ledger they just read suggests the existence of a cellar; one they haven't found yet.
session_synopses.VB_Mirror: The player is exploring a ruined house that once belonged to a rural doctor. As they look around, they realise that the home's resident was in fact a wizard, laying low and conducting his own secret experiments while maintaining his cover as a doctor. Here, the player notices something odd about a mirror, but they can't quite figure out what (they're in fact detecting the energy of a magical trap that resides within the mirror).
session_synopses.MagicMirror: Player finds a talking mirror that seems to be guarding a door to its old master's secret room. It doesn't recognise you as its master, so it challenges you with three questions to see if you're  friend or foe. If you get the questions wrong, it activates a trap to try and kill you. The mirror hasn't been used in a long time - its master died years ago. The mirror speaks in a cracked, broken voice.
session_synopses.QuasitSummon: The quasit is a summon that has information about the Thayan cellar. She's alittle shithead who loves nothing more than cutting people up and being an arsehole.

CheckpointGuards.speaker: Goblin Warrior
CheckpointGuards.text: Go on - more of us inside.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: Git over there. Surround 'em, like.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gesturing to the other goblinsNodeContext: In a loud whisper

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Keep quiet.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: Oi! You just walked into the wrong town.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Pointing at playerNodeContext: Half-shouting, smug.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: Don't bother runnin'. My archers got decent aim and plenty of arrows.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Stand down. Now.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: You're a True Soul... M-my mistake, your grace.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: ShockedNodeContext: Threatening a true soul is BAD NEWS

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: You'll get no more trouble from us, promise.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: BowsNodeContext: Groveling

CheckpointGuardsWarning.speaker: Goblin Sharp-Eye
CheckpointGuardsWarning.context: NodeContext: We caught him idling at the entrance of a checkpoint. Not trying very hard with the lie.

AD_StartedCombat.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
AD_StartedCombat.text: You must got a death wish, sneakin' around in my town.

session_synopses.CheckpointGuards: This goblin is guarding the entrance to a town his squad have occupied. The residents are long-dead, the town abandoned, and so he's taken it upon himself to rechristen the village as 'Bogrot'.
session_synopses.PAD_SpottedAmbush: This PAD plays if players pass a successful Perception check when entering an abandoned village. Goblins are sneaking around in the village, setting up an ambush.
session_synopses: This dialogue triggers when players enter a village being guarded by goblins. The goblins are on rooftops - the player may either be on the ground or on the rooftops with them (if they've snuck in). If the player has passed a perception check beforehand, the dialogue starts while the goblins are still getting into place for an ambush. Otherwise, the goblins are already in place, surrounding the player.If the player is not a drow, the goblins will attack the player at the end of the dialogue unless players can talk them out of it.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuardsWarning: Backup guard protecting the entrance to a village the goblins have seized

Ogre_Dead.speaker: Narrator
Ogre_Dead.text: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*

Bugbear_Dead.speaker: Player
Bugbear_Dead.text: Were you alone when you died?

session_synopses.Ogre_Dead: Butthir the ogre has been killed - you are now speaking with her corpse.
session_synopses.Bugbear_Dead: A dialogue with the bugbear's corpse after a player killed him. 'Butters' is Buthir, the ogre he loves.

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: Look what we got here - another little birdie wantin' to fly!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/look-at context - Fezzerk notices us and calls out to his cronies. (The line is addressed to the goblin raider and scavenger, but Fezzerk's attention is broadly held by the player.NodeContext: Cruel bravado.The goblin sees the player approach and boldly announces it to his cronies - he thinks some fresh victims have just turned up.

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: Yehehueh! Flap those wings some more, an' I'll feed you a worm!
node_data.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/look-at context - Fezzerk calls out to taunt his deep gnome prisoner, who rotates on the sail of a windmill a short-moderate distance off.NodeContext: Greatly amused. A schoolyard bully tormenting the little kid. Projecting his voice a little (Fezzerk calls out to taunt his deep gnome prisoner, who rotates on the sail of a windmill a short-moderate distance off.)
'Yehehueh!' = Fezzerk's distinct laugh (a raspy, mean-spirited slur of a laugh)

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: An' you - hope you got a stomach fer heights!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin turns back to the player (if the gnome inclusion line triggered - otherwise he's facing the player the whole time.)NodeContext: Confident, unpleasant. Turning his attention to the player to deliver a threat.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'm not looking for trouble - just want to pass by.

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: Heh, funny. That's what our birdie wanted.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Mocking. Refers to the player's previous statement ('I don't want trouble - just want to pass by').

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: ...Release me this instant, you beasts!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Context - the deep gnome yells at his captors as he swings into earshotNodeContext: Panicked, angry. Issuing an ultimatum even though he has no means of following through on it.

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: 'Less you wanna join him up there, you'd best pay the toll.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The lead goblin looks at his hands and tries to calculate a figure with his fingers.NodeContext: Fezzerk mockingly refers to the deep gnome's predicament as he threatens the player. 'Passing by' refers to rotating on a windmill rather than safe passage through the area, in his book.

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: Cough it up! ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
node_data.context: InternalNodeContext: The idea is the goblin is a bit dim greedy and throwing out a stupidly high number.NodeContext: Fezzerk declares his price. (A ridiculously high sum - questionable whether he truly knows how absurd a demand this is)

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'm going to pay nothing, and you and your cronies are going to leave.
True

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: Y-you're a True Soul... I didn't know. Wouldn't dare question you, never!

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Your blood runs quicker, feeding the gnawing absence at the centre of your mind.*

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: We'll, erm, we'll leave you to it.

AD_InvestigateMill.speaker: Fezzerk
AD_InvestigateMill.text: Our birdy flew away! Go check 'round back!
AD_InvestigateMill.context: NodeContext: Surprised and suspicious.The windmill that the goblins are using to torment their captive accelerated and launched the gnome through the air.

AD_UnfortunateGnomeGone.speaker: Fezzerk
AD_UnfortunateGnomeGone.text: Look's like the fun's over. C'mon, let's see who else we can snatch.
AD_UnfortunateGnomeGone.context: NodeContext: Calling to his assembled goblin cronies - 'c'mon fellas, let's wrap it up here.'

Dead.speaker: Fezzerk
Dead.context: NodeContext: A cryptic, fragmented croak, spoken by a temporarily-resurrected corpse.

Dead.speaker: Fezzerk
Dead.context: NodeContext: A cryptic, fragmented croak, spoken by a temporarily-resurrected corpse.

session_synopses: The party comes across a trio of goblins who've captured a gnome and have turned to tormenting him - they've tied him to a windmill and are watching him spin around. The party can try to intervene and save the gnome, possibly using a cult symbol of authority as a way to convince the goblins, if they have it. FOR_GnomeGoblin_1 (Fezzerk) is the leader of the goblins and does most of the talking. If the player is a drow, the goblins will be much more nervous and easier to intimidate. At times, the captive goblin pipes up from the windmill, loudly pleading or berating his captors.
session_synopses.AD_InvestigateMill: Some goblins tormenting a gnome tied to a windmill are surprised when it stops rotating.
session_synopses.AD_UnfortunateGnomeGone: The goblins are leaving after witnessing their captive gnome get launched from the blade of a windmill at high speed. Now that their amusement's been catapulted away, they have no reason to linger.
session_synopses.Dead: A speak with dead dialogue with a slain goblin, Fezzerk. As he's been just temporarily resurrrected from the afterlife, he speaks in slow, cryptic, fragmented phrases. From him, the player can gain a little insight into their hostage-taking activities. If Fezzerk recognises the player as his killer, he won't speak at all.

AD_Cultists.speaker: Andrick
AD_Cultists.text: I can't stop the bleeding, Bry.

AD_Cultists.speaker: Brynna
AD_Cultists.text: Press the wound. Not like that!

session_synopses.AD_Cultists: A brother and sister are worried, trying to figure out how to help their older brother (True Soul) Edowin. He's quickly fading. They are lost and lone, but haven't lost faith in the Absolute.

session_synopses.AD_Occupied: A Flaming Fist searching a burning building for survivors. This AD is triggered when the player tries to interact with them, but they are unavailable for dialogue.

PAD_FoundKey.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundKey.text: The corpse mentioned a key... this must be the one.

AD_RefugeeAlarm.context: NodeContext: Calling for help to companions nearby

session_synopses.PAD_FoundKey: Lines spoken when the player spots a key in the undergrowth near a tollhouse. Different variations depending on what the player already knows about the key.
session_synopses.AD_RefugeeAlarm: A paladin calls to their companions when they see hostile players.

DesireDoor.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
DesireDoor.text: I'm trapped! Someone, open this door!

DesireDoor.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
DesireDoor.text: The key must be with the innkeep. Please - hurry!

session_synopses.DesireDoor: You approach a door inside the burning building. Someone is trapped behind it.

AD_Searching.speaker: Benryn
AD_Searching.text: She's alive. I know she is.

PAD_TooHeavy.speaker: Player
PAD_TooHeavy.context: CinematicNodeContext: You click on the beam and you lift it or you don't (there is no animation or cut scene) so maybe mocap of the player's face looking frustrated...?NodeContext: You've just tried to life something and it's too heavy for you.

session_synopses.AD: This AD plays when Benryn is stuck beneath a fallen beam within a burning building. He is crying out for help - but coughing as he does so, as the building is still on fire.
session_synopses.AD_Rescued: This AD plays after the player has safely exited the burning inn with Benryn in tow. He is shocked by the scene he sees in the courtyard - blood and corpses everywhere.
session_synopses.AD_Searching: Benryn is searching for his wife in the wreckage left behind by a goblin attack on an inn. She's dead, but he doesn't know it yet.He's on the edge of total panic, but keeping it together enough to try to find her.
session_synopses.PAD_TooHeavy: Player's trying to lift the beams off the half-elf, has previously failed the skill check, and cannot enter interactive dialogue. There is no cutscene or animation - you lift it or you don't - the half-elf is just suddenly free. In this PAD they failed the check and can't lift it.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: There are Harper and druid symbols on their equipment - an interesting pair.

session_synopses.PAD: This is a booster for PLA. The player comes across a pair of old skeletons with harper and druid equipment. A successful history skill check will reveal these two were probably part of the Harper/druid alliance that fought against Ketheric's army of Shar. If the player has seen the frescos in the Druid's Circle of the Den depicting the battle between the Sharran troops and the Harpers/Druids, they will automatically jump to the 'Success' node.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Scratches that size... something powerful made these.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Perhaps it's some artist trying to make a statement.

session_synopses.PAD: This is a booster for PLA. The player comes across deep scratches in rock. Passing an Arcana check reveals the creature responsible to be a dragon.

Hyena_002.speaker: Hyena
Hyena_002.text: Hey. Hi. You're here. What're you, then?

Hyena_002.speaker: Player
Hyena_002.text: I'm a god, walking in mortal flesh.

Hyena_002.speaker: Hyena
Hyena_002.text: What does godmeat taste like? I... I gotta know.

session_synopses.Gnoll_FangOfYeenoghu_01: A Fang of Yeenoghu (magically gifted gnoll) communicates with a barking hyena-like laugh
session_synopses.Gnoll_Ranger_01: An aggressive gnoll lurks outside a cave where prey are hiding
session_synopses.Hyena_002: A hyena with a pack of gnolls is anxious and curious about players who get close enough to speak without being attacked by the rest of the pack
session_synopses.Gnoll_Ranger_02: An aggressive gnoll lurks outside a cave where prey are hiding
session_synopses.Gnoll_Ranger_03: A gnoll in a pack cackles as it waits to attack prey
session_synopses.Gnoll_Ranger_04: A gnoll pack-member lurks outside a cave, gnawing body of a dead Zhentarim agent.
session_synopses.Gnoll_FangOfYeenoghu_01_AD: Gnoll idle sounds that play as this gnolls performs blood ritual over the dead Zhentarim agent's body: bites its teeth into the flesh and rips it apart howling in frenzy.
session_synopses.GnollRanger04_AD: Gnoll idle sounds that play as this gnolls fest on dead Zhentarim agent's body. Cackle and growl as with other gnolls, crunching is bones cracking as it eats the corpse, 'chew' is as it devours flesh,
session_synopses.GnollRanger03_AD: Gnoll idle sounds that play as part of a pack of the monsters waits near a cave entrance where prey are hiding

node_data.speaker: Fist Recruit Pavel
node_data.text: We have to get them out!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standing, facing the playerInternalNodeContext: Desire is behind a sea of flames.

session_synopses: This dialogue can happen in two phases: while pushing agianst rubble outside of the inn, or in a more generic setting (either searching the inn or clearing rubble).A Flaming Fist trying to force their way inside of a burning inn. They can hear someone inside - they believe it might be a Duke of Baldur's Gate, who they were sent to guard on his way to Elturel. Instead, they found the inn burning, its staff and guests murdered by goblins and drow in the night.

session_synopses.AD_AlertingYapping: After hyena sees the player, before running and calling other gnolls, it skips it's first turn in combat nervously yapping.
session_synopses.AD_CallingHowl: After hyena sees the player, it runs to the nearby pack of gnolls and howls to get their attention.

session_synopses.Dead: A Flaming Fist initially trying to put out the fires at Waukeen's Rest, an inn that was attacked by goblins and drow in the night. If killed, she can be interrogated about what she was looking for - in this case, the missing Duke Ravengard.

AvatarKarlachAfterEnrage.speaker: Karlach
AvatarKarlachAfterEnrage.text: Maybe I went a little too far...

AvatarKarlachAfterEnrage.speaker: Karlach
AvatarKarlachAfterEnrage.text: Ah, fuck that. Fire's really going for broke, though.

AvatarKarlachAfterEnrage.speaker: Karlach
AvatarKarlachAfterEnrage.text: Bloody engine isn't cooling down, is it. Guess it wasn't made to work outside Avernus. Hope it holds together long enough to find an infernal mechanic.

AvatarKarlachAfterEnrage.speaker: Karlach
AvatarKarlachAfterEnrage.text: And a stiff drink, while I'm at it.

session_synopses.PAD_KarlachEnraged: Karlach is enraged and starts screaming and breaking items inside the tollhouse in act 1.
