session_synopses.AvatarKarlachAfterEnrage: After becoming enraged for killing the paladins at the toll house, Avatar Karlach will think about what just happened to her.

002_PostEA.speaker: Trynn
002_PostEA.text: If you want to go poking around in the cellar, be my guest. Plug your nose first though.
002_PostEA.context: NodeContext: Turning her attention from a trapdoor to the player. With a smirk on the last sentence

SpokeWithDeadCrime.context: NodeContext: shouting to alert companions in nearby rooms
NodeContext: quieter than previous lines - a threat to the player right before attacking

Dead_PostEA.speaker: Narrator
Dead_PostEA.context: NodeContext: describing a corpse that the player just cast a speak with dead spell on

session_synopses.002_PostEA: Wary and abrupt. Disguised as a noble paladin of Tyr, this young is actually in league with the archdevil Zariel. She's hiding out in a tollhouse with her companions.
session_synopses.SpokeWithDeadCrime: A group of paladins react angrily to the player casting a speak with dead spell on one of their dead companions. They are angry enough to attack the player if the spell is repeated a second time.
session_synopses.Dead_PostEA: A speak with dead dialogue triggered when talking to the corpse of a refugee who was killed by gnolls. The dead man had signed a pact with an archdevil before his death.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: You don't craft a chest like that to hold trinkets. There must be something valuable inside.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Well, there's only one way to know for sure.

session_synopses.PAD: This PAD was converted from a RD where the party were discussing what to do with a valuable chest they've found. It triggers when agents are not nearby and a character picks up the chest or tries to open it, or deals with the agents and then notices the chest in the cave.

Healthy_01.speaker: Hyena
Healthy_01.text: Hate you. Not the Butcher's kin.

VB_PostFight_2P.speaker: Player
VB_PostFight_2P.context: NodeContext: After a fight, you're reflecting on the monsters you've killed.

VB_PostFight_2P.speaker: Player
VB_PostFight_2P.text: We'll have to keep an eye out for more.

PAD_HyenaRunning.speaker: Player
PAD_HyenaRunning.text: Watch it - that hyena's going for help!

session_synopses.Healthy_01: A hyena in the plains is displeased when the player is close, wanting to devour them to please Yeenoghu.
session_synopses.VB_PostFight_2P: Two players hava just finished a fight with gnolls (biped canine-type monsters). Before or during the fight, they saw new-born gnolls bursting out of the stomaches of dead or dying hyenas. Dialogue changes depending on if players know what gnolls are already.
session_synopses.03: A second player using Speak With Animals talks to a hyena while the first player speaks to the Dying Hyena. This will always end in combat.
session_synopses.SickHyena_AD_Groaning: Sick dying hyena whimpering in pain: a new gnolls is about to be born from it.
session_synopses.PAD_HyenaRunning: When the party starts the combat with dying hyenas, one of them - healthy hyena - will run away to call the gnolls nearby. This PAD is to ensure the player will understand what hyena is up to.

AD_FoundDeadDesire.speaker: Fist Recruit Aelis, Fist Recruit Ito, Fist Recruit Pavel, Gauntlet Yeva
AD_FoundDeadDesire.text: Florrick... we had better send her body home.

session_synopses.AD_FoundDeadDesire: Reaction from the Flaming Fists if they run into a dead Councillor Florrick.

PAD_DiscoveredPressurePlate.speaker: Player
PAD_DiscoveredPressurePlate.text: There's a pressure plate in the chair, but I'm missing something.

Karlach.speaker: Karlach
Karlach.text: Hold up. One more step, and I put a bolt through your eye.
Karlach.context: NodeContext: slumped against wall, crossbow on her lap - she raises it wearily and points it at us, then speaks with authority

Karlach.text: CinematicNodeContext: stands, holding the crossbow in one hand, her other hand pressed to a wound on the left of her stomach. She appraises the player.
Karlach.context: CinematicNodeContext: stands, holding the crossbow in one hand, her other hand pressed to a wound on the left of her stomach. She appraises the player.

Karlach.speaker: Karlach
Karlach.text: No sudden movements, or you're dead.

Karlach.speaker: Karlach
Karlach.context: NodeContext: Almost like 'bring it on' - she's expecting a fight

Karlach.speaker: Player
Karlach.text: No, but I see you're hurt - let me help.

Karlach.speaker: Karlach
Karlach.text: Hurt or not, I won't miss - lung, heart, arse or eye. Take your pick.
Karlach.context: NodeContext: small gestures with the crossbow, aiming at the bodyparts as she calls them out

Karlach.speaker: Karlach
Karlach.text: Tell me what you're doing here. Now.
Karlach.context: NodeContext: About to loser her temper, but still keeping it for now

Karlach.speaker: Player
Karlach.text: I just want to know what's going on here, I swear.

Karlach.speaker: Karlach
Karlach.text: All right. Maybe the blood-loss is making me soft, but I'm going to trust you. For now.
Karlach.context: CinematicNodeContext: lowers the crossbow, grimacing in painNodeContext: appraising us, starting to trust us

Karlach.speaker: Karlach
Karlach.text: I'm in a tight spot - might not be able to get out of it alone.
Karlach.context: NodeContext: annoyed she has to admit this - she's used to being self-dependent

Karlach.speaker: Karlach
Karlach.text: Oh, I have. The kind of battles a cub like you sees in their nightmares.
Karlach.context: NodeContext: 'cub' as a minor insult about our combat experience - trying to intimidate us a little. Enjoying it

Karlach.speaker: Karlach
Karlach.text: I'm having a very bad day.
Karlach.context: NodeContext: we just said she was very intense, she's like 'well, yes'

PAD_Karlach.speaker: Karlach
PAD_Karlach.context: NodeContext: To self, while burning, pre-recruitment

HeadLoot.speaker: Narrator
HeadLoot.text: *A faint, acrid smell clings to the corpse - like the memory of a storm.*
HeadLoot.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of Karlach's dead body.

HeadLoot.text: CinematicNodeContext: player removes head off-camera - but maybe show either a reaction shot as they prepare to decapitate
HeadLoot.context: CinematicNodeContext: player removes head off-camera - but maybe show either a reaction shot as they prepare to decapitate

HeadLoot.speaker: Narrator
HeadLoot.text: *The head comes free with a sickening crunch.*

session_synopses.PAD_DiscoveredPressurePlate: A character reacts when sitting on one of the stone chairs in the tollhouse basement and activating the pressure plate hidden there. There is an audible click, but a second character needs to be in the other chair to open the secret chamber. The line needs to hint that there is a second part to solving the puzzle.
session_synopses.Karlach: First meeting with Karlach, future Origin/Companion. She's a fugitive, wounded and hiding from cultists who are hunting for her to drag her back to hell.The dialogue begins with a stream separating the player and Karlach, as she points a crossbow at them when they approach, holding them at bay. She's fierce, defiant, and intense. But friendly and grateful if the player helps. Shouldn't be too angry - she's in a bad situation and doesn't know who to trust, but she's also been in far worse situations. She has a sense of humour about her predicatment, no matter how bad it gets.
session_synopses.PAD_Karlach: Karlach is at her default recruitment state.
session_synopses.HeadLoot: After killing Karlach, players have the option to study her corpse and cut off her head if they have the mission to kill her and retrieve the head.

node_data.speaker: Wyll
node_data.text: Counsellor Florrick - are you all right?

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: Fresh air, at last.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: Your boldness is a blessing - I'm in your debt.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Surprised, but slightly monotone. Not overtly fearful.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: Listen close: drow have taken Grand Duke Ulder Ravengard - westward, if my eyes and ears may be believed.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: I must report to the Flaming Fist manip, with haste.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: And you - I must ask again for your aid.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: Please - rescue Ravengard from his drow captors. The Council will reward you for your effort.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: May I trust you'll see it through?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You'll have to find somebody else for the job.

node_data.speaker: Wyll
node_data.text: Damn you. My father's in danger. We cannot turn our backs.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: I see your goodwill has limits. Far be it from me to stretch them.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: I will seek reinforcements and join you when I can.

FirstThanks.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
FirstThanks.text: Come. I'm afraid proper thanks must wait.

session_synopses.AD_Trapped: Desire calls out to anyone that can listen, as she is trapped in a room in a burning building.
session_synopses: Councilor Florrick is working in secret for a dragon in the city of Baldur's Gate. She is acting as an advisor to Grand Duke Ravengard. She should come across as good but no nonsense. SHe is used to getting her way.
session_synopses.AD_FF1: Yeva calls out when she realises who is calling from behind the fire.
session_synopses.FirstThanks: You speak with Desire after freeing her but before she reaches safety and engages the flaming fist

Zhent07.speaker: Vol
Zhent07.text: Didn't I tell you to move along?

Zhent03_AD_Idle.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_Idle.text: Hope we don't wake anything down there.

Zhent05_AD_Idle.speaker: Bellar
Zhent05_AD_Idle.text: Don't know why we don't just kill those Fist.

Zhent02_Stage1.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1.text: That's far enough. What's your business down here? Answer honestly, and maybe we'll kill you clean.
Zhent02_Stage1.context: NodeContext: Neutral but firm - she's not remotely afraid of us but

Zhent02_Stage1.text: NodeContext: Almost bored but with a hard edge - we've blundered in and she has more important matters to deal with, just wants rid of us.
Zhent02_Stage1.context: NodeContext: Almost bored but with a hard edge - we've blundered in and she has more important matters to deal with, just wants rid of us.

Zhent02_Stage1.speaker: Player
Zhent02_Stage1.text: I don't want trouble - I just want to trade.

Zhent02_Stage1.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1.text: Trade with what? Your life was ours the moment you walked in here.
Zhent02_Stage1.context: NodeContext: Unimpressed - our life is in her hands, and she's stating it as a simple matter of fact.

Zhent02_Stage1.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1.text: But... maybe I'll let you buy it back. I have a job needs doing.
Zhent02_Stage1.context: NodeContext: Considering us - normally she'd kill us but we just tried to talk our way into her base, and she could use skills like that.

Zhent02_Stage1.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1.text: We've disarmed the traps. Come down.
Zhent02_Stage1.context: NodeContext: An order, not a request - we're entirely in her power as far as she's concerned.

Zhent06.speaker: Jarg
Zhent06.text: Wanna pick out the true Zhent? Tell 'em they're going down into the Underdark.

Zhent06.speaker: Jarg
Zhent06.text: While everyone else is bawling, they'll be the ones asking about hazard pay.

DoubtingArtist.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist.text: What - come to kill me yourself? You might as well.
DoubtingArtist.context: InternalNodeContext: Peacefull situation, the artist is still captive, already met the playerNodeContext: Intense, eager - waiting for us to tell him he's free

DoubtingArtist.speaker: Player
DoubtingArtist.text: Relax - I'll speak to your captors.

DoubtingArtist.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist.text: Now I don't mean to hurry you - but if you could hurry, I'd be most obliged.

Zhent01.speaker: Salazon
Zhent01.text: You're a friend of the family now. Just as well I didn't blow you up, eh?
Zhent01.context: NodeContext: Chummy - he was ready to kill you just a few moments before but knows you're an ally now.

AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.speaker: Rugan
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.text: I'm told we're taking a stroll through the Underdark once we blow the charges.
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.context: InternalNodeContext: Only plays if all speakers are available and present.

AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.speaker: Zarys
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.text: Let me guess. You'd rather take the surface.

AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.speaker: Rugan
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.text: The route with fewer hook horrors and other beasties? Perish the thought.

AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.speaker: Zarys
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.text: How did a coward like you survive all these years in the Network?

Zhent03_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.text: A little bit of this will turn your blood to treacle.
Zhent03_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.context: NodeContext: During combat, character is coating their weapon in poison.

Zhent03_AD_ArtCritics.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_ArtCritics.text: You should change that. People don't make that face in real life.

VB_Entrance.speaker: Player
VB_Entrance.text: A cave beneath the tavern. I wonder how deep it runs...

Zhent02_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.text: Let's see how you like a little rot.
Zhent02_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.context: NodeContext: During combat, character is coating their weapon with poison.

Zhent03.speaker: Brem
Zhent03.text: Something I can help you with?

Zhent03.speaker: Brem
Zhent03.text: Well now! If we're talking, my guess is you've got coin to spend.

Zhent02_Trap.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Trap.text: You're the one who recruited me, Rugan.
Zhent02_Trap.context: CinematicNodeContext: For this entire exchange, Zarys is standing about ten feet above us on a raised platform.NodeContext: She's overseeing the torture of an agent of hers - one who originally recruited her to the organisation. Tone is chiding and also vaguely disgusted - he should have known better.

Zhent02_Trap.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Trap.text: You're the one who taught me rule number one, remember?
Zhent02_Trap.context: CinematicNodeContext: A shot of the torturer from behind, the moving aside to reveal Rugan.NodeContext: As if reflecting on 'good old days', but with a harder edge

Zhent02_Trap.speaker: Rugan
Zhent02_Trap.context: NodeContext: <Bound to a chair> Any moan / gurgle of pain or fear. He's been tortured for quite some time and is too exhausted to scream

Zhent02_Trap.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Trap.text: You're dead the moment you steal from the Zhentarim.
Zhent02_Trap.context: NodeContext: All joviality dropped - flat and icy-cold.

PAD_NoticedFakeWall.speaker: Player
PAD_NoticedFakeWall.text: That wall's an illusion! Hiding what, I wonder...

Zhent05_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.speaker: Bellar
Zhent05_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.text: I've been wanting to try this venom...
Zhent05_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.context: NodeContext: Mid-combat, character is coating their weapon in poison.

Zhent05_AD_Combat_LeaderDied.speaker: Bellar
Zhent05_AD_Combat_LeaderDied.context: NodeContext: (Zar-iss, Sword-har) Your leader just died in combat - dismay, anger.

Zhent02_Stage2.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage2.text: Can't say you weren't warned - steel it is.

DoubtingArtist_AD_Cowering.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_AD_Cowering.text: Well?! You bought me, so save me! Please!
DoubtingArtist_AD_Cowering.context: InternalNodeContext: The player bought the artist. Now, the artist feel threatened by something.

Zhent05.speaker: Bellar
Zhent05.text: Olly was a decent lad. Pained me to cut on him like that.
Zhent05.context: NodeContext: Bellar is referring to a friend he 'had' to torture to death. Bellar is a bit of a sociopath.

Zhent02_AD_Stage1Darkness.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_AD_Stage1Darkness.text: Our visitor's taking out the lights! Fall back!

DoubtingArtist_AD_Idle.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_AD_Idle.text: Ye watching gods - I don't know any prayers, but rescue me from this pit and I swear that I will change.

DoubtingArtist_AD_Idle.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_AD_Idle.text: I'll drink only in the temple district, that you may keep an eye on me. Please.
DoubtingArtist_AD_Idle.context: NodeContext: As if making a concession if the gods save him

Zhent08.speaker: Karad
Zhent08.text: Wouldn't linger down here, I were you - see all that smokepowder?

Zhent08.speaker: Karad
Zhent08.text: The Flaming Fist won't find nothing here but rubble.

Zhent04.speaker: Garias
Zhent04.text: You don't want to keep Zarys waiting, believe me.

Zhent02_AD_Stage2.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_AD_Stage2.context: NodeContext: A barked order to her men - but not rattled, she's a consummate soldier

Zhent02_Stage3.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage3.text: You're making a bad mistake, my friend. Last chance to turn back.

Zhent06_AD.speaker: Jarg
Zhent06_AD.text: Another damn day in this cave.

Zhent04_AD_Idle.speaker: Garias
Zhent04_AD_Idle.text: Wonder if the Fist pay better than this lot...

Zhent06_AD_Combat.speaker: Jarg
Zhent06_AD_Combat.text: You've messed up. At least you won't live to regret it!

Zhent03_AD_Zhent04.speaker: Garias
Zhent03_AD_Zhent04.text: Here, make your fella draw me something.

Zhent03_AD_Zhent04.speaker: Garias
Zhent03_AD_Zhent04.text: Yeah, all right, fine. Who are you, his muse?

Zhent03_AD_Zhent04.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_Zhent04.text: Don't pretend you know what that means. What kind of drawin' you want?

Zhent03_AD_Zhent04.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_Zhent04.text: Like, any kind of birds, or...

Zhent03_AD_Zhent04.speaker: Garias
Zhent03_AD_Zhent04.text: Pretty ones. With colours and stuff.

Zhent07_AD_TrapsActivated.speaker: Vol
Zhent07_AD_TrapsActivated.text: Run! Rugan's friend set off the traps!

Zhent01_AD_Idle.speaker: Salazon
Zhent01_AD_Idle.context: NodeContext: Considering a big stack of boxes he's been told to sort through for the journey ahead.

session_synopses.Zhent08_AD: Karad is standing around on guard duty, bored.
session_synopses.Zhent02_CaughtUp: The player has snuck into the miiddle of a Zhentarim outpost and been spotted - the Zhent would usually run but choose to fight as the player got too close before discovery. In some cases, friendly members of the group recognise the player.
session_synopses.Zhent03_AD_Idle: Brem is chatting to himself as he packs to leave the Zhent hideout.
session_synopses.AD_InvestigationCheck: Player is chasing someone down into a seemingly sealed room - they'll either realise there's another door or just be confused that their quarry has disappeared.
session_synopses.Zhent05_AD_Idle: Bellar is a cheerfully violent thug who is happily chatting to himself while his companions prepare to flee their hideout.
session_synopses.Zhent02_AD_Idle: Zarys is barking orders at her minions as they prepare to leave the hideout.
session_synopses.Zhent02_Stage1:
Zarys is standing on a raised platform just as we stumble into her secret outpost, speaking to us across a gap of about 15 feet. We have to convince her we're friendly or she's ready to have us killed.

Her gang are preparing to burn down their hideout when they leave, and in some cases she'll give the order to start that process if she thinks we're a threat.
session_synopses.Zhent06: Jarg is a veteran of the crime organisation - as friendly as they come but would plant an arrow between your eyes without thinking twice.
session_synopses.Dog_01: Younger dog is following her master on patrol duty, mindful of all the beastly scents in the underdark.
session_synopses.DoubtingArtist:
An artist captued by the Zhentarim, Oskar is being forced to paint against his will. He'll discreetly approach the player and beg them to buy him, mindful that he's within earshot of his brutal captors. 
If he is freed by whatever means, he'll regain some of his old haughtiness but will ultimately still be grateful as he relates his story - that he's torn between two loves. The first is the patron who has offered to marry him, and the second is a first true love from his pre-fame and -wealth past.
session_synopses.Zhent01: Salazon is a guard the player will have encountered on entering the dungeon he'll either have fled from us, tried to blow us up, or let us pass.
session_synopses.Zhents_AD_ZhentAgentEscape: The player has freed a Zhent prisoner - tied up and beaten because he failed to return to the hideout with a valuable shipment. The NPC sees the prisoner freed and running for the exit.
session_synopses.AD_ZhentShipmentAgents: Back and forth between Olly, Zarys and Rugan in their idle states .
session_synopses.Zhent03_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed: One-shot combat AD to play when the character uses a Poison Vail.
session_synopses.Zhent03_AD_ArtCritics: Brem is commenting on paintings by the doubting artist.
session_synopses.VB_Entrance: Player exclaims on entering a hidden underground cave.
session_synopses.Zhent04_AD_Welcome: Garias is guarding a lowly gang hideout. ADs as he approaches you to open the door.
session_synopses.Zhent02_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed: One-shot combat AD to play when the character uses a Poison Vail.
session_synopses.Dog_03: This dog is guarding an illusory wall. It looks solid to him (and the player), but he can't smell it.
session_synopses.Zhent03: Brem is a trader for the Zhentarim. When we meet him, he's holding an artist prisoner and offering us a portrait. We can persuade him to release the prisoner or just buy him outright - or just trade normally. He'll indicate that there are more illicit items he can show us - once we prove ourselves to his leader.
session_synopses.AD_UseLift: On interacting with a broken elevator.
session_synopses.Zhent02_Trap: We walk in to find Zarys overseeing the torture of an agent that handed over special cargo to us. The agent is currently bound to a chair and badly beaten, and we're due to get the same treatment in her eyes - unless we can talk her out of it.Volume is likely louder than normal conversation but not shouting - she's standing on a raised platform perhaps ten feet above us and the tortured agent,
session_synopses.Dog_02: This older dog is following his master on guard duty, uncomprehending the endless circles they walk but happy to do it anyway.
session_synopses.PAD_NoticedFakeWall: In exploring the zhent dungeon, the player has discovered an illusory wall.
session_synopses.Zhent05_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed: One-shot combat AD to play when the character uses a Poison Vail.
session_synopses.Zhent05_AD_Combat_LeaderDied: One-shot combat AD to play when the leader of the Zhentarim - Zarys, - dies.
session_synopses.Zhent02_Stage2: Zarys is fleeing the player, setting traps as she goes (ADs account for if she is unable to do so)
session_synopses.DoubtingArtist_AD_Cowering: Doubting artist is cowering because something potentially harmfull is happening. He don't want to talk until it is resolved.
session_synopses.Zhent05: Bellar is a common thug working for the Zhent. We can find him beating one of their own members for incompetence, or waiting to flee the hideout.
session_synopses.Zhent02_AD_Stage1Darkness: Zarys is responding to the player trying to creep up on her crew, based on whether we've met her before or not.
session_synopses.VB_Cellar: Player has descended into a hideout and the person they're chasing has disappeared.
session_synopses.DoubtingArtist_AD_Idle: Doubting artist has been kidnapped and is now enslaved by Zhentarim. Everything is peaceful around, for now.
session_synopses.Zhent08: Karad is bored, guarding the back of the cave.
session_synopses.Zhent04: Garias is a lowly Zhent recruit left with guarding the gate. He's sullen about it.
session_synopses.Zhent02_AD_Stage2: Zarys is pulling her troops back as we intrude on their hideout
session_synopses.Zhent02_Stage3: Zarys is fleeing while her hideout blows up around her. Player is pursuing.
session_synopses.Zhent06_AD: Jarg is a veteran of the Zhent - but he's on guard duty and he's bored.
session_synopses.Zhent04_AD_Idle: Garias is talking to his brother as they prepare to leave their secret gang hideout.
session_synopses.Zhent06_AD_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the zhent is taking his turn.
session_synopses.Zhent03_AD_Zhent04: Brem and Garias are brothers, ADing back and forth about the artist they've taken captive (or sold)
session_synopses.Zhent07_AD_TrapsActivated: Plays if the player sets off the explosives after winning the Zhent over.
session_synopses.PAD_HiddenEntrance_Opened: Player has opened a secret entrance hidden behind an elaborate sliding-wardrobe setup.
session_synopses.Zhent01_AD_Idle: Salazon is pacing, packing up ahead of the plan to blow the hideout.

session_synopses.PAD: The player sees dead flaming fists and a collapsed tunnel near the Toll House.

node_data.speaker: Fist Recruit Ito
node_data.text: We have to get them out!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standing, facing the playerInternalNodeContext: Desire is trapped behind rubble.

session_synopses: This dialogue can happen in two phases: while pushing agianst rubble outside of the inn, or in a more generic setting (either searching the inn or clearing rubble).A Flaming Fist trying to force their way inside of a burning inn. They can hear someone inside - they believe it might be a Duke of Baldur's Gate, who they were sent to guard on her way to Elturel. Instead, they found the inn burning, its staff and guests murdered by goblins and drow in the night.
session_synopses.AD_Occupied: A Flaming Fist searching a burning building for survivors. This AD is triggered when the player tries to interact with them, but they are unavailable for dialogue.

DragonEvent.speaker: Gauntlet Dion
DragonEvent.context: NodeContext: Trying to be authoritative, but completely in over his head.

DragonEvent.speaker: Sarth Baretha
DragonEvent.text: I'll feed your innards to the ants before I do that, istik.

DragonEvent.speaker: Gauntlet Dion
DragonEvent.context: NodeContext: Last-ditch effort to enforce authority.

DragonEvent.speaker: Sarth Baretha
DragonEvent.text: No, look up. That was your last chance, istik. Now burn!
DragonEvent.context: CinematicNodeContext: A dragon appears and does an air-to-ground attack, roasting the Flaming Fists. It goes to land somewhere and its rider, Kith'rak Voss, dismounts. He approaches the other githyanki.InternalNodeContext: Dragon destroys bridge, dragon lands, knight starts talking to BarethaNodeContext: 'I'm done with you'.

DragonEvent.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
DragonEvent.text: Stop wasting time, Baretha. You're not here to play with the locals.
DragonEvent.context: NodeContext: Berating an underling. Baretha pronounced Bar-eh-tha. A gith name.

DragonEvent.speaker: Sarth Baretha
DragonEvent.text: Of course, kith'rak. We merely sought to -
DragonEvent.context: NodeContext: Kith'rak - 'Captain' - a gith commander in charge of ten sarths (100 warriors total). Pronounced Kith-rack

DragonEvent.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
DragonEvent.text: No excuses. Question, kill, then move on. Find the weapon.

DragonEvent.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
DragonEvent.text: Our queen watches us. Fail her at your peril.

TieflingScout.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout.text: Hrast, another one! Keep back, flatface - I know how to handle myself!
TieflingScout.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ellyka is immediately defensive, brandishing a dagger at the gith player.NodeContext: Hrast pronounced hur-RAST-ing. Similar to damn/fuck in common language.

TieflingScout.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout.text: Come on, mragreshem! I'll take my chances against you than your friends on the bridge!
TieflingScout.context: NodeContext: mragreshem = infernal for 'shithead'. Pronounced mragRESHem.

PAD_LaezelKilledByGith.speaker: Player
PAD_LaezelKilledByGith.text: Dead - by her own kin's hand.

AD_ScoutReactsToDragon.speaker: Ellyka
AD_ScoutReactsToDragon.text: Helm protect me, where'd that beast come from...?
AD_ScoutReactsToDragon.context: NodeContext: A tiefling refugee reacts with terror and awe upon seeing a dragon fly overhead.

ConfrontationLaezel.speaker: Lae'zel
ConfrontationLaezel.text: Rider - my time is short. Lead me to...
ConfrontationLaezel.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel begins to bow as she speaks to the kith'rak

ConfrontationLaezel.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
ConfrontationLaezel.text: Were I not merciful, I would slice the skin clean from your meat.

ConfrontationLaezel.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
ConfrontationLaezel.text: Yet you are not bleeding. For I am nothing if not merciful.

ConfrontationLaezel.speaker: Player
ConfrontationLaezel.text: If you wish to speak, speak to me.

ConfrontationLaezel.speaker: Lae'zel
ConfrontationLaezel.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel looks up from bowing at the player in anger

CINE_RiderAndDragonLeave.text:
CinematicNodeContext: ~The dragon spreads its wings and soars away.
NOTE: this could be used in a number of circumstances in which Voss flies away. Voss is an arrogant senior gith officer, focused on his mission, so he can always depart while being unfazed by preceeding events.
CINE_RiderAndDragonLeave.context:
CinematicNodeContext: ~The dragon spreads its wings and soars away.
NOTE: this could be used in a number of circumstances in which Voss flies away. Voss is an arrogant senior gith officer, focused on his mission, so he can always depart while being unfazed by preceeding events.

Confrontation.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation.text: You are unknown to me, kin. Are you straight from the crche, wandering unbidden?
Confrontation.context: InternalNodeContext: Do not put a selection speaker here, gith has priority

Confrontation.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation.text: Explain yourself, vin'iisk.

AD_StandOff.speaker: Sarth Baretha
AD_StandOff.text: Your babbling tires me, istik. Move your carcass!
AD_StandOff.context: CinematicNodeContext: Authoritative demandingNodeContext: Authoritative demanding. 'istik' =  'Stranger' - Catch-all term for non-gith. Pronounced Iss-tick

AD_StandOff.speaker: Gauntlet Dion
AD_StandOff.text: B-by order of the Flaming Fist, halt!
AD_StandOff.context: CinematicNodeContext: Unintelligent confusionNodeContext: Unintelligent confusion

AD_StandOff.speaker: Sarth Baretha
AD_StandOff.text: Or what? Show us what you can do, worm.
AD_StandOff.context: NodeContext: Htak'-a meaning "Die!" in gith language

ReadingMap.speaker: Narrator
ReadingMap.text: *Githyanki tir'su - the script of your people - is etched on the slate, forming an array of arcs and circles.*
ReadingMap.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~[reuse] Player produces slate from intventory

PAD_Shield.speaker: Player
PAD_Shield.text: Still warm to the touch, if you can believe it.

PAD_Shield.speaker: Player
PAD_Shield.text: A dragon is clearly not to be trifled with.

PAD_LaezelReadMap.speaker: Lae'zel
PAD_LaezelReadMap.text: A githyanki crche lies beyond the mountain pass.

PartyReaction.speaker: Player
PartyReaction.text: You'd have to be a fool to pick a fight with that lot. Best to keep away for now...

AD_SearchingCorpses.speaker: Sarth Baretha
AD_SearchingCorpses.context: NodeContext: Vlaakith pronounced v-lah-kith. The name of the gith queen.

AD_SearchingCorpses.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
AD_SearchingCorpses.text: I expect you to fall on your sword, if you do.
AD_SearchingCorpses.context: NodeContext: Baretha pronounced Bar-eh-tha. A gith name.

session_synopses.DragonEvent: A Flaming Fist detachment tries to confront a githyanki war band. The Flaming Fists are completely outmatched, however; the githyanki warriors dismiss their demands. Moments later, a githyanki controlled dragon roasts the Flaming Fists in a fly-by. Afterwards, the dragon rider, a senior gith, berates his subordinate for her slow mission progress.
session_synopses.AD_LaezelRunsToKnight: Non-recruited Lae'zel calls out to the gith knight.
session_synopses.TieflingScout: A tiefling scout from the Druid Grove hides and observes as a Githyanki war party massacres some Flaming Fists. The tiefling may warn the player that they are too weak to take on such opponents, before running off.
session_synopses.PAD_LaezelKilledByGith: Player returning to the Gith Chokepoint area after leaving Lae'zel behind -- she has been killed by the gith
session_synopses.AD_ScoutReactsToDragon: A tiefling refugee observes a war party of githyanki warriors guarding a bottleneck in the main road leading out of the region. The githyanki are alien and fearsome to the tiefling. She reacts with shock when she sees how they have a dragon circling overhead in support.
session_synopses.ConfrontationLaezel:
Alternate version of the dragon rider scene at chokepoint. Lae'zel is alive and was never recruited. Player can recruit her after this.

Lae'zel approaches the rider to discover where to find the creche. A cure for the tadpole can be found there - or so she believes. However, the knight is under different orders.
session_synopses.CINE_RiderAndDragonLeave: Cinematic: Kith'rak Voss flies away on his dragon.The player interrupted the Gith Chokepoint situation. The most likely interruption is triggering a combat (player attacks any npc there including Voss or the dragon, or drags another hostile npc near them)This interruption happens in gameplay, so normally the Rider (Kith'rak Voss) and the Dragon would also leave in gameplay, but animations don't have the tech support to make the Rider ride the dragon like this, so we play this cutscene instead
session_synopses.Confrontation: Our party encounters a band of githyanki warriors who have taken position at bottleneck in the region - a bridge that provides one of the few paths of progression. The gith confront us and try to see if we know anything about the 'weapon' they seek. (The weapon in question is the strange puzzle box we are carrying.) While reading our thoughts, the githyanki may realise we are tadpoled, resulting in instant combat. If we manage to conceal our tadpoles, they may allow us to pass.
session_synopses.AD_StandOff: A flaming fist solider nervously attempts to challenge a githyanki warrior. The gith is essentially an alien to the lowly soldier; he can't help but feel intimidated.
session_synopses.ZorruFriend_Dead: Yul was Zorru's friend. Player finds him dead already and may have heard about him before if they talked to Zorru with Lae'zel.
session_synopses.ReadingMap: |Item interaction: player clicks on the githyanki map and tries to read it. Githyanki are able to read it.Lae'zel is added in the 3th speaker slot. Any others are in the second slot. If Lae'zel is taking the map from somebody, they are both speakers in the dialog. Otherwise the second or third slot are null.
session_synopses.PAD_Shield: Comment on acquiring or moving a shield of a Flaming Fist mercenary killed by the dragon on the bridge.
session_synopses.PAD_LaezelReadMap: After reading the Githyanki Map, Lae'zel Avatar urges the rest of the party to go to the crche.
session_synopses.PartyReaction: Companions react to the gith chokepoint (dragon flew by and killed the flaming fists). Lae'zel is handled in a different dialog.
session_synopses.AD_SearchingCorpses: Kith'rak Voss, a high-ranking gith warrior, berates his underling, Sarth Baretha, and orders her and her warriors to search the corpses of some humans they'rve just killed. They are looking for 'the weapon' (in fact a strange puzzle box in the possession of our party).

AwayFromCorpse.speaker: Fist Recruit Tristan
AwayFromCorpse.text: We shouldn't stay too long. The goblins might come back.
AwayFromCorpse.context: NodeContext: He's politely telling the player to go away.

AwayFromCorpse.speaker: Fist Recruit Tristan
AwayFromCorpse.text: A massacre. Drow and goblins slaughtered them all.

AwayFromCorpse.speaker: Fist Recruit Tristan
AwayFromCorpse.text: You should talk to Gauntlet Dain. She's in charge.

session_synopses.AwayFromCorpse: A Flaming Fist soldier standing in the aftermath of a drow raid on an inn. There were many casualties, and it's hitting him hard.

Agent_003_Dead.speaker: Narrator
Agent_003_Dead.context: NodeContext: After casting a speak with dead spell

Agents_AD_Retreating.speaker: Olly
Agents_AD_Retreating.text: Hear that? Someone's fighting the gnolls! We should help!
Agents_AD_Retreating.context: NodeContext: Upon hearing a fight break out between players and a gnoll pack - Shouting to his friend who is nearby

Agents_AD_Retreating.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_Retreating.text: Don't be a fool, lad. Shut your mouth, and keep your head down.
Agents_AD_Retreating.context: NodeContext: shushing his friend on first line to avoid getting spotted and involved in a fight

Agents_AD_Retreating.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_Retreating.text: Leave the heroics to them that don't value their own skin.
Agents_AD_Retreating.context: NodeContext: in a hushed voice, to a companion rather than to players as a fight they're avoiding unfolds nearby

Agent_002.speaker: Olly
Agent_002.text: That bloody chest can rot for all I care. I'm not cut out for this kind of work.

Agent_001_CrimeSevere.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_CrimeSevere.context: NodeContext: furious, beginning hostilities with player who is stealing his belongings

VB_BloodSymbol.speaker: Player
VB_BloodSymbol.text: That's the symbol of the Absolute. Marked in blood.

Rugan_AD_AfterCombatReaction.speaker: Rugan
Rugan_AD_AfterCombatReaction.text: Well, lad. It's our lucky day after all.

Agent_002_Crime.speaker: Olly
Agent_002_Crime.text: I told you to leave that alone!
Agent_002_Crime.context: NodeContext: shouting at players who are stealing his belongings

Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat.text: Where the hells is the chest? It was right here!
Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat.context: NodeContext: surprised and anxious - lost important cargo. Voice raised but talking to nobody in particular

VB_WreckedCaravan.speaker: Player
VB_WreckedCaravan.text: This must be where the gnolls attacked.

Olly_AD_AfterCombatReaction.speaker: Olly
Olly_AD_AfterCombatReaction.text: Ah, Rugan... old bastard thought he'd live forever.
Olly_AD_AfterCombatReaction.context: NodeContext: wry comment on the death of a companion... sad, but pragmatic

Agent_001.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001.text: Thanks. You always seem to show up at just the right time.
Agent_001.context: InternalNodeContext: Rugan's thanking the player after being freed.NodeContext: Through his teeth, but friendly.

Agents_AD_Joining.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_Joining.text: Take the leader down - I'll try to hold the rest back!
Agents_AD_Joining.context: NodeContext: Shouting orders as a fight against a gnoll pack starts

Agents_AD_FlasksLow.speaker: Olly
Agents_AD_FlasksLow.context: NodeContext: panicked, shouting to a companion across a small cave as they attempt to hold off an attack

Agents_AD_FlasksLow.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_FlasksLow.text: Keep steady. We're not finished yet.
Agents_AD_FlasksLow.context: NodeContext: raised voice, trying to impose calm on a panicked situation

Agents_AD_FlasksLow.speaker: Olly
Agents_AD_FlasksLow.text: The fire's the only thing holding them back!
Agents_AD_FlasksLow.context: NodeContext: panicked, shouting to a companion across a small cave as they attempt to hold off an attack

Agents_AD_FlasksLow.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_FlasksLow.text: I've been in worse spots, lad. Just follow my lead.
Agents_AD_FlasksLow.context: NodeContext: raised voice, trying to impose calm on a panicked situation

Agents_AD_OutOfFlasks.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_OutOfFlasks.text: That's the last of the flasks! Fall back!
Agents_AD_OutOfFlasks.context: NodeContext: Shouting desperately during a battle - the flasks are like flammable grenades. Running out means they have to flee because the fire was holding their enemies back.

AD_BetweenAgents.speaker: Rugan
AD_BetweenAgents.text: Well, lad. It's our lucky day after all.

AD_BetweenAgents.speaker: Rugan
AD_BetweenAgents.text: The rest of our crew's half-digested, and you're still alive. That's lucky.

Agent_002_Dead.speaker: Narrator
Agent_002_Dead.context: NodeContext: after successfully casting a speak with dead spell

Agent_001_Dead.speaker: Narrator
Agent_001_Dead.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*
Agent_001_Dead.context: NodeContext: after casting a speak with dead spell that fails

session_synopses.Agent_003_Dead: Using a speak with dead spell, we are able to talk to the spirit of Amnos, a zhentarim mercenary who was killed by a pack of gnolls
session_synopses.Agents_AD_Retreating: One-shot AD for Zhent shipment survivors when they hear/see players starting a fight with the gnoll pack that have them (the agents) cornered. They back away, somewhat cowardly, not wanting to get involved
session_synopses.Agent_002: Non critpath: The dialogue for the second agent, he mostly tells you to speak with the first agent. Works both if the first agent dead or alive. The gnolls could be either waiting near the entrance or gone (dead / ran away)
session_synopses.Agent_001_CrimeSevere: Angry and surprised, a zhent agent prepares to attack as he calls out to a player stealing an item that belongs to him.
session_synopses.VB_BloodSymbol: The party character comments on the blood symbol near the wrecked caravan. They player might reckognize the symbol.
session_synopses.Rugan_AD_AfterCombatReaction: One-shot AD for the Rugan just after he fought gnolls. If Olly is dead Rugan approaches his body to say alternative node.
session_synopses.Agent_002_Crime: Non critpath: The dialogue for the second agent, he mostly tells you to speak with the first agent. Works both if the first agent dead or alive. The gnolls could be either waiting near the entrance or gone (dead / ran away)
session_synopses.Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat: Shaken Zhent agents check on their cargo after surviving an attack. Always shaken by the attack (which is now finished), and anxious if the cargo is missing/damaged, otherwise relieved.
session_synopses.VB_WreckedCaravan: The party character comments on the wrecked caravan. The player might already know about the special chest from the Den Zhent Agents
session_synopses.Olly_AD_AfterCombatReaction: One-shot AD for Olly after he fought gnolls and is the only agent who survived.
session_synopses.Agent_001: One of a pair of Zhentarim agents trapped in a cave by gnolls. A veteran mercenary, tough, and above all else a survivor. The rest of their crew are dead. Rugan here is the senior agent of the two, and he's grimly determined to survive this terrible situation.
session_synopses.Agents_AD_Joining: One-shot AD for Rugan when Zhents join the fight with the gnolls.
session_synopses.Agents_AD_FlasksLow: Trapped in a cave by monsters, Olly and Rugan are running low on fire flasks.Olly is panicking and shouting to Rugan as they attempt to hold the line; Rugan is more experienced and putting on a calmer, braver face.
session_synopses.Agents_AD_OutOfFlasks: Zhent agents panic as they prepare to be attacked by gnolls
session_synopses.AD_BetweenAgents: Non critpath: conversation between two zhent agents while they are trappedwaiting in a cave. In the first three branches, they are desperate and out of breath as they throw flasks of fire at the cave entrance to hold off a pack of gnolls. In the final flow, the gnolls are gone. The characters are more relaxed, but traumatised by the experience.
session_synopses.Agent_002_Dead: Using a speak with dead spell, we are able to talk to the spirit of Oll, a young Zhentarim agent
session_synopses.Agent_001_Dead: Using a speak with dead spell, we are able to talk to the spirit of Rugan.

node_data.speaker: Fist Recruit Ephren
node_data.text: I promise my shield and my sword, Vigilant One. Let them be my courage...
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ephren is kneeling next to the dead Jacek, prayingNodeContext: Praying

node_data.speaker: Fist Recruit Ephren
node_data.text: He of the Unsleeping Eyes. Grant me the might to carry this burden. Grant me the faith to face darkness without fear.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ephren is kneeling next to the dead Jacek, prayingNodeContext: Quietly praying

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: My condolences to you.

node_data.speaker: Fist Recruit Ephren
node_data.text: He should never have been here in the first place. I'm the one that talked him into joining the Fist.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ephren is kneeling next to the dead Jacek

session_synopses: Flaming Fist praying over a dead colleague. Jacek = "YAHT-sick."Drow players: Ephren believes you are another attacker, and either initiates attack or you persuade her not to.

Sign_PAD.speaker: Player
Sign_PAD.text:
'Welcome to Waukeen's Rest.
West - Baldur's Gate. East - Elturel.'
Sign_PAD.context: NodeContext: The player is reading from a signpost. Pronunciation: Wah-KEEN, ELL-tur-ELL

VB_House.speaker: Player
VB_House.text: I hear shouting. Someone needs help.

DeadCiv1_Dead.speaker: Benryn
DeadCiv1_Dead.text: You're a medium! You're going to speak to her.

DeadCiv1_Dead.speaker: Benryn
DeadCiv1_Dead.text: Could you ask her something for me?

DeadCiv1_Dead.speaker: Player
DeadCiv1_Dead.text: Maybe. What do you want me to ask?

DeadCiv1_Dead.speaker: Benryn
DeadCiv1_Dead.text: The dowry. She'd know where it is.
DeadCiv1_Dead.context: NodeContext: Having an 'aha' moment (but not excited - he's still grieving)

DeadCiv1_Dead.speaker: Benryn
DeadCiv1_Dead.text: It's for her sister's wedding. Miri had it when she ran out.

session_synopses.VB_DeadDrow1Armor: Party comments on finding the armour of a dead drow in the tavern region.
session_synopses.Sign_PAD: The player is reading from a signpost in front of the tavern 'Waukeen's Rest'.
session_synopses.VB_House: PC approaches tavern where Flaming Fists are trying to break through.
session_synopses.DeadFF1_Dead: The Cult of the Absolute has ransacked the inn at Waukeen's Rest and kidnapped Duke Stelmane of Baldur's Gate. The player arrives after the carnage, finding corpses strewn about. The player casts 'Speak with Dead' on one of these corpses - a member of the Flaming Fist who was sworn to protect the Duke. She was among the final Fists left standing. She was killed guarding the Duke.
session_synopses.DeadCiv1_Dead: The Cult of the Absolute has ransacked the inn at Waukeen's Rest and kidnapped Duke Stelmane of Baldur's Gate. The player arrives after the carnage, finding corpses strewn about. The player casts 'Speak with Dead' on one of these corpses - a civilian that was caught in the middle. She stopped in Wakeen's Rest with her husband and daughter in the middle of their journey to Waterdeep for a wedding. She watched her family butchered by goblins before being killed herself.
session_synopses.DeadGoblin1_Dead: The Cult of the Absolute has ransacked the inn at Waukeen's Rest and kidnapped Duke Stelmane of Baldur's Gate. The player arrives after the carnage, finding corpses strewn about. The player casts 'Speak with Dead' on one of these corpses - one of the goblin raiders. He was killed chasing a child through the inn.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A human man awaits you, a spell crackling at his fingertips.*
node_data.context: NodeContext: [Salazon is crouching behind the shelves with Fire Bolt ready].

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Wait!

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Wait - listen!
True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *He freezes, waiting on your next word.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Careful. You won't kill me, but you will make me mad.
True

node_data.speaker: Salazon
node_data.text: Right, look - if it's business you're about, then be about it. Flaming Fist could be on us any minute.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Salazon stands up. We've intimidated him but he's trying to cling on to some scrap of authority, letting us down with a warning as if it's his choice.

node_data.speaker: Salazon
node_data.text: Down you go - entrance is behind the wardrobe. You'll find a key in one of the crates.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wardrobe is behind SalazonNodeContext: [Salazon is standing].

session_synopses: Salazon is preparing a fire-trap at the entrance to his gang's hideout. We can either sneak up on him or be sneaked up on in turn - either way we have to convince him we should be there or he'll get skittish and blow us all up. In general he's jumpy and suspicious of us, but relieved when we convince him we're a friend. Think an inexperienced guard pointing a gun at us when he's been told to be on alert.
session_synopses.AD_Backup: Plays when Salazon spots an NPC he can't have a dialogue with (summon, animal, party follower)

session_synopses.AD_Occupied: A Flaming Fist searching a burning building for survivors. This AD is triggered when the player tries to interact with them, but they are unavailable for dialogue.

AD_001.speaker: Narrator
AD_001.text: *Risen Road. Closed due to inclement weather. Seek marked detour.*

session_synopses.AD_001: Sign before the Risen Road detour around SCL.

SurrogateMother_Dead.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Dead.context: InternalNodeContext: Doesn't know whether husband is dead or not, but knows that you killed her brothers.NodeContext: Spitting with rage but also on the brink of tears. This player killed people you loved.

SurrogateMother_Dead.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Dead.text: ... drove me mad but... loved them... dead now... everyone is... dead.

SurrogateMother_AD_HagOccupied.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_AD_HagOccupied.text: Who are you? You need to leave. Now. Before she sees you.
SurrogateMother_AD_HagOccupied.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sitting down in her chair - looking at her foodNodeContext: Afraid - looking around for the hag. Head low.

Husband.speaker: Connor Vinderblad
Husband.context: NodeContext: Guttural and disturbing. You're a zombie that has a decomposing jaw.

SurrogateMother_AD_CorpseDugUp.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_AD_CorpseDugUp.text: I dragged my husband here in a wheelbarrow. Buried him. Took everything the hag threw at  me for him.

SurrogateMother_AD_CorpseDugUp.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_AD_CorpseDugUp.text: And some godsdamned psychopath digs him up? I hate this place. I hate everyone.

PAD_AfterResurrection.speaker: Player
PAD_AfterResurrection.text: Not quite the outcome intended, but I must say - the technique was excellent.

PAD_AfterResurrection.speaker: Player
PAD_AfterResurrection.text: The spell is cast - what's done is done.

session_synopses.SurrogateMother_Dead:
This occurs when Mayrina dies. There are multiple permutationinlcuding, but not limited to, you killed her brothers and/or her husband, she knows that one or more of these people are dead but doesn't blame you, you took her husband as a summon, and you know one of the brothers is dead but she doesn't hold you responsible. 

Sad and far away sound - except in parts when she knows you killed her family.
session_synopses.SurrogateMother_AD_HagOccupied: This is an edgecase in which the player talks to Mayrina when the hag isn't present. Mayrina is afraid, looking around for the hag - doesn't want to get into trouble. Sitting down in her chair.
session_synopses.Husband: Mayrina's husband has been resurrected - but he's not the man she married. He's a horrible and decomposing zombie.
session_synopses.StartScene: This is the main hag dialogue. In it, you can ask about Mayrina (who is present) or make a deal to have your parasite removed. If you keep asking about Mayrina (twice), the hag will be furious and vanish Mayrina away while she deals with the 'busybody' - the player.If you agree to the tadpole deal, you must give up an eye (in the transformed dialogue).
session_synopses.SurrogateMother_AD_CorpseDugUp: Triggers when Mayrina gets to the grave. In the top node the grave is empty. In the bottom the corpse is lying there for her to see. She leaves and does not return.
session_synopses.PAD_AfterResurrection: The player's found a wand in the Hag's lair and tried to use it to resurrect Mayrina's husband. Unfortunately, it was cursed and he only came back a zombie. The players reflect on using items from evil beings.

PAD_TriedTart.speaker: Player
PAD_TriedTart.text: Gods spare me, why did I think eating a second one was a good idea?

PAD_Fled.speaker: Player
PAD_Fled.text: Where has she gone, I wonder?

session_synopses.PAD_TriedTart: Player eats a disguised Hag Tart, not knowing it's truly rotten and noxious. Brave (or foolish) players can eat the tart a second time, deepening their misery.
session_synopses.PAD_Fled: In the top node player has started combat with the hag in the teahouse. She has disappeared, fleeing to her lair. In the bottom, business has been conducted peacefully and she has left.

Victim_003_AD_HeartAttack.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_AD_HeartAttack.text: No, Ethel! I'm sorry! I'll go back! Argh.

Victim_001_AD_Dying.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_AD_Dying.text: The Bite! No. I don't want to die. I don't - Argh.
Victim_001_AD_Dying.context: NodeContext: You're about to puke your guts up and die a horrible death. You feel it coming - you're panicked, scared and terrified.

session_synopses.Victim_003_AD_HeartAttack: Lorin has been ordered to stay in the corner by the hag. The player has forced him out, and he is absolutely panicking - he knows the hag will punish him. He calls out, begging for forgiveness before clutching his heart as he experiences a massive heart attack and collapses on the floor - dead.
session_synopses.Victim_001_AD_Dying: Edgecase for if you don't speak to the victim and he has to die. You're about to puke your guts up after being de-petrified

PAD_FoundBrothersAfterLongRest.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundBrothersAfterLongRest.text: Be ready. Whoever - or whatever - did this could be close.

session_synopses.PAD_FoundBrothersAfterLongRest: This occurs after the player has refused to help the brothers and subsequently finds them dead/one of them dead. It can trigger in the swamp, teahouse or lair, and you may not know that Ethel is a hag at this point (depending on where it triggers). In the first, you've met the brothers, in the second you skipped the confrontation and have no idea who these men are.

Brother_002_AD_Fallback.speaker: Johl
Brother_002_AD_Fallback.context: NodeContext: You're in the swamp and want to keep moving. Gruff and impatient.

Brother_001_AD_BrotherDied.speaker: Demir
Brother_001_AD_BrotherDied.context: NodeContext: You're brother has just died in front of you.

Brother_001_AD_Fallback.speaker: Demir
Brother_001_AD_Fallback.context: NodeContext: Looking around, scared but trying not to show it.

ThankPlayer.context: NodeContext: Player has just saved Ethel. This is exactly what she hoped would happen. Still playing up the old lady act -upset and frazzled and overcome with emotion.

ThankPlayer.text: I - I didn't mean for this to happen.

ThankPlayer.speaker: Player
ThankPlayer.text: The best thanks are paid in gold.
Oh, you're a cheeky pup, aren't you?
ThankPlayer.context: NodeContext: Player has asked for gold in return for saving her. You're delighted at how brazen they're being. This is said in a gentle and teasing tone - with a smile.

ThankPlayer.text: But I can respect someone who gets down to business.
ThankPlayer.context: NodeContext: This is true - admiration in your voice.

ThankPlayer.text: And such heroic deeds deserve proper thanks.
ThankPlayer.context: NodeContext: A sublle hint of amused menace here.

ThankPlayer.text: Why don't you stop by my house? I'll be sure to look after you. See you soon, dearie.
ThankPlayer.context: NodeContext: Cheeky wink and a grin.

Confrontation.text: Lads, for the love of all that is holy, I've never clapped eyes on your poor sister.
Confrontation.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking at the brothers - hasn't noticed the player yet. NodeContext: Opening line of the dialogue. Annoyed as you plead with the two men who advance on you. You sound sincere and genuine.

Confrontation.speaker: Johl
Confrontation.text: Drop the act, hag. You was the last to see Mayrina.
Confrontation.context: NodeContext: Not buying Auntie Ethel's claim that she hasn't seen Mayrina. Accusation and fury in your voice - you're prepared to get violent if needs be.

Confrontation.speaker: Demir
Confrontation.text: Just let her go. Please.
Confrontation.context: NodeContext: Your brother is on the brink of violence and you're trying to regain control of the situation. You just want your baby sister back, you don't want anyone to get hurt.

Confrontation.text: You there! Please, I don't know what's come over these boys. I just want to go home.
Confrontation.context: NodeContext: You've caught sight of the player. You call out, fear and pleading in your voice - in your mind you've hatched a plan - you're going to force the player to defend you and kill the brothers.

session_synopses.Brother_002_AD_Fallback: Player tries to speak to the brother while either the other brother is in the shared Brothers dialogue (and this one missed it for some reason), or because they're waiting for the hag to come back into the house and start her dialogue.
session_synopses.Brother_001_AD_BrotherDied: Occurs when Demir's brother dies in front of him.
session_synopses.Brother_001_AD_Fallback: Player tries to speak to the brother while either the other brother is in the shared Brothers dialogue (and this one missed it for some reason), or because they're waiting for the hag to come back into the house and start her dialogue.
session_synopses.ThankPlayer:
This dialogue occurs if the player has sided with the hag in the ambush and saved her - by killing the brothers.
She's still in old lady mode, hamming up how upset she is, but there should be a hint on the last set of questions, about the gold, that this was an act and that there is more to her than meets the eye.
session_synopses.Confrontation: Auntie Ethel has been cornered by two brothers - Demir and Johl - who claim Ethel is a hag and has taken their sister. Ethel is pleading that she has no idea what they're talking about and begs the player to help her.Ethel is actually a hag. Should we step back and do thing, she summons monsters to cut the two brothers down. Should we side with her, we have to kill the brothers. Should we side with the brothers, Ethel is angry and disappears with a threat.

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: Ah, a fellow wanderer. Forgive the aroma.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Friendly - noticing a stranger, wryly apologising for the slight stench

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You catch a waft of something foul - metallic and sickly-sweet.*

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: Powdered iron-vine. Most monsters will think twice before making a meal of me.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Explaining the smell in the air - he's taken a foul substance designed to ward off monsters

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: An old hunter's trick - if you can't mask your scent, spoil it.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Friendly, unassuming, as if what he's saying is perfectly conventional

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You're a monster hunter? Not what I imagined.

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: Hah. Perhaps that is why I have survived so long where more fearsome peers have not.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Serene, absolutely unoffended by us basically saying he doesn't look too tough

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: You would be wise to look past the seeming of things, if you intend to bargain with the lady of this house.

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: A sharp wit will serve you better, if you're to bargain with the lady of this house.

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: That is why you come to her lair, I take it? To bargain?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Gently prodding for our story

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: It's a teahouse - hardly a lair.

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: A charming sight, to be sure. But the prettiest web still has a spider sitting at its centre.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of sign for tea-house here if possible.

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: Her kind have hidden among us since the first darkness - and their knowledge is matched only by their spite.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Growing slightly grave - telling us of a great evil thing that is not to be underestimated

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: Know how to ask, and they'll share that knowledge. If you're fool enough to pay their price.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Telling us the risk might be worth the reward - but is is a great risk

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: And are you fool enough?

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: Of course. I'm a hunter who lost his prey, and here I am seeking help from something worse.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Amused and absolutely accepting of his own foolishness

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: But she thrives on suffering. Once she hears what awaits my quarry when I catch him, she will help.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Growing grave

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Any advice on how to deal with her?

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: Scream. Turn. Run the other way - that's what I'd like to say.

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: But bad as she is, I'm betting whatever drove you to her door is worse.

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: So instead: know you're outmatched. Know what you're willing to give. And mind your manners.

session_synopses.Dead: We can speak to Gandrel if he dies - he'll hint at his mission to hunt Astarion on behalf of Maiden Fel. Separate options if it's Astarion himself speaking to him.
session_synopses: Male, middle-age or older.Gandrel is a monster hunter we encounter outside the Hag's lair. He's pleasant, cheerful, and a little eccentric - but shows his experience and expertise when warning us about the hag. He's affable and unassuming, but shows moments of steel when discussing his quarry (Astarion). A younger General Iroh from Avatar is a good reference - someone who makes you feel good about yourself just by conversing with you.

HusbandGraveForcefield.speaker: Player
HusbandGraveForcefield.context: NodeContext: You just tried to touch a coffin, but it has a forcefield, which hits you with psychic damage.

session_synopses.HusbandGraveForcefield: A forcefield surrounds a coffin. Everytime you touch it, it causes more psychic damage.

session_synopses.WRLD_TendFlowers_HumanForm: Timeline dialog for Auntie Ethel in human form tending flowers

PAD_SidedHag.speaker: Player
PAD_SidedHag.text: Bloody way to end an argument. I hope we chose the right side.

PAD_SidedHag.speaker: Player
PAD_SidedHag.text: No point in debating what's already done. Let's go on ahead.

session_synopses.PAD_SidedHag: This VB plays after saving Ethel from the two brothers of the sister she's holding captive. Ether disappeared in a magic puff, and she was acting suspicious. The players are reacting to her exit and discussing that there may be more to Ethel than meets the eye.Speaker 1 may have been the character who was in dialog for the scene with Ethel. Speaker 2 is another party member. However, since there may be combat, this setup isn't guaranteed and it's best to write this assuming everyone had a hand in the actions that led to this VB playing.

PAD_ProtectedAstarion.speaker: Player
PAD_ProtectedAstarion.text: You protected a child-stealing vampire? Bold choice.

PAD_ProtectedAstarion.speaker: Player
PAD_ProtectedAstarion.text: Let's hope it doesn't come back to bite me later.

session_synopses.PAD_ProtectedAstarion: This voicebark plays when a player chooses to not give up Astarion to the Gur hunter.Speaker 1 is assumed to be the player who did this action, and speaker 2 may have an opinionated comment on the outcome.Astarion can be neither of the speakers.

HagLair_Victim_003.speaker: Lorin
HagLair_Victim_003.context: NodeContext: *With a gasp, the corpse shuddered.*

AD_ControlledByMask.speaker: Player
AD_ControlledByMask.text: Get out. GET OUT OF MY HEAD!
AD_ControlledByMask.context: CinematicNodeContext: Clutching head NodeContext: Panicked and afraid as the hag invades your mind. Lae'zel's line; Pa'vrylk = Stop! Pronounced; PAH-vrill-ck

AD_ControlledByMask.text: Quiet, little one. Auntie will make it all better.
AD_ControlledByMask.context: NodeContext: Soothing and cruel. A vicious insult as you take over their mind.

Lair.text: You come to my home, interfere in my business, and now have the gall to face me in the heart of my lair? You petulant bollocks.
Lair.context: NodeContext: This begins the fight. Roaring it at the player - likely on the other side of the lair. They've freed your captive and you are furious and out of blood. Fit to kill everyone in the room.

Lair.text: I'll rip your spine out your arsehole.
I'll use your blood to spice my stew.
I'll keep you alive until I've sucked the marrow from your bones.
And then I'll bring you back and do it all over again.

MaskedVictim1_AD_FailResist.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_AD_FailResist.text: Yes, Auntie. I'll break their pretty little bones.
MaskedVictim1_AD_FailResist.context: NodeContext: Wearing a mask that controls her - at this point, it's commanded her to kill the player and she revels in what she's going to do

MaskedVictim2.speaker: Mask of Servitude
MaskedVictim2.context: NodeContext: terrified, brainwashed to believe we want to harm them

AD_PutOnMask.speaker: Player
AD_PutOnMask.context: NodeContext: Intrigued as you look around

AD_PutOnMask.text: Hello, petal. Just relax. Let me in.

MaskedVictim1.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1.text: We need to leave. You're not supposed to be here - she'll be furious.
MaskedVictim1.context: CinematicNodeContext: panicked, confused, as if coming out of a stuporNodeContext: confused, afraid

MaskedVictim1.speaker: Player
MaskedVictim1.text: You served her - give me one good reason to let you live.

MaskedVictim1.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1.text: It was the mask. It dug its roots into me... took away my will. I tried to fight it.
MaskedVictim1.context: NodeContext: explaining something she barely understands

AD_WearMask.text: You'll break eventually, precious. They always do.
AD_WearMask.context: NodeContext: You are attempting to break into someone's mind and take over from afar. Voice is low and seductive - enticing.

session_synopses.AD_ControlledByMask: The player has failed the wisdom save while wearing the mask - and fallen prey to the hag's control. Auntie Ethel takes over your mind.
session_synopses.Lair: These are fired at the very beginning of the fight with the hag - tense scene. Hag is at one end of the cavern. Mayrina is trapped in a cage in the middle. Player is on the other side.
session_synopses.MaskedVictim1_AD_FailResist: Responding to a telephatic command from the hag's mask to kill the player.
session_synopses.MaskedVictim2: A victim of the hag, bound into her service for so long that their mind is almost completely lost. This victim is wearing the Mask of Terror, which fills them with fear of everything but the hag.
session_synopses.AD_PutOnMask: Player has put on the mask and looks around - relaising they can see things different (it allows them to bypass several illusions and traps within the hag's lair). However, the hag will attempt to break into their mind.
session_synopses.MaskedVictim1: A victim of the hag, forced to wear a mask that takes away her free will so that she fights for and serves the hag. If the hag is killed, this character regains her senses and resolve. She's deeply shaken by her experience, but courageous, telling the player that she'll inform the people of Baldur's Gate of our heroism, and vowing to hunt down the hag's accomplices in the city.
session_synopses.AD_WearMask: This occurs when the player puts on the hag mask and on ever subsequent 'turn' thereafter. The player must continually succeed on a wisdom save or risk the hag taking over their mind.

AD_HagCackles.context: NodeContext: A set of different cackles for Ethel. All evil. All nasty. All mean. At least three different kinds.

PAD_Explore1.speaker: Player
PAD_Explore1.text: That smell - something died in here.

AD_VictimSign_TalkingDoor.text: 'A thief who tried to steal from Auntie. Now the good little pet guards my home.'

AD_VictimSign_004.text: 'My sweet Calim, whose beloved asked that his beauty never fade.'

PAD_MaskedVictimsNeutral.speaker: Player
PAD_MaskedVictimsNeutral.text: They're not attacking. Must think I'm one of them.

Victim_001.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001.text: I'm getting out of this hellhole. You'd best do the same.
Victim_001.context: NodeContext: You're alive but that could change at any moment. Nearly running out the door.

AD_VictimSign_005.text: 'This poor dear wished never to lay eyes on her family again.'

VB_BurningCage.speaker: Player
VB_BurningCage.context: NodeContext: You're trying to save a woman. She's trapped in a cage that is one fire.

AD_SpawnDoublesPhase2.context: NodeContext: You've turned invisible and disappeared during the fight. Sing song and mocking tone.

TalkingDoor.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor.text: *The presence within sobs. The hag is gone. He's trapped in this door, this wooden prison - forever.*
TalkingDoor.context: InternalNodeContext: The hag is dead, and the player saw that it was alive in the past.

AD_VictimSign_002.text: 'My darling Magron. She wished for the mind of a genius, but the silly head crossed me.'

AD_MayrinaIllusion_Real.speaker: Mayrina
AD_MayrinaIllusion_Real.context: NodeContext: Breatheless, relieved. Ran across the battlefield to get to the player.

Victim_003_Dead.speaker: Narrator
Victim_003_Dead.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

AD_MayrinaIllusion_Fake.text: Don't let that awful hag hurt me!
AD_MayrinaIllusion_Fake.context: NodeContext: This is the fake illusion. She has Mayrina's voice and is pretending to be Mayrina. Crying in the fight - begging and pleading for the player to believe that they are the real Mayrina and the other is the fake. It should ring a little false.

AD_SummonVictims.context: NodeContext: You're forcing two people to come help you in battle - it's a spell and they have no free will. Soft alluring voice as you call our to them across the room.

Victim_005_Dead.speaker: Narrator
Victim_005_Dead.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

VB_MayrinaInCage.speaker: Player
VB_MayrinaInCage.context: NodeContext: You've spotted the woman you're trying to save.

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed.text: I was a fool. I wanted to know my fate. I had a choice between two lives, and I was frightened of choosing wrong.
Victim_003_Freed.context: NodeContext: Player has asked how you ended up in the hag lair. Your voice is filled with regret.

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed.text: I asked the hag to help me see what the future would hold. Got what I wished for, too.

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed.text: I saw my future self - a corpse, rotten with maggots. And everyone around me dead. Putrid and dead.
Victim_003_Freed.context: NodeContext: Dazed horror as you recall the visions that pushed you to the brink of insanity.

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Player
Victim_003_Freed.text: You mentioned choosing between two lives. What were they?

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed.text: A boring story. Stay or go. Marriage and kids or a life of novelty.
Victim_003_Freed.context: NodeContext: Your voice is filled with regret. You gave up everything because you were too afarid to make a choice.

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed.text: I lost my best years rather than just... choose.

AD_VictimSign_003.text: 'My gentle Lorin. He wished to know what was to come.'

AD_SurrogateMotherInCage.speaker: Mayrina
AD_SurrogateMotherInCage.context: NodeContext: Sobbing and crying. The cage n which you're hanging over an abyss is on fire. You're absolute freaking out and screaming for help.

Victim_004.speaker: Narrator
Victim_004.text: *You see the shadowed outline of a figure.*

VB_MirrorScreams.speaker: Player
VB_MirrorScreams.context: NodeContext: Confused at the sound but you can't tell where it is.

PutOnMask.text: Hello, petal. My, my - the mask suits you. Just relax. See the world with fresh eyes.
And let your dear old Auntie Ethel look after you.

AD_VictimSign_001.text: 'My dearest Efrin. He begged me to halt the deadly disease that ravaged him.'

AD_SpawnDoublesPhase1.text: Am I here? Or am I there?
AD_SpawnDoublesPhase1.context: NodeContext: You've summoned illusions of yourself to confuse and taunt the player. You're calling out to them in a mocking and amused tone.

AD_ViciousMockery.text: Freakish thing. I bet everyone stares when you walk by.

AD_Victim_003.speaker: Lorin
AD_Victim_003.context: CinematicNodeContext: One the ground - cowering. Curled up - looking in front of you at a mirror and then ducking behind your hands. NodeContext: Panicked and afraid. You're severely traumatised and not really aware of your surroundings.

AD_BrotherReactToMayrinaIllusion.speaker: Johl
AD_BrotherReactToMayrinaIllusion.text: I smell you from here, hag. That ain't Rina!
AD_BrotherReactToMayrinaIllusion.context: NodeContext: You're in the middle of a fight. The hag has assumed the form of your sister but you can tell it's fake. Calling out a warning to the player - anger in your voice that the hag would try to trick you.

EntranceDouble.text: You are as thick as they come, sweetness.
EntranceDouble.context: NodeContext: Threatening smile while taunting player.The old lady act is gone.

HagBegsForMercy.text: Wait! Argh. Wait just a tick.
HagBegsForMercy.context: NodeContext: You're on the brink of being defeated in the fight and you've stopped it - preparing to beg for your life with a new deal. You're breathless and in pain, fighting to regain control.

HagBegsForMercy.text: Killing me is a waste of time - I'll find a way to return. Always have, always will.
HagBegsForMercy.context: NodeContext: little breathy from the fight, coldly determined in the second line

HagBegsForMercy.text: But it's... unpleasant. So how about we be civilised about this, hmm? I have something you want.
HagBegsForMercy.context: NodeContext: wincing at the thought in the first line, turning on the charm in the second, trying to regain control

HagBegsForMercy.speaker: Player
HagBegsForMercy.text: Indeed. I'll take your head and stick it on a pike.
Now, petal, there's... there's no need for such talk.
HagBegsForMercy.context: NodeContext: Player has threatened to kill you. You're scared and not used to it - trying not to show it.

AD_HagAttacksCage.text: Aw, did the girl die? So very sad.
AD_HagAttacksCage.context: NodeContext: The pregnant woman has died. Utter sarcasm here - taunting the player for failing to save her.

PAD_AtEntrance.speaker: Player
PAD_AtEntrance.context: NodeContext: Wyll's line: a bit sing-songy but not too much.

Victim_003_PAD_Mindflayer.speaker: Player
Victim_003_PAD_Mindflayer.text: A mind flayer. No intention of letting that happen.

session_synopses.AD_HagCackles: A set of different cackles for Ethel to be used in the lair.
session_synopses.PAD_Explore1: Players have wandered into the Hag Lair without Ethel being present and are commenting on the creepy environment. This is the first to fire.
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_TalkingDoor: This person has been turned into a door and is unable to speak. Sign attached to it.
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_004: This person is trapped in a mirror and mute.
session_synopses.PAD_MaskedVictimsNeutral: You are wearing the mask and the other masked victims do not attack you.
session_synopses.Victim_001:
The dwarf was turned to stone by the hag to stop the spread of an deadly disease - Laduguer's Bite. Little does he know that the hag was the one who cause the disease in the first place.

Should you remove the petrification spell BEFORE the hag is dead, the disease will kill him.

Should you speak to him after the hag is dead, you can figure out that the hag is the one who made him sick in the first place.
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_005: An eyeless woman - dead. One of the hag's victims. You're reading a sign in front of her eyeless body.
session_synopses.VB_BurningCage: This occurs when the hag sets the cage on fire.
session_synopses.AD_SpawnDoublesPhase2: The hag turns invisible and disappears during the fight.
session_synopses.TalkingDoor: The door guarding the entrance to the hag's lair. It's actually transparent and the player can walk through it. It's a cut scene as the door tries to project images onto the player and communicate to them. Pleading with them to leave. The door was a thief that was taken by Ethel and torn to shreds, with the remainder of his body transformed into a door.Much of this is a 'cut scene' as the door projects visions into the player's mind instead of communicating.
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_002: A victim holding their own decapitated head in their hands. This is the sign attached to their corpse.
session_synopses.AD_MayrinaIllusion_Real: Triggered during the fight with the hag. She has sent out illusions mimicking Mayrina. The real Mayrina is trying running towards the player. Her voice and mannerisms should be a clue to the player that this is the real Mayrina.
session_synopses.Victim_003_Dead: The characters has died and player is using the 'speak with dead' spell. Character is at peace. He lived in fear of his own death. Now that it's happened, he's at peace.
session_synopses.AD_MayrinaIllusion_Fake: These are fired during the fight. It's the hag pretending to be Mayrina.
session_synopses.AD_SummonVictims: Auntie Ethel summons victim_001 and victime_003 to aide her in battle.
session_synopses.Victim_005_Dead: A dialogue with the corpse of a hag victim with her eyes gouged out. She is happy to be dead-- she lived a terrible life and carried family secrets heavily upon her. Her voice should be meek and delicate. She has borne too much in this life already and is ready to be done.
session_synopses.VB_MayrinaInCage: Triggers when the player enters the lair and sees Mayrina trapped in the cage.
session_synopses.Victim_003_Freed: This occurs if Lorin survived the fight with the hag. He is dazed and out of it. This is the victim who first say the player as a mind flayer and freaked out. 1) In scenario one, he was never summoned by the hag2) He was summoned and attacked the player and saw the player turn into a mindflayer3) He was summoned and attacked the player but never saw the player as a mind flayer
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_003: This person is alive but severely traumatised and hysterical.
session_synopses.AD_SurrogateMotherInCage: ADs fire by Mayrina when she is trapped in the cage. In the first set it's when combat has started and she is cheering the player on, in the second set she just wants the player to leave her alone. In the third set the cage is on fire, and in the last the fighting is over but she's still locked in the cage.
session_synopses.Victim_004: A victim of the hag's. They're trapped inside a mirror.
session_synopses.VB_MirrorScreams: Trigger near mirror - someone is trapped inside.
session_synopses.PutOnMask: Player put on mask and is hearing auntie's voice telepathically booming around them.
