session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_001: This is the plaque that is attached to the petrified body of one of the hag's victims.
session_synopses.AD_SpawnDoublesPhase1: The fires as Ethel summons illusions of herself to confuse the player.
session_synopses.AD_ViciousMockery: The Hag will cast Vicious Mockery on the party in combat. Whoever she targets will be insulted by origin or race. If a character is targeted multiple times, another insult in the chain will be used.
session_synopses.AD_Victim_003: This is a victim of the hag. He was cursed to see the future - he's severely traumatised. In the first AD he's been summoned to fight by the hag. In the rest, he's curled up ont he ground and talking to himself. Severely traumatised.
session_synopses.AD_BrotherReactToMayrinaIllusion: The hag assumes the form of Mayrina in the boss fight. The brothers are able to tell who is Mayrina and who is the hag.
session_synopses.EntranceDouble: This fires when the player enters the victim gallery, She appears to taunt them and then vanishes.
session_synopses.HagBegsForMercy: The hag is on the brink of defeated. She's stoppped the fight to try and plead for her life by offering the player the thing she does best - a deal. If Mayrina is present she asks offers you a powerful gift in exchange for her life (she will also take Mayrina with her) or the hag can bargain for Mayrina's life but lose out on the powerful gift. It is a tense and heightened situation.
session_synopses.AD_HagAttacksCage: These are fired during the fight with the hag. The first occurs when Mayrina's cage is set on fire, the second if she dies.
session_synopses.PAD_AtEntrance: Combat has started with the hag. She's fled downstairs. You've gone through the fireplace and have just appeared in her lair. Furtive. Looking around for Auntie Ethel.
session_synopses.Victim_003_PAD_Mindflayer: This occurs after speaking to the prescient victim in the hag's lair, who sees the player turn into a mind flayer in a vision.
session_synopses.PAD_Explore2: Players are wandering around the Hag Lair and have gotten into her workshop. It is filled with blood and bones. The hag may or may not be alive at this point.

SurrogateMother_Lair.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Lair.text: I'm so stupid. How could I have trusted her?
SurrogateMother_Lair.context: NodeContext: Shake and horrified - you've just survived a near death experience.

SurrogateMother_Lair.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Lair.text: I almost gave that monster my child.
SurrogateMother_Lair.context: NodeContext: The true horror of what you almost did is dawning on you - giving your child to a hag.

SurrogateMother_Lair.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Lair.context: NodeContext: Struggling to pull yourself together - but managing. If the player doesn't want to hear about how upset you are, you have too much pride to continue talking about the child/deal.

session_synopses.SurrogateMother_Lair: This occurs after the hag fight. Mayrina is in one of two states. In the top she is horrified, shaken and trying to calm herself. She can't believe she almost made a deal with the hag and explains her deal to the player.In the second, she is FURIOUS with the player for ruining her deal. And leaves angry with them (unless you tell her about ethel planning to eat her child.)

AlarmUsedReaction.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction.text: Hah! Lads, looks like this idiot just went and raised the alarm on theirselves!
AlarmUsedReaction.context: NodeContext: Derisive, can't believe you're this stupid

Guard005.speaker: Sharp-Eye Snurd
Guard005.text: I can see the Absolute from here. I can!

Guard004.speaker: Tracker Rindle
Guard004.context: InternalNodeContext: Gained access by poop smearingNodeContext: Level of disgust - player has shit on their face.

Worg_001.speaker: Klaw
Worg_001.text: Wearin' me muck. Muck on ya. Good muck.
Worg_001.context: NodeContext: Sniffing and snuffling at the shit on your face. Spoken quickly, primal.

CliffWarning.speaker: Sharp-Eye Snurd
CliffWarning.text: Oi, thicko! This here's off-limits. Get to the main gate, or I'll plug you full o' arrows.
CliffWarning.context: NodeContext: Warning an intruder to leave  - shouting last line

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sentinel Olak
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.text: Well! Look who's gettin' dragged back. And by such high company! How badly did you mess up?
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: Olak to Sazza, a fellow goblin he doesn't have respect for.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sazza
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.text: Can it! I know something Ragzlin will want to hear.
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: Sazza is ragging on Olak. They don't like each other.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sazza
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.text: I been in some druids' grove. This one sprang me. Now move over, so I can tell Ragzlin myself!
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: Sazza is arguing on the player's behalf to the hostile Olak.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sentinel Olak
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.text: Hold on. Where are the raiders?
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: Olak is full of gleeful malice.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sentinel Olak
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.text: Ragzlin's drow friend won't be happy to hear that.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sazza
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.text: She'll be happy enough when I tell her where them looters is holin' up. Let me through.
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: Hard 'g' on ranga. Sazza's pride is wounded but she hates Olak, so doesn't want to show it.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sentinel Olak
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.text: Go on. I ain't gonna hold up a drow.
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.context: CinematicNodeContext: Olak turns to the playerNodeContext: To player. Cool and malicious.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sazza
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.text: C'mon! Gotta let the drow True Soul know where them looters is. We'll be heroes!
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: To player. More bright and friendly.

Guard003.speaker: Tracker Bal
Guard003.context: InternalNodeContext: thinks player is priestNodeContext: deferential, thinks player is a True Soul

Backup002.speaker: Devout Wasp
Backup002.text: ... an' the gnoll gnawed 'er arm clean off. So much for the Flamin' Fist, eh?
Backup002.context: CinematicNodeContext: Speaking to other goblins at table.

Backup002.speaker: Devout Wasp
Backup002.text: The Fist? Merc pigs from Baldur's Gate. Good for one thing: feedin' to worgs.

Backup001.speaker: Sharp-Eye Sluck
Backup001.context: NodeContext: Greeting node inquiring - is the player part of her clan?

Backup001.speaker: Sharp-Eye Sluck
Backup001.context: CinematicNodeContext: She gives player a drink (item goes into inventory).NodeContext: Elated. Player has confirmed they're from the same clan. She gives player a drink (item goes into inventory).

Worg_002.speaker: Small Klaw
Worg_002.text: Touch me 'n I'll bleed ye out.
Worg_002.context: NodeContext: A seething whisper. Used to being mistreated

AlarmSystem.speaker: Narrator
AlarmSystem.text: *A great, taut drum sits before you. One strike would likely ring for miles, alerting goblin reinforcements.*

AlarmSystem.speaker: Narrator
AlarmSystem.text: *The echoes of the drumbeat fade to silence.*

session_synopses.AlarmUsedReaction: The player used the alarm drum, which is meant to alert other guards that there are enemies attacking. Depending on who the player is and how they performed, the goblins around the alarm will either be impressed, neutral, or willing to fight.
session_synopses.Guard005: Goblin standing on a hill. Fibbing like a child about what he can see.
session_synopses.Guard004: Goblin grunt guarding a checkpoint. Laconic; gruff.
session_synopses.Worg_001: Squirrely, quick-breathing, animalian worg (wolf-like creature) stands guard at a checkpoint with its masters.
session_synopses.CliffWarning: Goblin warns an intruder to leave
session_synopses.ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin:
If the player released the captured goblin in Halsin's den, the CG will be waiting for the player at the checkpoint. When the player starts the dialog with the main guard at the checkpoint (or gets closer to him) and the CG is at the checkpoint, this dialog is shown. After this dialog, the CG leaves the checkpoint and the main guard gets his normal dialog back.

 Olak and Sazza have a very antagonistic relationship, ripping each other to shreds.
session_synopses.Guard003: A goblin grunt guarding a checkpoint. Squirrely, animalian type. Friendlier than most, but not extremely friendly.
session_synopses.Backup002: One of the three goblins that are serve as a backup for the checkpoint in case of emergency. Telling a story of the inn ransacking. Really into violence :)
session_synopses.TopCliffWarning: Player is climbing a cliff they shouldn't be and is spotted by a goblin guard.
session_synopses.Backup001: One of the three goblins that are serve as a backup for the checkpoint in case of emergency. This goblin is a bit touched in the head and wonders whether you're a member of her tribe. She's a woman even though some of the notes are male.
session_synopses.Worg_002: An attack beast used to mistreatment stands guard with its masters. Fearful, vengeful beast.
session_synopses.AlarmSystem: The dialog for the alarm system. If the player activates it then the first half of the camp will become hostile.

RewardPenance.speaker: Abdirak
RewardPenance.text: Sweet child. While I enjoyed that, I'm afraid your reaction was... lacking.
RewardPenance.context: NodeContext: Voice low and intimate. Player did penance but did not react correctly. He regrets that the player does not get a reward (but he had a great time, which is all he really cares abotu)

RewardPenance.speaker: Abdirak
RewardPenance.text: To gain Loviatar's favour, every single strike should be met with an honest cry of pain - or perhaps a touch of begging.

RewardPenance.speaker: Abdirak
RewardPenance.text: Nevertheless, thank you. And I pray you've learned from today's little... lesson.

Battlestation.speaker: Abdirak
Battlestation.text: Dear child, the goblins have blood on their minds. I am leaving - I suggest you do the same.
Battlestation.context: NodeContext: The goblins are fighting, he's calm and measured but about to flee. He wants no part in it.

PostPenance.speaker: Abdirak
PostPenance.context: NodeContext: Player has finished penance. Speaking to player as if speaking to a loved one.

PostPenance.speaker: Abdirak
PostPenance.text: Loviatar herself found your performance inspiring and wishes to bless you.
PostPenance.context: NodeContext: Voice intimate and filled with admiration. His goddess has chosen to bless the player - a sacred gift.

PostPenance.speaker: Player
PostPenance.text: What would such a blessing entail?

PostPenance.speaker: Abdirak
PostPenance.context: NodeContext: As if speaking to a lover.

PostPenance.text: CinematicNodeContext: This can be anything - for reaching a hand out and gently passing it over the player to holding both hands out and closing his eyes in concentration as he passes on the blessing. As long as it is something that indicates that a spell/blessing is happening, it can be anything. NodeContext: Not voiced
PostPenance.context: CinematicNodeContext: This can be anything - for reaching a hand out and gently passing it over the player to holding both hands out and closing his eyes in concentration as he passes on the blessing. As long as it is something that indicates that a spell/blessing is happening, it can be anything. NodeContext: Not voiced

PostPenance.speaker: Abdirak
PostPenance.text: And on a personal note, thank you. That was positively divine.
PostPenance.context: NodeContext: This is a low, sultry. Almost whispered in the player's ear. Sexy and intimate. But also creepy as all hell.

session_synopses.RewardPenance:
Father Abdirak is a follower of Loviatar, a goddess that thrives on inflicting pain on others. He is indulging in some private 'worship' (self flagellation). He offers to help alleviate the player's pain by giving them 'penance' - i.e, beating them. 
Loviatar = loh-VEE-a-tar. He is a young and charismatic preacher with a threatening and creepy edge.
session_synopses.Battlestation: The goblins are fighting. He's going to leave, He loves pain - not death.
session_synopses.PostPenance: |Abdirak fully completed his penance with a player. It can't be tried again.|

Spiders_Wildshape.speaker: Larger Giant Spider
Spiders_Wildshape.text: |We generally eat people and other animals that end up here|

Spiders_Wildshape.speaker: Smaller Giant Spider
Spiders_Wildshape.text: |Eated! Eated! Is it eated or eaten, sis?|

Spiders_Wildshape.speaker: Player
Spiders_Wildshape.text: |But wait! Goblins are so much tastier and with our animal forces combined, we can get a feast unlike anything you had!|

Spiders_Wildshape.speaker: Larger Giant Spider
Spiders_Wildshape.text: |At least you recognize us as animals. Refreshing!|

Spiders_Wildshape.speaker: Larger Giant Spider
Spiders_Wildshape.text: |But the cage gate is closed and we cannot leave right now. Open it and feast shall be ours|

CapturedGoblin.speaker: Sazza
CapturedGoblin.text: Let me go. I'll sneak off and become a hermit - won't cause trouble for nobody.
CapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: pleading; just survived an attempted execution

session_synopses.CapturedGoblin: Sazza after she survives 'execution' the the spider pit. Pleading to the player to let her leave (which she will if she's not killed)

node_data.speaker: Devout Cry
node_data.text: Shh. Show some respec'.

session_synopses: Goblin observer part of ritual. Wants you to be respectful of the king.

Goblin_001.speaker: Warrior Plagg
Goblin_001.text: Make a wrong move, and Boss Ragzlin'll chew you up and spit out the chunks!

Goblin_002.speaker: Sharp-Eye Crub
Goblin_002.text: Nowhere the faithless can hide. It's the Absolute's world now!

session_synopses.Goblin_001: Goblin talking about that chump hero the Blade of Frontiers
session_synopses.Goblin_002: One goblin announced the blade of frontiers has no change against the Absolute!

node_data.speaker: Zurga
node_data.text: You been out there spillin' blood for the Absolute?
node_data.context: NodeContext: appraising the player

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Leave.

session_synopses: Sober goblin, tough, itching for a fight.

Guard.speaker: Warrior Plig
Guard.text: Steal somethin' or act the bollocks, will ya? I'm itching to throw someone in the brig. It'll be fun. I promise.
Guard.context: NodeContext: plig wants the player to act out so she can throw them in jail

Escapee_Dead.speaker: Player
Escapee_Dead.text: Were you the only prisoner here?

Escapee_Dead.speaker: Dead Elf
Escapee_Dead.text: Goblins took... my friends. Cut them up... for the worgs. For meat.

session_synopses.Guard: Warrior Plig is a goblin on patrol around the wolf pens in the goblin camp. She's bored and wishing for some action.
session_synopses.Escapee_Dead: A dead body is found trapped in a half-dug prison hole. After freeing him, it's clear he died attempting to escape the prison before ended up like the rest as worg chow.

node_data.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
node_data.text: Huh? What do you want? I'm tryin' to concentrate on readin'!
node_data.context: NodeContext: pleased with himself

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Can I see the manuscript?

node_data.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
node_data.text: I ain't finished with it! There's enough readin' here to last me a lifetime.
node_data.context: NodeContext: indignant

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You should spend your time in prayer - not reading this nonsense.
True

node_data.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
node_data.text: S'pose you're right. Absolute rewards faith, not book-learnin'.
node_data.context: NodeContext: after being persuaded to give something away - pleased to have learned something

node_data.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
node_data.text: Take it. Maybe if I pray hard enough I can get some of that booyahg for myself.

session_synopses: He is smarter than your average goblin, and is reading a manuscript - loose papers, freshly written by Volo. It's a study of goblin behaviour that would give anyone who reads it an advantage in combat against goblins.

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: That the jingle of coin I hear? You've timed it well, my friend.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Custom CamNodeContext: Warm and welcoming (a kind of mercantile 'Who do we have here?')

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: Already turned quite the profit today, so I'm feeling generous.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Trying to coax you into a deal

node_data.text: True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You recognise the crest she bears - the winged serpent of the Zhentarim.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera should show Crest of Zhentarim she is wearing

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Let me see your wares.

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: Pleasure.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Affable.

session_synopses: A trader from the Zhentarim (z-HENT-ah-rim) , a shady organisation of spies, assassins and dealers in illicit goods. The player may or may not recognise her as such, but either way her attitude is blunt, breezy and unscrupulous. She's there to make money, and you're either there to make a deal or wasting her time - she has absolutely no interest in indecision or moralizing.

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: Praise his ever-bleedin' axe, praise his throne of flamin' iron. Praise Maglubiyet!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: He's speaking to his god, staring upNodeContext: Chanting a prayer fiercely - ma-GLUB-i-yet is the name of his god

node_data.text: False

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: Tryin' to interrupt my prayers? Scared of a real god? You're as gormless as the rest of 'em.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: He turns his attention to the playerNodeContext: Sneering, aggressive, but locked in a cage

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Gormless? I'm not the one behind bars.

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: They'll turn on you soon enuff... then you'll be wishin' you woz in a cage.
node_data.context: NodeContext: mocking advice

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: You'll end up bein' supper for the spiders or the worgs.
node_data.context: NodeContext: mocking

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Spiders and worgs are nothing. I can handle myself.

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: If you 'ad 'alf a brain, you wouldn't be muckin' around in 'ere at all.
node_data.context: NodeContext: advising

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: They've all gone barmy - 'ad their 'eds turned from the old ways by some upstart god!
node_data.context: NodeContext: explaining the situation, frustrated

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: Cuz I'm loyal to Maglubiyet! Cuz I ain't havin' my 'ed turned by some upstart god!
node_data.context: NodeContext: insistent - ma-GLUB-i-yet is his god

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Gods are fickle. Maglubiyet doesn't give a damn about you.

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: Maglubiyet's looked out for me since I was knee-high to a worg-pup.
node_data.context: NodeContext: ma-GLUB-i-yet is his god, sincerely proud of his god

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: Bollocks to this Absolute, I say. And bollocks to you an' all.
node_data.context: NodeContext: annoyed

Saved.speaker: Brakkal
Saved.text: Ha! Look at where the Absolute's love got 'em. Dead!
Saved.context: InternalNodeContext: Goblin was saved from the cage and his attackers are dealt with.NodeContext: happy to see lots of dead heretics

Saved.speaker: Brakkal
Saved.text: Thanks for breakin' me out. Gonna find me a new tribe. One that appreciates the old ways.

session_synopses: A goblin who still follows the old goblin god, Maglubiyet, while the rest of his tribe have started to follow a new god, the Absolute. He sees them as heretics - they think the same of him, and have locked him in a cage.
session_synopses.Saved: A goblin who still follows the old goblin god, Maglubiyet, while the rest of his tribe have started to follow a new god, the Absolute. He sees them as heretics - they think the same of him, and have locked him in a cage. He thanks players after they save him.

Backup_03.speaker: Sharp-Eye Gruz
Backup_03.text: What're you doin' up here anyway? Countin' spider webs? C'mon, get off.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Sudden, barked - she's on guard duty and takes it very seriously, assumes you're a drunkard coming in from the party outside.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Sazza
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: Shut it, Graw. Olak cleared us - got a visitor for the drow, I do.
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: As if at a yapping dog. Sazza and Graw have bad blood, and Sazza loves being in a position of authority above her.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: My arse - what's a True Soul want with any mate o' yours?
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Disbelieving - to Graw, Sazza is the lowest of the low but has always had high opinion of herself.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Sazza
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: Private business, that is. Raidin' business. But if anyone wants a pisspot guarded, we'll call.
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Putting on airs - Sazza has been chosen to go out on raids, Graw hasn't, and Sazza's rubbing it in.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: Just get your friend branded proper, right Sazza? Got better things to do th-
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Disgusted, dismissive. Trying to have the last word and claim a scrap of authority by telling Sazza to the player marked so she doesn't have to stop us again. Cut off at the end by Sazza's reply

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Sazza
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: No you don't. Come on, then.
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Dismissive, bored, matter-of-fact. Snubbing Graw and sweeping past, addressing us to follow with the second line.

session_synopses.Backup_03: Unless you're a (half)drow, this guard doesn't want you to be up in the rafters, but also isn't in the mood to really do anything about it.
session_synopses.3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins: A three-way checkpoint dialog if Sazza (Captured Goblin) was freed in the Den. The guard would usually stop us but instead gives player free access to the Goblin Throne region.

session_synopses.CINE_ClimbDown: Cinematic Cutscene with the character using a ladder to get from the Goblin Camp to the Underdark

Friend0.speaker: Sharp-Eye Breg
Friend0.text: Man, you're like... the best guy I ever met. You just... kicked 'im... like... kicked Crusher's arse.

Friend0.speaker: Sharp-Eye Breg
Friend0.text: It's a secret, right. 'Tween you and me. But I think... I think I like you better. But don't tell 'im.

AtSecludedPlace.speaker: Crusher
AtSecludedPlace.text: 'Scuse me. The other drow are inside. Planning an' such.
AtSecludedPlace.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin gives a very small nod on the excuse me, then motions to the right with his head when the says the drow are inside.NodeContext: He's talking to someone who is higher in rank, and he doesn't like it, but doesn't really want to start a fight.

session_synopses.Friend0: Goblin listening to another goblin's stories. He is very drunk and should be slurring his words.
session_synopses.AtSecludedPlace: Goblin is standing on the bridge, outside the Goblin Camp.

node_data.speaker: Devout Muzul
node_data.text: Lookit this. That's god's mark.
node_data.context: NodeContext: showing a mark on the back of his hand. arrogant

session_synopses: Goblin telling a war-story in which he conflates blind luck with "the will of God".

node_data.speaker: Warrior Druk
node_data.text: We treat the real spiders real kind, True Soul. Feed 'em the plumpest prisoners.
node_data.context: NodeContext: bowing his head, spiders are sacred to drow and he's trying to please a drow player by bragging about how well kept the ones in the camp are

session_synopses: A goblin who guards a pit of giant spiders. To most players, he's rude, but to drow he's deferential and grovels, trying to please them.

Owlbear.speaker: Owlbear Cub
Owlbear.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking aboutNodeContext: SFX only

Owlbear.speaker: Player
Owlbear.text: Kneel down - you won't hurt him.

Owlbear.speaker: Narrator
Owlbear.text: *You notice a shiver run through his feathered coat - fear, a desperate longing for the safety of his nest.*

Owlbear.speaker: Narrator
Owlbear.text: *But his mother is gone - taken. All that's left are these creatures.*

Owlbear.speaker: Player
Owlbear.text: Offer him your hand. He can follow your scent to your camp in the wilderness.

Owlbear.speaker: Owlbear Cub
Owlbear.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cub tilts head, considering player, then backs away and leaves.NodeContext: SFX only - do not record.

session_synopses.Owlbear: This owlbear has been captured by the goblins. It is a cub and has been tormented by the goblins. In this dialog the player can reassure it, guide it to safety, or encourage it to attack the goblins. If the player has convinced his captors to release him, they can invite him to their camp. The owlbear refuses - but will show up later on his own.

node_data.speaker: Warlock Bolt
node_data.text: Shut it. The boss is 'bout to wake that tentacle thing up.

session_synopses: Standard goblin guard. Grouchy.

Torture.speaker: Torturer Spike
Torture.text: I warned you, I WARNED you not to touch him. And now you'll PAY.

Spike_Dead.speaker: Torturer Spike
Spike_Dead.text: ... speaks through True Souls... scour the land... find weapon...

Rat_001.speaker: Narrator
Rat_001.text: *The rat's nose twitches impatiently. Her teeth bite air as though it is flesh, but it doesn't sate her hunger.*

Goblet.speaker: Lookout Grush
Goblet.text: Ya didn't touch my prisoner, didya? 'E's mine. Mine!
Goblet.context: CinematicNodeContext: He might not be standing next to the prisoner anymore.NodeContext: disgruntled and a little crazy. He didn't actually see you do anything, but he's suspicious.

session_synopses.Torture: One of the goblins is torturing a prisoner, either to find out where the grove is, or just because he wants to. The player can try to get rid of him - if Shadowheart is present, she gives some advice on how to do so. If Shadowheart is the avatar, she has unique options criticising the goblin's techniques.
session_synopses.Spike_Dead: Speak with dead: goblin torturer in camp. Non-Wyll version.
session_synopses.Rat_001: Rat in the torture cell who is full of menace and going crazy because of how hungry she is.
session_synopses.Goblet: One of the guards standing next to the torture. He's mean (and a cannibal).

Goblin006.speaker: Sharp-Eye Aggy
Goblin006.text: I ain't never drinkin' again. Never.

GoblinSleeper_01.speaker: Tracker Dullwill
GoblinSleeper_01.context: NodeContext: goblin is drunk and sleeping, belches when disturbed but doesn't wake

Trader.speaker: Grat the Trader
Trader.text: You look like you got something jingling in your pocket.
Trader.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standing in front of his goods, laid out on a blanket

Trader.speaker: Player
Trader.text: Quite the trove. How'd you get your hands on all this?

Trader.speaker: Grat the Trader
Trader.text: Nicked 'em off the dead, didn't I?

Trader.speaker: Grat the Trader
Trader.text: Erh, I mean - raid spoils, your majesticality.
Trader.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wide-eyed, bowingNodeContext: Regretting his choice of words

GoblinKid000.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000.text: Ugh. You look like you've been kissin' a worg's backside.
GoblinKid000.context: CinematicNodeContext: waving his hand in front of his nose, exaggerating a bad smellNodeContext: disgusted and amused - reacting to player having dung smeared on their face. Worg is a wolf-like animal (

GoblinKid000.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000.text: Piss off, or you'll end up like this bleeder.
GoblinKid000.context: NodeContext: cocky, aggressive - 'this bleeder' is a dead adventurer at his feet

GoblinKid000.speaker: Player
GoblinKid000.text: A warning, whelp. Do not threaten me.

GoblinKid000.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000.text: Whatcha gonna do about it? Run off and cry to yer spider-mum?
GoblinKid000.context: NodeContext: talking to a drow - 'spider-mum' refers to the drow goddess Lolth. This is a deeply dangerous and blasphemous thing to say, but he's too immature and cocky to realise he could be getting himself into serious trouble. Doesn't know boundaries.

GoblinKid000.speaker: Player
GoblinKid000.text: No. I'm going to cut out your tongue.

BugbearSleeper_00.speaker: Stimk
BugbearSleeper_00.text: Go away, True Soul. I need sleep.
BugbearSleeper_00.context: NodeContext: just woke, tired and frustrated

Goblin007.speaker: Warlock Gurk
Goblin007.text: Hey, can I see yer brand? The priestess gave me one, and I think she did it wrong.
Goblin007.context: NodeContext: He has been branded (by choice) and his arm is badly burned. He's too drunk to care too much though

Goblin007.speaker: Player
Goblin007.text: Priestess? Is she a healer, too?

Goblin007.speaker: Warlock Gurk
Goblin007.text: Heh. Seen 'er carve more folk than she's cured. Still, she's a Chosen o' the Absolute now.

Goblin007.speaker: Warlock Gurk
Goblin007.text: Hold on. I was askin' you sumfin', wasn't I?
Goblin007.context: NodeContext: Drunk, trying to remember what they were talking about.

DwarfOperator001.speaker: Tracker Grikka
DwarfOperator001.text: Meat ain't ready yet - dwarves take an age to roast.
DwarfOperator001.context: NodeContext: he's cooking a dead dwarf on a spit, thinks we want a piece

DwarfOperator001.speaker: Tracker Grikka
DwarfOperator001.text: D'ya fancy a hunk of dwarf meat, under-dweller? He ain't ready yet.
DwarfOperator001.context: NodeContext: he's cooking a dead dwarf on a spit - 'under-dweller' refers to the fact the player is a duergar, a dark dwarf

DwarfOperator001.speaker: Player
DwarfOperator001.text: Where did you find a dwarf?

DwarfOperator001.speaker: Tracker Grikka
DwarfOperator001.text: He found us! Dunno wot he was doin' 'ere or where he came from.
DwarfOperator001.context: NodeContext: responding to player asking about the dead dwarf he's cooking

DwarfOperator001.speaker: Tracker Grikka
DwarfOperator001.text: Lads inside are tryin' to get answers out of one of his mates.
DwarfOperator001.context: NodeContext: 'tryin' to get answers' means 'torturing'. He's enjoying telling us this.

DwarfOperator001.speaker: Player
DwarfOperator001.text: I can get you answers. Where's the prisoner?

DwarfOperator001.speaker: Tracker Grikka
DwarfOperator001.text: Enjoy pokin' holes in people do ya?
DwarfOperator001.context: NodeContext: amused, we just told him we're willing to help his friends torture somebody

session_synopses.Goblin006: A goblin at a party who has had far too much to drink already. He's celebrating the raid in which the goblins stole all of the booze they're now working their way through.
session_synopses.GoblinKid001: a young goblin kid hanging out with his friends on the periphery of a party. Insulting and rude.
session_synopses.Ogre_00: This ogre has two states: one where he's enjoying the festivities, and one where he is angry at the person who interrupted the festivities.
session_synopses.GoblinSleeper_01: A drunk, sleeping goblin. If woken, he's tired and angry, and likely to attack the player
session_synopses.Trader: Grat is selling items laid out on a blanket in the middle of a drunken celebration in the goblin camp. He's not participating in the drinking - he expects to make a good bit of coin off his drunk mates.
session_synopses.GoblinKid000: A goblin kid, hanging out with two friends at the goblin camp near the corpse of a dead adventurer. He's trying to sound tough, like a cocky teenager impressing his friends.
session_synopses.BugbearSleeper_00: A sleeping bugbear is woken by the players hitting a nearby wall. Like a very angry drunk, woken up with a sore head. Guttural voice - not stupid-sounding, but savage and sinister.
session_synopses.Goblin007: A somewhat zealous goblin eager to tell us about the mark that the Absolute's followers have branded onto their flesh
session_synopses.DwarfOperator001: This goblin is operating a spit, cooking a dead dwarf. He's in a festive area, where his friends are celebrating a recent raid. The dwarf was captured when attempting to steal something from the goblin camp, and he'll tell us a little about that.

WarDrum.speaker: Narrator
WarDrum.text: *This mighty drum is powerful enough to be heard for miles. You need only strike it.*

WarDrum.speaker: Narrator
WarDrum.text: *Chaos ignites in the ruins around you. Goblins howl and spit, clawing for their weapons.*
WarDrum.context: InternalNodeContext: The player might play the drum again when the Backup and Checkpoint goblins are talking or dancing

session_synopses.WarDrum: The dialog for the alarm system. If the player activates it then the first half of the camp will become hostile.

Parent.speaker: Brawler Birka
Parent.text: Come to see the bear? Just wait 'til Boss Ragzlin sets the worgs on it.
Parent.context: NodeContext: Polite in the come to see the traitor node, rude in the other one. She doesn't want to be bothered.

Kid_002.speaker: Three
Kid_002.text: It was so big but... it died so easy.
Kid_002.context: NodeContext: disappointed, doesn't really understand what's going on.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Three
GroupDialogWithBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The bear is tucked away in a corner, trying to make himself small.InternalNodeContext: default - not met, didn't speak about leaving the captiveNodeContext: excited/in awe because he made a bear squeal.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: One
GroupDialogWithBear.context: NodeContext: Giggle before the line. She's excited because the woman makes noises when they throw stones at her.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Brawler Birka
GroupDialogWithBear.context: NodeContext: stern - she's trying to turn this torture into a learning experience for the kids.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Three
GroupDialogWithBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Three picks up a stone and throws it, hitting the bear in its faceNodeContext: A little humph of excertion while Three throws the stone.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Halsin
GroupDialogWithBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear looks up at us, growling in pain.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: One
GroupDialogWithBear.text: Again! Again! Make it squeal again!

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Player
GroupDialogWithBear.text: Sharper stones might cut through all that fur.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Three
GroupDialogWithBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: [reuse] Three picks up a stone and throws it, hitting the bear in its faceNodeContext: Triumphant hump of excertion

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Halsin
GroupDialogWithBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear whimpers as the stone hits him and looks at us directly, as if begging us to help it.

Halsin_Following_Elf.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_Following_Elf.text: The ringleaders of these butchers still draw breath. Nobody is safe until we stop them.

Halsin_Following_Elf.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_Following_Elf.text: Hurry, please. Any delay could cost innocents' lives.

Kid_001.speaker: One
Kid_001.text: D'you think it's bad to keep throwing stones at a dead lump?
Kid_001.context: NodeContext: curious, a bit naughty. She doesn't think it's bad at all.

Worg_001.speaker: Ferr
Worg_001.text: Smells big. Big belly. Big GUTS.

Worg_002.speaker: Tale
Worg_002.text: Fur. Can't you smell the fur? Fur and meat. Lots of MEAT!

session_synopses.Parent: Goblin parent standing next to the goblin kinds throwing stones at Helia or the bear.
session_synopses.Kid_002: One of the goblin kids that is throwing rocks at Helia or the bear.
session_synopses.GroupDialogWithBear: Player finds a group of goblin kids throwing stones at a bear, spurred on by their mother. The bear is the arch druid Halsin, in bear form. He won't make this apparent to the player, even if they have Speak with Animals.
session_synopses.Halsin_Following_Elf: Halsin, arch-druid of the Emerald Grove, is  following the player inside the Goblin Camp in his elf form, trying to find and kill the goblin leadership. The player can tell him to hold his position.
session_synopses.Kid_001: One of the goblin kids that is throwing rocks at Helia or Halsin's bear
session_synopses.Worg_001: One of the worgs in the worg pens, driven mad with excitement by the presence of Halsin, a druid transofrmed into a bear.
session_synopses.Worg_002: One of the worgs in the worg pens, driven mad with excitement by the presence of Halsin, a druid transformed into a bear.
session_synopses.CombatCutscene_Bear: This is a Combat Cutscene Dialog. The bear attacks the door that flies away and potentially kill a goblin.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
node_data.text: Oi! Ain't no party in 'ere - we're doing the Absolute's work.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Annoyed, affronted - she's lost her patience with people stumbling in from the party.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
node_data.text: State yer business. Now.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Cold, deadly - the player has just passed through a party area, and this should be their first indication that the throne room is much more serious.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'm here to see the True Souls. Do you want to keep them waiting?

node_data.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
node_data.text: ...Well, I didn't say that. But you'll need to be more specific, mate. Absolute's blessed us with three.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Realises she's treading on thin ice all of a sudden. Tone is more reasonable than other branches.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
node_data.text: You 'ere to see Priestess Gut, Boss Ragzlin, or the drow?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Ragzlin = RAGS-lin

node_data.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
node_data.text: Guessin' you're after Minthara. Could be 'er blood by the looks of you.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I've got an audience with Minthara.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
node_data.text: 'Audience' is right. She's an uppity one and no mistake, but she knows 'er business.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Snorting at the drow's pretension, but acknowledging her power.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
node_data.text: She's in tellin' the warchiefs wot's wot. Next raid's gonna be a big'un, I hear.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Anticipating.

session_synopses: This goblin guard is aggressive and self-important. She's been tasked with keeping drunkards out and is taking to her small responsibility like a little tyrant, but will immediately roll over if the player convinces her of their authority.

node_data.speaker: Skrut
node_data.text: Whatcha staring at? Move along, ugly.

session_synopses: There's a floating eye moving throughout the camp. This goblin takes issue with it, he feels they are being spied on by their bosses, who don't trust them.

session_synopses.LocalRat_001: This rat is skittering around the goblin camp, feeding on whatever offal it finds. When we enter its mind we learn of a cavernous space below that it's constantly in fear of.
session_synopses.LocalRat_002: This rat is skittering around the goblin camp - we can learn of a puzzle hidden in the floor.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Bez
node_data.text: Unless you like big, bristlin' hairy legs, I wouldn't go down there, mate. Tha's the spider pit.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Terrified of the spiders she's guarding. Acts very deferential with the drow, but is honest about her fear with other races.

session_synopses: This guard is watching over a pit containing two giant spiders. She is afraid of them and says as much to the player (unless player is a drow, who venerate spiders)

node_data.speaker: Tracker Azak
node_data.text: Leave me alone - ain't got time for chatter.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Avoiding eye contact, afraidNodeContext: Avoiding eye contact, afraid - a slave speaking to a master

session_synopses: A goblin who is afraid of drow, having been a former slave

node_data.speaker: Polma
node_data.text: You. Not supposed to be here. Leave!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Slow, stupid. Identifying us, pointing on 'you'. Then figuring out we're trespassing before roaring at us to 'leave'.

session_synopses: An ogre that acts as a guard in the goblin priestess' chapel. Will warn players away if they enter the chapel area - will attack them if they escape from the priestess' dungeon.

node_data.speaker: Booyahg Shekt
node_data.text: Been boozin'? If ya need to clear yer head, priestess can help.
node_data.context: NodeContext: We've just arrived from a party so she thinks we might be drunk - friendly

node_data.speaker: Booyahg Shekt
node_data.text: She'd rather be cuttin' folks than curin 'em, but she knows her stuff.
node_data.context: NodeContext: friendly advice

session_synopses: A goblin participating in a religious ceremony.

session_synopses.Dead: Players cast a spell allowing them to speak to the corpse of the goblin priestess, a high-ranking religious figure in the goblin camp

Mindflayer_Dead.speaker: Narrator
Mindflayer_Dead.text: *The mind flayer's corpse twitches, then collapses again. It will speak no more.*

session_synopses.Mindflayer_Dead: The player casts speak with dead on the corpse of the mind flayer that tortured them at the beginning of the game.

Volo_FestivitiesArea.speaker: Volo
Volo_FestivitiesArea.text:
With fragulous crown, and with sceptre abrade,
Dror Ragzlin short work of the innkeeper made!
Volo_FestivitiesArea.context: NodeContext: singing improvised nonsense under duress, projecting his voice. 'fragulous' has a hard 'g' to sound somewhat like 'fabulous'. 'abrade' is pronounced a-braid. Dror Ragzlin is 'Drawer RAGS-lin'

Volo_FestivitiesArea.speaker: Volo
Volo_FestivitiesArea.text:
The inn burned to ash! The captives were many!
Goblinkind had reduced them to cowering filfenny!
Volo_FestivitiesArea.context: NodeContext: singing improvised nonsense under duress, projecting his voice. 'filfenny' pronounced 'filth-any'

Volo_FestivitiesArea.speaker: Volo
Volo_FestivitiesArea.text:
So raiseth your goblets, and drain them with pride!
Dror Ragzlin, the True Soul, hath led you galide!
Volo_FestivitiesArea.context: NodeContext: singing improvised nonsense under duress, projecting his voice. 'Dror Ragzlin' is the goblins' leader (pronounced 'Drawer RAGS-lin'), 'galide' is a nonsense word pronounced with a hard 'g' (Gah-lied)

Volo_FestivitiesArea.speaker: Wyll
Volo_FestivitiesArea.text: I reckon Dror Ragzlin's the gobbo in charge, the way this one's carrying on.

session_synopses.Volo_FestivitiesArea: Volo, a reknowned scholar, has been captured by goblins and is being forced to sing on a stage at their celebratory party following a raid. One goblin has the responsibility of guarding him and engages him in conversation. If the goblins are killed, he investigates the corpses, researching the cause of death.
session_synopses.Guard: Drunk, excited goblin who's guarding Volo and forcing him to sing even though Volo's no singer.

node_data.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
node_data.text: I do not have time for interruptions, sister.
node_data.context: NodeContext: dismissive

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *As she turns to you, her thoughts mingle with yours, a cold hand caressing your brain.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: the drow turns and looks at the player, studying themNodeContext: unnerved

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The chamber melts away to reveal a dark, endless nowhere. In it, you see a vision - the drow listens as a pale-eyed young woman whispers in her ear.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: mindmeld with Minthara as narrator describes vision of Minthara with Orin

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *One of those the voice spoke of. One of the Chosen. The vision fades away...*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: mindmeld with Minthara as narrator describes vision of Minthara with Orin

node_data.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
node_data.text: A True Soul in such a grotesque form? The Absolute has a place in Her heart even for darthiir.
node_data.context: NodeContext: disgusted - speaking to an elf player and has a hatred of them. 'darthiir' (dar-FEAR) is a derogatory term for an elf

node_data.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
node_data.text: Her heart is more generous than mine. Join my hunt, faerie. And obey me.
node_data.context: NodeContext: sinister - 'faerie' is a derogatory way of referring to the player's race (an elf)

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: A hunt? Who's the target?

node_data.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
node_data.text: Worshippers of a false god. Their existence is an insult to the Absolute's claim on this region.
node_data.context: NodeContext: cool, calm, sinister

node_data.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
node_data.text: The thief whimpering in our dungeon tried to flee to their sanctuary.
node_data.context: NodeContext: cold, calm

node_data.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
node_data.text: We will continue to remove parts of him until he tells us exactly where it is.
node_data.context: NodeContext: malicious glee

node_data.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
node_data.text: He's been resilient but he'll talk...
node_data.context: NodeContext: cold, with a spark of malice

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Perhaps you can misdirect her... or kill her.

node_data.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
node_data.text: Speak, True Soul. The hunt must begin soon.
node_data.context: NodeContext: cold, calm

node_data.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
node_data.text: Enough. Speak only to me while you are in my presence. The hunt must begin soon.
node_data.context: NodeContext: mild irritation, cold

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I can be very persuasive - I'll visit the prisoner.

node_data.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
node_data.text: Excellent - be sure not to kill him before he talks.
node_data.context: NodeContext: arrogant, pleased

session_synopses: The drow commander is a True Soul, sent to the goblin camp in order to instil some discipline in the goblins and lead their raids. She's already had one success - at the tavern - but the adventurers who infiltrated the goblin camp are her next targets. The Absolute believes they have something of value, and she must reclaim it. The players can tell her that the adventurers fled to the grove in which case she'll see the players as perfect candidates to help her infiltrate the place, having mistaken them for True Souls.

Torturers_Spike_MurderCustom.speaker: Torturer Spike
Torturers_Spike_MurderCustom.text: No! I still had more to do with him! Guess I'll have to give his due to you, eh?
Torturers_Spike_MurderCustom.context: NodeContext: sadistic - he couldn't exact revenge on the prisoner, so the player will have to pay instead. Starts combat.

session_synopses.Torturers_Spike_MurderCustom: Small crime dialogue with Spike if he sees you kill Liam.

node_data.speaker: Booyahg Gnat
node_data.text: Shove off. Ain't lookin' for friends.

session_synopses: Goblin absolutely enamoured with his own king and less impressed with the player.

node_data.speaker: Devout Mrak
node_data.text: You 'ere to get branded too? Priestess reckons we should be marked up before the next raid.
node_data.context: NodeContext: curious

node_data.speaker: Devout Mrak
node_data.text: Make sure whoever we're stickin' it to knows we're doin' it for the Absolute.
node_data.context: NodeContext: proud

session_synopses: Goblin is recently converted to new religion and eager to head out on a raid.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: I see tracks there - or footprints. That's worth a look.

SurvivalCheck_PAD.speaker: Player
SurvivalCheck_PAD.text: Bloodied tracks - quite small, too. A gnome found some trouble here.

session_synopses.PAD: The player spots a sign of Thulla's escape: footprints. Player wishes to take a closer look.
session_synopses.SurvivalCheck_PAD: The player identifies Thulla's tracks to be that of an escaping gnome if they pass a survival check

node_data.speaker: Hurk
node_data.text: Been a long day for all of us, so don't try nothin' funny.

session_synopses: Possible dialog during the Lake Encounter (if the player jumps on another raft when another player is in dialog)

node_data.speaker: Mossy Myconid
node_data.text: ((*the Circle lauds you. be welcome*))

session_synopses: Myconid one-liner. Speaks with hivemind/mysterious voice.

Spider02.speaker: Lur Jox
Spider02.text: You heard her. Xanta was a betrayer. We will miss her. But she was wrong.

session_synopses.Spider03: Followup with spiders after they kill their sister Xanta.
session_synopses.Spider02: Followup after the spiders have killed their sister Xanta for being disloyal.

node_data.speaker: Alchemist Argram
node_data.text: You tryin' to tip us over? Stop moving, idiot.

session_synopses: Possible dialog during the Lake Encounter (if the player jumps on another raft when another player is in dialog)

BroodingSovereign_Raft.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_Raft.text: ((*I will not cross. painful memories beyond*))

BroodingSovereign_Raft.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_Raft.text: Stay in the grotto, then. I have to cross the lake.

session_synopses.BroodingSovereign_Raft: Glut says he cannot follow you across the lake, and must remain on shore.

AD_FailedWisdomSave.text: Would that I might ease thy madness.

session_synopses.AD_BeckonPlayer: An amulet calls out to the player amid the rocks surrounded by lava in Grymforge.
session_synopses.AD_FailedWisdomSave: After resting and leaving camp, the haunted amulet curses the player with periodic fits of laughter if they use the amulet's ability  if they do not pass a wisdom save. Amulet speaks this dialogue. Shar-allied clerics and paladins get different lines: the amulet is happy to drive them mad.

Saved.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
Saved.text: My friends are trapped in Moonrise, and I'm just... sitting here.

session_synopses.Saved: Dialog for gnome worker on the other side of the ebon lake after they were saved by player. Laridda reflects on her missing friends, who are trapped in Moonrise.

node_data.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
node_data.text: You got those boots? Or something else eatin' at you?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: A few of your clanmates are plotting to kill Nere.

node_data.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
node_data.text: Let me guess - Brithvar and Kur. They've been a thorn in my arse since Nere hired us.

node_data.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
node_data.text: Ignore dumb and dumber. They'd jump down a well if they though there was gold at the bottom.

node_data.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
node_data.text: Nere can handle himself. Reason I joined - I know which way the lava flows.

session_synopses: The duergar sergeant responsible for the camp while Nere is trapped. She's yelling at the gnomes and is considerably pissed off. After realising you are a True Soul, she asks you to help free Nere from the cave-in, and you can refuse or accept. You might turn in her missing boots if you have found them You can also ask about the gnome that escaped and the scrying eye.

AD_FoundKey.speaker: Player
AD_FoundKey.text: Hmm - a steel mould. Used in forges to cast armour and weapons.

CINE_HammerStrike.text: CinematicNodeContext: As the player character watches, the forge hammer descends and crashes into the dais below with a loud clang and a flash of sparks. It then rises back into its original position.
CINE_HammerStrike.context: CinematicNodeContext: As the player character watches, the forge hammer descends and crashes into the dais below with a loud clang and a flash of sparks. It then rises back into its original position.

session_synopses.AD_FoundKey: Party stumbles upon a mold while exploring the rear area of Grymforge. If they pass the check, they understand it's used at a forge.
session_synopses.CINE_HammerStrike: A party member pulled the lever that activates the hammer strike.NOTES:- To be replaced by combat cams.- For now, we're ignoring the scenario where the lever was activated some other way than using it.

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers.text: Where's your pickaxe, gnome? Thrinn know you're over here?

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Viss
CorpseDisposers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spits on the groundNodeContext: Said like a threat.

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers.text: Thrinn don't believe in mixing work between us and you. No, I think you were trying to escape.

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers.text: What do we do with runaways, Viss?

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Viss
CorpseDisposers.context: NodeContext: Said as a threat, since htis is about ot start combat.

session_synopses.CorpseDisposers: Two grouchy duergar, one a talker and one who somewhat mimics/ repeats what his partner says, are responsible for dumping dead gnome bodies into the lake. You can convince them to let you loot the bodies.

PAD_NobleStalk.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_NobleStalk.text: Strange... I remember a tiefling boy. Purple hair... Rennald. Who is that?
PAD_NobleStalk.context: NodeContext: Unsure. Relaying a strange memory fragment that's just been restored to her. Ren-awld

session_synopses.PAD_NobleStalk: Fallback in case the memory stalk dialog does not start. Cheap version of the memory.

session_synopses.Dead: Speak with Dead dialogue with Derryth Bonecloak, a dwarven alchemist from Baldur's Gate who came to the Underdark along with her husband, Baelen, in search of a rare and valuable mushroom - the noblestalk.

Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.text: *A faint voice echoes in your mind.*
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mindmeld: Nere is calling out to player from a distance

Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.speaker: Nere
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.text: I sense you, True Soul... come to me, come to Nere... the poison spreads.
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.context: NodeContext: Voice goes in and out, as if the connection is weak

Mindmeld.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld.text: *You make out only a few faint figures and scattered debris through Nere's eyes.*

session_synopses.Mindmeld_LeavingRegion: When trying to leave Grymforge before freeing Nere, you get a mindmeld from Nere, warning that he will die if you leave. Nere is not physically present in scene - only his voice is heard.
session_synopses.Mindmeld: A mindmeld with a True Soul through a brick wall - the connection is unstable because of this, and we do not hear everything the True Soul says.
session_synopses.Dead: Speak with Dead dialogue for True Soul Nere. He may tell you about the temple he was looking for as well as what is inside it.

HiddenGnome.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome.text: Tell Laridda I'm dead. It's the best way.

session_synopses.HiddenGnome: Philomeen is ready to die for her cause. She has run from the duergar with explosives and when the player arrives, she assumes they are a true soul and would sooner blow herself up than let the player take her to Moonrise.If you reach the end of her dialogue, she'll leave once you get far enough away.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You stare into the eye. Your reflection stares back.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closely inspects the scrying eye

node_data.text: True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The longer you stare, the more uneasy you feel. There is a presence. You are seen.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closely inspects the scrying eye more intensely

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Attack the eye.

session_synopses: Player clicks on the scrying eye patrolling in Grymdark. Passing an Insight check lets you look back into the presence watching you (one of the scryers at Moonrise Towers). This dialogue uses the same template as the dialogue with the scrying eye in the goblin camp.

Guard_003.speaker: Morgya
Guard_003.text: Bloody deep roth. All the hassle of getting them up here. Now they won't work!

RotheDeadAttack.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
RotheDeadAttack.text: The hell's wrong with you? Drugnin' hoon!
RotheDeadAttack.context: NodeContext: Clan-sen: like it sounds. (Diuergar of another clan) Drugh = fuck. DROOG. (RHymes with hood, not food.)

RotheDeadAttack.speaker: Player
RotheDeadAttack.text: Don't get surly with me. Those beasts were out of control.

RotheDeadAttack.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
RotheDeadAttack.text: Shit-for-brains. All that adamantine within reach - and you done screwed me over!

Guard_001.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001.text: Let 'em clear the rubble. Then you'll get what's coming to you.

session_synopses.Guard_003: A coarse and unempathetic duergar, one of three guarding some Deep Rothe (beasts of burden currently being used to clear rubble).Different reactions if:- animals are panicking;- animals are calm;- animals are dead (doesn't matter how);
session_synopses.RotheDeadAttack: Duergar attack you after you have angered and killed the rothe.
session_synopses.Guard_001: The taskmaster is another cruel duergar. He is whipping several pack animals to clear out some rubble, but his arm is tired and asks you to step in. You might discover they want the rubble cleared because a valuable forge can be found behind it. If you convince the beasts to break through, he attacks you because he doesn't want to share the wealth.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: Seems the 'shrooms are letting in more people every day.
DwarvenAlchemist.context: NodeContext: Not friendly. She's got a real squint in her eye taking you in.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: You see a fella on his own on your way in? Dwarf. Baelen's his name.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist.text: I could look for him - for a price.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: Please. I know better than to promise coin to a stranger.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: He'll find his own way out, or he won't.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: I'll wait a little longer. What a bleedin' waste it'd be to come all the way down here for nothing.

AD_CheckpointGuard_002_Combat.speaker: Restless Myconid
AD_CheckpointGuard_002_Combat.text: ((*the disease still festers. I will cut it out*))

CheckpointGuard_001.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_001.text: *The creature's song rumbles within you, neither warm nor welcoming.*

VB_GlutDead_1P.speaker: Player
VB_GlutDead_1P.text: The usurper is dead. So much for 'Circle Glut'.

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *You are swallowed by a chorus of turbulent music. Through one creature sing many voices: the harmony of an entire collective.*

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Restless Myconid
CheckpointGuard_000.text: ((*Sovereign. they have come. they are here*))

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *The choir fades. A single melody rises above the others, brassy and commanding.*

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *You see a vision: your lifeless body, wrapped in fungal tendrils. The sovereign is threatening you.*
CheckpointGuard_000.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes eyes as if seeing the vision in their head.

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Player
CheckpointGuard_000.text: I am a traveller seeking adventure.

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *Fungal roots weave through your mind, seeking your true intent.*
CheckpointGuard_000.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes eyes as if to see the vision.

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *Then the sovereign drones a new melody, cautious but welcoming.*
CheckpointGuard_000.context: CinematicNodeContext: Overhead view, as sovereign is not in sight range.

CheckpointGuard_000.text: ((*descend to me. let us speak in flesh*))
CheckpointGuard_000.context: CinematicNodeContext: Overhead view, as sovereign is not in sight range. (Custom cameras required)

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *The persistent music coaxes you forward. The sovereign expects you.*

DeepRothe.speaker: Deep Roth
DeepRothe.text: Hope master doesn't start kicking me again.
DeepRothe.context: NodeContext: SWA line. Reproachful. A simple beast of burden senses his master has returned to a crueler demeanour.

AD_CheckpointGuard_004_Combat.speaker: Noxious Myconid
AD_CheckpointGuard_004_Combat.text: ((*you will fall. and in death, we will raise you*))

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar.text: I must complete this study. Entertain yourself elsewhere.

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*King of Kings, I am. let this place be sacred: Circle Glut takes root!*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*my spawn will rise, and sing of your might. you will be called King-Bringer!*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*take my gift of song. cry it low or loud - but cry it proud, King-Bringer! so it is certain, and so you are known!*))

ServantDuergar1.speaker: Narrator
ServantDuergar1.text: *Fungus and mould glaze the servant's face and body. Through music and vision, the sovereign reveals its origins.*

ServantDuergar1.speaker: Narrator
ServantDuergar1.text: *You see a frothing duergar, axe drawn, crazed by bloodlust, bearing down on a young myconid.*

ServantDuergar1.speaker: Narrator
ServantDuergar1.text: *The frightened myconid circle conjures mildewed vines. They encircle and transform the duergar.*

ServantDuergar1.speaker: Narrator
ServantDuergar1.text: *It now belongs to the circle. It will obey the sovereign.*

AD_CheckpointGuard_003_Combat.speaker: Mossy Myconid
AD_CheckpointGuard_003_Combat.text: ((*the sickness can't be left to fester*))

RapportSpores_Alone.speaker: Narrator
RapportSpores_Alone.text: ((*who is it. what do they want. are we safe*))

RapportSpores_Alone.speaker: Player
RapportSpores_Alone.text: Who are you? What are you?

DeadMyconid_Dead.speaker: Narrator
DeadMyconid_Dead.text: *The corpse twitches in response to the spell...*

DeadMyconid_Dead.speaker: Player
DeadMyconid_Dead.text: What was life in the circle like?

DeadMyconid_Dead.speaker: Narrator
DeadMyconid_Dead.text: *Like its living counterparts, the corpse speaks in your mind.*

DeadMyconid_Dead.speaker: Dead Myconid Sprout
DeadMyconid_Dead.text: ((*...floating, knowing, seeing, hearing. all together, never apart...*))

MushroomField_Warning.speaker: Restless Myconid
MushroomField_Warning.text: ((*after the light comes the bang. step away. step away*))

CheckpointGuard_002.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_002.text: *You are swallowed by a chorus of turbulent music. Through one creature sing many voices: the harmony of an entire collective.*

CheckpointGuard_002.speaker: Restless Myconid
CheckpointGuard_002.text: ((*Sovereign. they have come. they are here*))

CheckpointGuard_002.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_002.text: *The choir fades. A single melody rises above the others, brassy and commanding.*

CheckpointGuard_002.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_002.text: *You see a vision: your lifeless body, wrapped in fungal tendrils. The sovereign is threatening you.*
CheckpointGuard_002.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes eyes as if seeing the vision in their head.

CheckpointGuard_002.speaker: Player
CheckpointGuard_002.text: I am a traveller seeking adventure.

CheckpointGuard_002.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_002.text: *Fungal roots weave through your mind, seeking your true intent.*
CheckpointGuard_002.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes eyes as if to see the vision.

CheckpointGuard_002.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_002.text: *Then the sovereign drones a new melody, cautious but welcoming.*
CheckpointGuard_002.context: CinematicNodeContext: Overhead view, as sovereign is not in sight range.

CheckpointGuard_002.text: ((*descend to me. let us speak in flesh*))
CheckpointGuard_002.context: CinematicNodeContext: Overhead view, as sovereign is not in sight range. (Custom cameras required)

CheckpointGuard_002.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_002.text: *The persistent music coaxes you forward. The sovereign expects you.*

InjuredGnome.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome.context: NodeContext: Grief struck, angry at herself, doesn't want to deal with us. (This is in her 'healed' state)

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: You return. Have you changed your mind about the ring?

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: How do you survive? Don't you need... brains?

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: In the beginning, I had an arrangement with a lich. Excellent company, despite what one would expect.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: I required brains, he required souls. A perfect symbiosis.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: But our ambitions eventually splintered. I wished to better the world, and he preferred its rot.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: So I left his company, and thus I now feed from those who... act against the Society's goals.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: Best way to deal with that sort of hunger, I suppose.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: Perhaps the peoples of the Underdark will be less inclined to violence if they comprehend the cost, yes?

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: I'd like to learn more about the tadpole.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Narrator
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: *An almost childlike joy enters Omeluum's ichor-laced eyes.*

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: Open your mind to me, friend. Let us see what lurks within.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: Never mind. I'm done with mind flayers touching me.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: I see. I will remain here if you decide otherwise.

session_synopses.DwarvenAlchemist:
Derryth is a dwarven alchemist visiting the underdark from Baldur's Gate. She runs a shop in the city with Baelen, her business partner. They've come to the underdark in search of a very valuable mushroom - noblestalk. When the player arrived, she was tending to an injured gnome.
Derryth is a bit gruff - she's a healer, but her bedside manner leaves a lot to be desired. She's also a very shrewd businessperson. She's in the underdark to get rich first and foremost.
She treats her business partner (Baelen) like he's an idiot, and pretends not to care about him, but in reality he is the most important person to her in the world.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_002_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_001: Individual myconid responds with one-liner after you have gained access to the myconid circle. Hallucinogenic delivery.
session_synopses.VB_GlutDead_1P: Players refuse to kill Sovereign Spawn on Sovereign Glut's behalf. Glut has attacked the players and is now dead. The party comments afterwards.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_000: You come upon the myconid guards. They warn the sovereign of your presence telepathically, and it begins to speak to you. This should be creepy, hallucinatory.
session_synopses.DeepRothe: A Deep Rothe that belongs to Derryth and Baelen Bonecloak. A beast of burden with a simple Speak with Animals dialogue. There's some reactivity depending on whether Baelen has returned to the bonecloak camp or not, and if Baelen recovered his senses by eating the noblestalk mushroom. The animal's observations reinforce that Baelen has been more amiable and gentle since his mind began to slip, and his recovery is not seen as a good thing by all.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_004_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar: The player meets Blurg, a hobgoblin (deep orc) member of the Society of Brilliance, a group of intelligent, neutral monsters working to improve the Underdark. He talks about his research and, if the tadpole is mentioned, brings his mind flayer friend Omeluum to talk to the player. The player can either agree to the mind flayer's help or attack.
session_synopses.AD_Myconid_004_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.AD_Myconid_003_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.ServantHookHorror_01: You interact with a hook horror servant belonging to the myconids.
session_synopses.BroodingSovereign:
A sovereign myconid we call the brooding sovereign has been displaced to this myconid circle, after the duergar attackes his home. He would like to join you as you cleanse the area of duergar as a means of getting revenge - supposedly.

 The top block: The borroding myconid is with the other myconids. You can recruit it.

The middle block: You have killed the lone duergar. the myconid now wants you to kill all the duergars.

 Next block: you have killed all the duergars; now it wants you to kill the sovereign
. 
Final block: you have killed the sovereign and it rewards you. 

This myconid does not speak with the same hive mind voice of the others. He should sound creepy, like FART in Rick and Morty, with a SLIGHT undercurrent of menace.

 As the quest moves on, he gets more and more creepy and angry,
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_004: Individual myconid responds with one-liner after you have gained access to the myconid circle. Hallucinogenic delivery.
session_synopses.ServantDuergar1: Player tries speaking with an enthralled duergar. Duergar players get an option to go hostile afterwards.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_003_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.RapportSpores_Alone:
Non has met: Triggers if the player is alone when first hearing the myconid circle's collective voice.

Hasmet: Occurs second time, regardless of how mnay players are in party. Player hears a strange voice, and has a reaction to it. Second time: Tries to respond to it.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_003: Individual myconid responds with one-liner after you have gained access to the myconid circle. Hallucinogenic delivery.
session_synopses.DeadMyconid_Dead: Speak with dead on Myconid sprout. Sprouts are children. This one should sound young. It describes being killed by grey dwarves (duergar). Should not sound like hivemind.
session_synopses.MushroomField_Warning: Myconid warns you that mushrooms explode if you get too close.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_002: You come upon the myconid guards. They warn the sovereign of your presence teleapthically, and it begins to speak to you. This should be creepy, hallucinatory.
session_synopses.InjuredGnome: STATE NODES - first half of dialogue, Thulla is in EXTREME pain, speaking in short, terse sentences.Second half - she's weary but recovering.Thulla is a member of the Ironhand Gnomes, a group of militant gnomish artificers who came to the Underdark to find a forbidden - and extremely secret - formula for runepowder: an explosive of awesome power.Thulla is a true believer in the cause - when her group was captured by duergar, she escaped but picked up a poisoned wound on the way. She's slowly succumbing to poison - initially vague and feverish. If we heal her, she's exhausted but straight back on task, giving us the job of freeing her people.
session_synopses.SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer: Omeluum is a friendly, neutral mind flayer and member of the Society of Brilliance, dedicated to improving life in the Underdark. If attacked, it will teleport away rather than engaging in combat.

MemoryCrystal.speaker: Narrator
MemoryCrystal.context: CinematicNodeContext: CU on the stone sitting in player's hand. If possible, with a dull glow at the centre.

MemoryCrystal.speaker: Narrator
MemoryCrystal.text: *You heard its like described before - a memory shard, used to store brief mental impressions from the user's mind.*

session_synopses.CINE_SpectatorReveal: This is a Combat Cutscene Dialog. A spectator rises from a chasm.
session_synopses.MemoryCrystal: This dialogue is for an artefact called a Memory Shard, a crystal taken from the Petrified Drow (Dhourn).The crystal can store memories - in this case, Dhourn's knowledge of the location of the Adamantine forge. The player either approaches knowing what it is, or can discover its function based on a check.

session_synopses.AD_Combat_AnimatingSpores_02: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid sovereign is using Animating Spores spell.
session_synopses.AD_Combat_AnimatingSpores_03: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid sovereign is using Animating Spores spell.

Saved.speaker: Skickpit
Saved.text: Shit. Still can't believe you got me out of there. Sorry I told you to piss off.

session_synopses.Saved: Foul-mouthed elevator gnome has been saved and is now in the myconid circle.

AD_CombatTurn.speaker: Gekh Coal
AD_CombatTurn.text: I am pain, I am torment, I am death.

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: Too loud, sun-scum. Heard you stumbling. Can hear you blinking.
node_data.context: NodeContext: A low growl

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: Noise gets you eaten down here. Reckon I'll hush you, before something hungry comes along.
node_data.context: NodeContext: A grim statement of fact. He intends to kill you rather than let you bumble around.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *His gnarled fist grips an axe.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Grips his weapon threateningly. Absolute brand doesn't need to have attention drawn to it.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *His fist grips an axe. On his gnarled, grey skin, you see the Absolute's brand.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Grips his weapon threateningly. Absolute brand visible if possible (or just leave it to the narrator)

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Turn to leave.

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: You're a liability, hook-bait. I'll decide how many steps and breaths you've got left.
node_data.context: NodeContext: 'One more step, and you're dead'. Hook-bait refers to a hook horrors - a species of predatory beast in the underdark, which might be attracted by the player's noise.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *His fist grips an axe. On his gnarled, grey skin, you see the Absolute's brand.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Grips his weapon threateningly. Absolute brand visible if possible (or just leave it to the narrator)

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Turn to leave.

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: You're a liability, hook-bait. I'll decide how many steps and breaths you've got left.
node_data.context: NodeContext: 'One more step, and you're dead'. Hook-bait refers to a hook horrors - a species of predatory beast in the underdark, which might be attracted by the player's noise.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *His fist grips an axe. On his gnarled, grey skin, you see the Absolute's brand.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Grips his weapon threateningly. Absolute brand visible if possible (or just leave it to the narrator)

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I can be discreet. No need for bloodshed.
True

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: Fine. I'll let you live.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Situation defuses a little.

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: But spoil my hunt, and you're dead.
node_data.context: NodeContext: A pointed finger. He isn't kidding.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Turn to leave.

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: Didn't say you could leave, did I? Another step and you'll get a kiss off my axe.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: What do you want?

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: Shut up and listen.

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: I'm on a hunt. Got a runaway slave to kill. Need to fetch back the boots she stole from Sergeant Thrinn.

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: Got to kill the slave and fetch back the leather, or the bosses in Moonrise'll have Thrinn's hide.
node_data.context: NodeContext: It's his job. He has no moral qualms about this.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'm not helping a slave-catcher.

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: A bleeding heart, are you? Reckon I'll just roast an' eat it.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Brutal and matter-of-fact. Combat ensures immediately afterwards

Squad_Sniper.speaker: Holvik
Squad_Sniper.text: If you need attention, see Gekh.

Squad_Caster_AD_CombatTurn.speaker: Lurgan
Squad_Caster_AD_CombatTurn.text: Die, so your carcass can rise!

Squad_Wizard.speaker: Lurgan
Squad_Wizard.text: You'll want to speak to Gekh. He's in charge.
Squad_Wizard.context: NodeContext: Respectful towards a drow player.

Squad_Ranged_AD_CombatTurn.speaker: Holvik
Squad_Ranged_AD_CombatTurn.text: I will split your corpse and roast the pieces!

session_synopses: A duergar scout sent by his superior to track down an escaped deep gnome slave and retrieve the valuable Boots of Speed that she stole from the scout's superior. His progress has been hampered as the escapee his hiding amongst some myconids - fungal creatures with telepathic powers. He confronts the player, who may convince him they aren't a threat. They may be able to assist him agains the runaway and myconids, or could betray him, In general, Gekh is a gruff, vicious type. If the player convinces him that they're his superior (a true soul, for instance) he'll show a little more deference.
session_synopses.Squad_Sniper: A duergar, part of the cult of the Absolute. He and his brethren are part of a squad sent to track down an escaped deep gnome prisoner from their camp in the Underdark.
